story:
In 2000 I started the company Girlchef (you can learn more about me and that business at my website: www.clairemenck.com) .  The most recent extension of that business is TOGO MKE, food service provider located in Milwaukee, Wisconsin. TOGO MKE offers the following services to individuals and corporations:

·         Weekly prepared meals ordered through our website: www.togomke.com

·         Catering

·         Grab N Go items for businesses who need healthy food options

TOGO MKE focuses on healthy food preparation using local ingredients and producers whenever possible.  The business also serves as an online outlet for products produced by small Milwaukee artisans (www.order.girlchef.com). A new menu is posted every Friday.  People order by Wednesday for delivery or pick up of the meals the following Monday. 

The idea for this business has evolved from my work in food and social justice.  I believe that food access is an essential component for a healthy community.  Milwaukee is the most segregated city in the United States. That plays out in high crime and poverty rates in the city, limiting opportunities for economic, educational and personal development of large swatches of our urban landscape.  I envision TOGO MKE as part of the response to those issues by helping to create economic opportunities on several levels, including:

1.  Nourishing people with locally grown and prepared foods through our meal service.

2.  Creating economic opportunities by purchasing our ingredients from local urban producers, such as Alice’s Garden (www.alicesgarden.com ).

3.  Opening economic opportunities for local producers by selling their products online to new customers that would otherwise not have access to those products.

4.  Training individuals who would otherwise not have access to that education for careers in food service and agriculture, increasing their potential earning capacity.


TOGO MKE has had an amazingly positive response from the customers we have, and the corporate clients we have worked with to develop our corporate programs.  The business has seen a doubling of revenue every month since we began the service in January 2019.  I literally could be producing 24 hours a day, seven days a week.  However, I have limited access to the industrial kitchen I rent, and I require several key pieces of equipment.  I have had to turn away several large potential clients because of these limitations, and my growth is stalled.  I am asking for capital for the following three things:

1.  Rent/property renovations

2.  Operational costs [Hiring & training staff, Inventory, General operating needs]

3.  Equipment and other capital investments

Specifically, I would like to purchase 10 refrigeration units that will be used as drop off points for our meal service in and around Milwaukee.  Each unit has the potential to generate $2,000 in revenue when full.  We would like to fill each unit twice a week ($4,000 per unit per week).  For us to be able to meet the capacity for that volume we need to rent a commercial space that with unlimited access.  A portion of this capital will be used to secure a lease on our own kitchen, and make necessary upgrades.

It is hard for me to put into words how much your support means, because I'm not sure I know words strong enough to represent that feeling of gratitude.  My work in food and social justice are cut of the same cloth, I see access to healthy food and sustainable communities bound together as part of a strong society.  It is my life goal to create more equity in the food system, both in access to food, and promoting those not traditionally represented there.  For me your support means creating a self-sustaining business and developing my legacy.  For the people I work with it means opening new avenues to health and growth, both financial and personal.  I want to thank you in advance for your support!

story:
Greetings Friends,

Radhey Radhey!

My name is Sudevi Samanich and I joined the team at Radha's Kitchen a few months ago.  I've known the founder, Radha Dainton for many years and when I came back to Gainesville this time I was so inspired by how far she has taken her lovely operation.  She's been a chef for 15 years, doing catering jobs for weddings, cooking for the lunch program at her kid's school and for summer bus tours and for the last 3 years being a regular feature at the Gainesville Wednesday Market,   Radha's Kitchen Pop-up has also traveled to Canada, Costa Rica, Puerto Rico, Panama, Ocala and Asheville, NC and been a part of Vege Fests and Envision Music Festival.

My mission is to help expand distribution giving more Gainesvillagers the chance to enjoy this wonderful vegan blessed food.  I have been in the food business for the past 12 years and it's exciting to join forces with such a talented chef and beacon of love in the community that is Radha. 

This campaign has come about because Sara of Abuela's Latin Cuisine has offered Radha's Kitchen a new cafe that she is building for us next to her current very successful location.   Sara started hosting Radha's Kitchen in her cafe for Taco Tuesdays earlier this year.  Her reason for doing this is because she wants her clientele made up of many Latino families and other locals to know about vegan options.  She has been an important supporter for Radha's Kitchen the last few months and we are very grateful for this opportunity to have not only this location but her mentorship.  She has been a restauranteur for 13 years now and has a wealth of experience and excellent track record in the industry.  

Our target move in date is July 20 and we have some goals to reach between now and then.   While construction is taking place at Abuela's we are rolling out new options for lovers of Radha's Kitchen vegan and vegetarian meals.  In this campaign you will be able to purchase a yearly membership that will entitle you to exclusive discounts, invitation to member only events, Radha's Kitchen swag, as well as access to special offers that will be announced in a private fb/whatsapp group for members only.  

 

What We Need & What You Get

This fundraiser is a membership drive and presale campaign

  • We need 5k for move-in down payment and another 10k for licensing, equipment, rent, merchandise, website and associated admin fees.  All other costs have been covered by Abuela's.  
  • You will now be able to purchase meal kits, personal chef style lunches deliverable starting In June through our popups and prepay for hot lunches deliverable starting as soon as we open.  
  • As the funds come in they will be disbursed and we will go as far as we can with your support.  

 

The Impact

In addition to giving Radha's Kitchen a home, we are creating a business model that allows us to pay it forward.  

  • In a effort to give other vegan/vegetarian kitchen startups the advantage of shortcuts without compromising on quality we will share our kitchen with a select few companies who match our mission.  
  • Abuela's supports Radha's Kitchen to support more small cooking businesses in the area.

 

Risks & Challenges

We must raise this money before the move in date to continue as planned.  

  • In addition to this crowd funding campaign on Indiegogo, we'll also be hosting a fundraiser dinner and will have our website up with more ways you can support us in the next couple of weeks.
  • We are working hard to bring all of Gainesville this amazing vegan food and are counting on your support in achieving this goal.  

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Everyone has something to bring to the table and it's not just cash that counts.  

  • You can share this campaign on your social media and tell your friends about it using the tools below. 
  • You can also volunteer your time - dishwashing and help with transportation are the most needed tasks at this time.  
  • Photographers, videographers, social media influencers, artists, online marketers lend us your services, we need them. 
  • Exchange services and goods.  Make an offer and it might really work for us.  We love that.   

We thank you for your time and consideration and look forward to seeing you and perhaps collaborating with you in some way.

story:
[DK - English below] Destillering: En ny fremtid for gamle danske æblesorter
Vi vil bringe de gamle danske æblesorter tilbage. Dem som HC Andersen sad i skyggen under og deklarerede sin kærlighed til. Lige nu er de ved at uddø, fordi deres holdbarhed som økologiske æbler, ikke lever op til kædesupermarkedernes behov. Vi vil bruge æblerne til destillation - og bringe deres fulde smags- og aromapotentiale frem i helt nye brandy typer, der kun er baseret på de danske æbler.

Vores æblelund får mere end tyve gamle æblesorter, som vi har fundet med hjælp fra historikere, lokalbefolkningen og den sydsjællandsæbledronning, Kirsten Rohde.  De i alt 4500 træer plantes på Oremandsgaard Gods, der allerede i 1967 var økologiske - og dermed Danmarks pionere på feltet. 

[DK] Sådan støtter du os:
For at vi kan indfri potentialet i de gamle danske æblesorter, har vi brug for din hjælp. Enten kan du forudbestille en flaske gin, æblebrandy eller sponserer et træ. Alternativt kan du melde dig som æbleleverandør (Apples for applebrandy), hvor for for 75 kr kan bytte overskuds- og nedfaldsæbler til en flaske æblebrandy. Vores målsætning er at kunne lave en æblebrandy baseret på overskudsæbler fra en række af områdets byer. 

[DK] Holdet bag: Landmænd og Laboratorieforskere
Projektet her er et partnerskab mellem Oremandsgaard  og Radius Distillery, der hver især har en forhistorie med æbler.

Mens Oremandsgaard har produceret højkvalitet michelinmost fra deres gamle æblelund- har Master Distiller teamet hos Radius udviklet prisvindende og anmelderroste æblegins. Efter vi sammen destillerede de første gamle æblesorter fra Oremandsgaard, blev vi så begejestede for resultatet, at vi besluttede os for at satse fuldt ud på Danmarks æbleskattekammer.

[DK] Næste skridt: Et Økologisk Partnerskab
I August måned flytter Radius Distillery på Oremandsgaard Gods. I samme forbindelse bliver produktionen 100% økologisk og 90% af vores råvarer vil komme fra en radius af 10 km - fra godsets jorde og skove.  Vi håber derfor, at I vil være med til at støtte op om projektet - og melde jeres ankomst til vores åbningsfest. 
 

[ENG] The Solution: Bringing back the Danish Apple Heritage
We are on a mission but we need your support! We aim to bring back the oldest and most characteristic Danish Apple sorts, and save the fantastic Scandinavian produce heritage for us and for coming generations. Just like our ancestors did for us.

We have a plan to plant more than 20 different sorts of the old Danish Apple trees, which we have found with the help of historians, locals and apple experts. We will plant more than 4.500 new apple trees, shaping an entire new apple orchard at Oremandsgaard - the Estate in Denmark that has one of the longest organic traditions, dating back to 1967 when organic was not even a word anybody would recognize.

We are so serious about this endeavor that we are moving our Distillery, now based near Copenhagen, to Oremandsgaard in Præstø. All in order to plant, produce and harvest our own ingredients for the wholesome spirits we are already known for.

In a way, our job is easy. In this part of Denmark, the Biosphere is truly unique, so much so that UNESCO named the neighboring areas "Biosphere Møn" recognizing it as World-class nature we should highly protect. Here the clay is rich and the coastal climate ensures plentiful flavors to be distilled from the produce, and in particular, from the apples that have grown here for hundreds of generations.


The Challenge: Commercial demands
The oldest Danish Applesorts are disappearing. These are the ones that gave shade to our parents and grandparents. They also gave them amazing apples which for centuries have been referred to as “amongst of the World’s best and most flavorful.”

Unfortunately, in our fast-paced world, these amazing apples are not “commercial enough.” They go bad too fast for store chains to take them in, resulting in an abandonation of the old Danish apple varieties and their replacement by more commercially-viable apples. We can’t let this happen!
 

The Team: Farmers & Pharmacists 



We are Farmers and Pharmacists - representing 50 years of Organic tradition and 40 years of experience in Pharmaceutical R&D. Collectively we have expertize ranging from cultivation of the Earth to the Science of distillation. 

We started our Distillery in 2016, focusing on gin. So far, there´s 10 gins out there and many more in the making in our Lab. We fell in love with Apples, some time along with the development of new gins. So much so, that most of our recent gins (and the best-reviewed ones too) all have apples. 

We work with a simple philosophy, implied in our name, Radius: we source our botanicals locally. Moving our Distillery 100km from Copenhagen to Oremandsgaard will result in a paradigm shift in our production, as more than 90% of our raw materials will now come from the Estate fields.

Radius Distillery will merge to become Radius Estate Distillery, and we can realize a production radius for all of our Spirits of under 10km. 

 

Our impact: Nature preservation and a new range of spirits 

By replacing field crops with Apple trees we will bind a lot of C02 during the lifetime of the Orchard. And though we tap into nature’s reserves by cultivating the soil under the Apple trees, we seek a minimal impact by creating lakes in the orchard so insect and bird life can thrive. A balanced fauna is the best way to prevent agricultural vermin and thereby securing the growth of the Apple Orchard - and our continued development of new Apple spirits from the Estate fields. 

We really hope you will help us realize the enormous distillation potential of these amazing old apple sorts, preserving a piece of Danish history while crafting a spirit worthy of our heritage.

We invite you to become a part of our Distillery, by joining our community where you are a part of the many tastings, discussions, dinners at the old Estate and walks under the shade of the Apple trees. 

Hop in!

Warmest,

Kristian, Henrik, Flemming, August & Louise

 

What people say about us and our journey so far: 

"One of this year's best gins" Michael Sperling, Gin critic & connoisseur 

"Spirits of the highest quality" , Henrik Pedersen, Babette (Danish Restaurant of the year 2017)

"Beautifully made", Justin Williams, The Interval, San Francisco

"Smooth and highly addictive gin of the highest quality", Liva Haaland, Co-Founder of Østergro Urban Farm & Restaurant

"A gin that makes Denmark a better place to live", Gin-critics Hans Henrik & Henrik Holm Nielsen Aka. Gintossen 

"Radius Distillery is all about taste, aroma, and quality", Tim Vladimir, TV Chef

 

The Apples we are bringing back in the Orchard: 

Many apples will be planted in the coming years in the Orchard. In 2019 we and you, are giving these apples new life: 

Alfred Hage - the apple named after the first owner of Oremandsgaard Estate. The great grandfather of the current owner. 
Nysø - Long thought to have died out, we believe to have found the last surviving specimen of the apple most likely enjoyed by H.C Andersen when visiting 
Skovfoged - An apple originating from Vordingborg and named after the forest rangers who took a special liking for them. 
Lundbytorp - A crisp and fantastically flavourful apple coming from the hamlet, Lundby. 
Hans Wassard - An apple named after the owner of the nearby Estate Marienlyst. 
Runddelens æble - The apple of the round-about, found logically next to the roundabout in Bårse. An old family apple with a most original character. 
Petersgaard Gråsteneren  - A full flavored apple belonging to the estate of Petersgaard. 
Fredsskov - A wonderful apple from beautiful gardens at The Estate of Stenbygaard. Tendered by gartners for a generation - loved by neighbors. 
Spejlsby Pigeon  - The best apple on Møen according to the residents of Spejlsby. 
Borrekærne - The best apple on Møen according to the residents of Borre. 
Gadeskov - A family apple from Køng. A big local favorite!
Dronning Louise - Once an apple that was famed all over Denmark, named after Queen Louise
Høvdinggaard Gråsteren - This apple originates from the Estate of Høvdingsgaard. 
Brøndæblet - Apple of the well. Enjoyed by locals from Præstø to Kalvehave. 
Vaaelse sukkertop - The sugar top of Vaaelse. Sweet and wonderful.
Tagesminde - The sourest apple in the whole of the north.

Tendered by gartners for a generation - loved by neighbors. Spejlsby Pigeon  - The best apple on Møen according to the residents of Spejlsby. Borrekærne - The best apple on Møen according to the residents of Borre. Gadeskov - A family apple from Køng. A big local favorite!Dronning Louise - Once an apple that was famed all over Denmark, named after Queen LouiseHøvdinggaard Gråsteren - This apple originates from the Estate of Høvdingsgaard. Brøndæblet - Apple of the well. Enjoyed by locals from Præstø to Kalvehave. Vaaelse sukkertop - The sugar top of Vaaelse. Sweet and wonderful.Tagesminde - The sourest apple in the whole of the north.

story:
Short Summary

Greetings, my name is Thomas Decker and I have a strong passion for finding solutions to your everyday needs and problems. At AyoDeks, we identify and rectify.   

The hospitality sector is a booming industry. Rapidly evolving and attracting people from all walks of life, the demand for efficient and precise customer service has never been so great. How often have you waited long periods of time for your drinks to be served at your table, but when they arrive it is the wrong order or they are accidentally spilt on your beautiful outfit due to inadequate handling capacity? Well, that Achilles heel has finally been put to rest with my new revolutionary, contemporary solution that will elevate your services to the next level.

I have developed the ultimate drinks carrier that can be used by restaurants, bars, clubs, hotels, cruise ships, and airlines to improve the speed and efficiency of table services globally. The AyoDeks drinks carrier can serve multiple tables and private meetings in a single journey whilst minimising the number of spills and breakages due to time constraints. It has three shelves and can be used as a single, double, or triple-deck carrier, with slots and rubber inserts provided for each drink vessel. The drinks carrier provides a safer way of organising, managing, and transporting glassware of different shapes and sizes than conventional trays.

I have invested a large amount of time and money into my invention and I am now at a stage where additional financial help and support are needed to further progress my idea. My product can be used in a variety of venues within the hospitality and commercial industry. It has the potential to yield a large number of sales worldwide. I am confident and believe that my product will rapidly spread resulting in a high profit margin and turnover for any investor. Your support will help me take my invention to the next level and make it a worldwide success.

A full product range and details will be able to be viewed on my company website www.AyoDeks.co.uk which is launching soon.

 

What We Need & What You Get

I am looking to secure funding of £100,000.

  • Most of this money will go towards tooling (£34,520.80 with all parts, and £22,892.10 without the counter).
  • The funds will also go towards manufacturing. It currently costs £55.27 to make one complete unit, but I am in the process of acquiring additional manufacturing quotes to reduce this cost. It is highly anticipated that a large volume of orders will help to bring the cost down.
  • The remainder of the money will be used for advertising, website maintenance, postage, and packaging.

 

My drinks carrier is unique and offers many advantages over conventional trays. The slots and rubber grips ensure that drinks are carried safely and effortlessly from the bar to the table, minimising spillages during transit. A variety of shelves have been developed which have different sized slots and variations to hold glasses and bottles. The option for businesses to request different design combinations and slot sizes is also available for personalisation.

There are no limits in which the AyoDeks drinks carrier can be further advanced for future developments and demand. This version is the primary design of the drinks carrier with multiple ideas already formulated to evolve its current state. Customer ratings and feedback will also provide valuable data as to what colour/design preference is required which can be worked on to fulfil their needs and expectations.

In the event that my target of £100,000 is not met, all the funds raised will then go towards the tooling costs. This is the most expensive stage which is preventing me from starting manufacturing.

 

The Impact

I would like to thank everyone that is reading this campaign with the prospects of contributing to this journey. Your contribution and support will be pivotal in the drive towards getting my product onto the consumer market. You will be giving me the opportunity to fulfil my dream of manufacturing my drinks carrier and helping to become the number one drinks tray in the world.

Your contribution and support will also open the gates for the rest of my ideas that are waiting to be developed. By helping me, you are giving fellow inventors like myself the chance to showcase their ideas to the rest of the world. Ideas that are never seen and locked away due to financial constraints and not knowing the right path to take to bring their ideas to life. Once my product is fully developed, I aim to help other inventors make a start towards their goal. With your help now, you will be helping many generations of inventors to come. 

My drinks carrier is just the start of many other exciting ideas currently in the pipeline to be brought forward to the world. It is a simple solution to a problem we have endured for centuries. Conventional trays pose risks to the user and result in breakages, spills, wasted drinks, and embarrassment. Many nights have been ruined by drinks being spilled on a customer. There are lots of people that would like to work in restaurants, bars, and other hospitality venues but have struggled to manage conventional trays. Some have tried and lost their jobs because they were unable to support conventional trays correctly. Many have had accidents and been told not to return.

With the AyoDeks drinks carrier, those that are put off by the idea of working in hospitality because of spilling drinks need not worry about this again. My drinks carrier will give users peace of mind and ensure that service runs smoothly. It gives waiting staff the opportunity to work safely and without fear of their pay being deducted or losing their job by messing up someone’s day. For companies, this will mean less money is spent on replacing drinks and glasses, and importantly, less money will be spent on refunding and reimbursing customers.

My drinks carrier will minimise breakages, spills, and avoid embarrassment. It will help to reduce the workload for waiting staff as they can serve multiple tables in one journey. This will ensure an efficient and elegant service for customers. Many trays are being used in bars and restaurants, but none offer the benefits that my drinks carrier does. I believe that there will be high demand for my drinks carrier and that I will be able to yield greater sales than my competitors. It is time for venues to serve drinks in style.

This is a vivid dream that has been materialising gradually over the last two years. I have spent a large amount of my own money on this project with a strong passion and faith in its success. The high cost of tooling is making it almost impossible to start up without additional help. Without financial assistance, it will take several years to raise the required capital to go into production. There is also the risk of my design being plagiarised as I have already started exposure of the tray on the internet and social media.

I am a hard-working former Warrant Officer Class 2 of the British Army after serving for 16 years. Getting to the rank I did in the army comes with hard work and determination. I can guarantee you that I will work to the best of my ability to ensure my invention is a success. Your investment will not go to waste.

 

Risks & Challenges

Risk 1: Covid-19.

Risk 2: Restaurants not willing to invest due to the unknown of another worldwide lockdown/pandemic.

Risk 3: Restaurants, bars, and hotels not opening again for the foreseeable future. 

 

Risk 1: Covid-19 has slowed everything down globally in some areas, it has put life on hold for many businesses and entrepreneurs. The best way to get around this is to get in touch with companies online or through Zoom meetings to pitch my product to them. With my pride, passion, and belief in the outcome of this product, I will be able to show companies what the AyoDeks drinks carrier can do for them. The economy is taking a hit at the moment but once we overcome this pandemic, we will be able to move forward positively and with a clear focus, the hospitality industry will be able to return to normal.

Covid-19 has changed the way we live dramatically. Greater care is taken to prevent contamination and the spread of the virus. The AyoDeks drinks carrier reduces the risk of contamination by separating the glasses into individual slots which can be picked out of the tray by each respective customer. Businesses will be looking for solutions to reduce crowds gathering at the bar area. My drinks carrier allows multiple tables to be served in one journey which will cut down on crowds gathering as they wait for drinks. The numbering system will allow the user to navigate between tables and serve multiple tables with ease. Any orders placed on an app can be prepared at the bar and placed into the drinks carrier. The drinks carrier can be filled for multiple tables and picked up by the user to be delivered in one journey.

Risk 2: All dining facilities will reopen in the long run. The global pandemic has meant that venues have reopened to varying degrees throughout the past year. For example, the Eat Out to Help Out scheme saw a real influx of customers and venues were able to open during this time. The subsequent lockdowns have meant closures but, in the future, the economy will pick up and all venues will be able to open again.

Risk 3: It is hoped that in time Covid-19 will no longer be present. Sales will initially be slow, but the demand will increase once the pandemic has been resolved. With this in mind, there will be a flood of customers going back to their favourite restaurants, bars and other venues. This will help to raise the demand for my drinks carrier with what it provides for the user and venues.

Countries like Australia and New Zealand have been able to defeat Covid-19 and therefore other leading countries will be also be able to achieve the same outcome. With this in mind, gradually, we will be able to provide my product to every country that defeats the pandemic.  

We will be able to sell the product online until shops reopen for those that like to shop in the high street to have a feel of what they are buying. 

Transportation costs may rise yes, but striking a good deal with the current delivery firm is possible to sustain my business.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

As this is my first attempt to start a company and produce a product for the global market, I am more than happy to be contacted with advice, hints and tips of ways I could go about achieving my goal. I am open to those that have links to the right companies that can help in manufacturing and other ways to have my product get in the market.

 

Contact details

  1. info@AyoDeks.co.uk
  2. WhatsApp 07919 048119

All help and links shared with someone else are a step closer to achieving my goal. Please share this with everyone you can. They might not be the one able to help me but they may be able to forward this campaign to the right person who will be able to make this happen.

Please use the Indiegogo share tools or copy and paste whatever you can to share this wherever you can please. Thank you very much for taking the time to read through this pitch. 

Regards,

Thomas Decker

Founder and Director of AyoDeks Ltd

story:
Forest Hill Tea is launching an Indiegogo campaign in cooperation with Huckleberry Days, to raise 75 000 DKK to reach 3 goals:   

 

  1. Transmit & share our knowledge with the local community so they can work with us for a fair wage. 
  2. Develop our production facilities to meet the international demand without changing the our way of working.
  3. Finance the organic labels necessary to access the Western market and properly value our teas.

 

Our story:

Not only today, but also centuries ago, tea was still the most popular beverage in the world.

About 130 years ago, a group of Scottish plantation owners, abandoned their lands, to sail back home. 

Amongst the estates they left behind, was a traditional tea-bush plantation, that in time grew into a wild forest of tea trees; some of them up to 15 meters tall. 

Wild Tea tree

To many people, this abandoned land seemed utterly useless, with low farming potential, high deforesting costs and less value than other and more maintained areas in Sri Lanka. To any conventional farmer in the tea industry, climbing up to 15 meters to pluck the leaves of the tree, seemed both too difficult and costly.  

Nevertheless, we saw the hidden potential of the forest in 2018 and began developing a so far unseen project. We soon realized, that what we had actually acquired the first and only tea forest in the world. 

Finding and plucking tea in the forest

We learned, that brewing a cup of the leaves from a tree, very much differs from the taste of the mass-produced, commercial tea bushes we find in the supermarkets today.  

The taste is stronger and more flavorful. The colors evolve as the minerals travel further from the earth to the leaves. Combined with careful, handcrafted processing methods, this brings us a tea with as many nuances and mysterious facets as you can find in the finest bottle of French wine. 

Our teas from the jungle

Along with the careful methods of processing, environmental care is also amongst our top priorities. Besides not using any chemicals additives in our processing while also taking great care of the tea forest and the wildlife within it, we also saw the opportunity of simply getting rid of the classic, single use teabag, that both pollutes our planet and the taste. 

The tea leaves from a tree are simply so big, that you can roll them up, just like a cigar and put them directly in the hot water in your cup. 

This was the beginning of the worlds first natural teabag - the Tea Rod.

 

From single use tea bags:A

A century of tea bags

 

To the Tea Rod (a naked tea bag): 

 

The Tea Rod by Forest Hill Tea

The Tea Rod elegantly unfolds when dipped into hot water

 

Why 75 000 DKK ? 

 

14 000 DKK  ( = 2 300 USD)

With these unique products on hand, we now wish to boost our project by teaching and assisting the local community in our ways of processing the tea, while giving them a fair and sustainable wage, allowing them to have the time to learn.  We produce specialty teas and the wages for the farmers are much higher than for conventional tea. 

 

16 000 DKK  (= 2 600 USD)

We also wish and need to develop our production facilities inside our micro factory, in order to meet the demand of volume on an international market, while still living up to our initial standards. 

Our current processing facilities

 

42 000 DKK  (= 6 900 USD)

Last, but not least, we aim to obtain the necessary, but highly priced, organic certifications to access the western market, proving the high standard and quality of our Wild Teas. Selected organism deliver those certification and the procedure is costly for Sri Lankan farmers but mandatory to export to the Western market. 

Few of the Necessary labels for the Western Market

story:
As I traveled the world, most of my strongest human connections happened as local people shared with me a bottle of their most popular, local spirits. MESH & Bone was born to share both of these things with the world. 

Your financial contribution will help us get an old 1987 Fleetwood Bounder RV running safely again, so we can get to more markets faster. Once we get it up and running, we will be getting feedback from our fans about where to go next.

We need to fix problems like steering and belts, remaining repairs on the A/C (it gets hot in there!), and turn signals (for obvious reasons).

We can't share a human story and celebrate our common humanity with a billboard. This campaign asks you to be part of our journey by helping us get a vehicle that we can use take our message and these products we've curated from around the world to more of you across the country.

Along the way, we plan to share not only our hidden treasures but also promote bringing people together to MESH and celebrate local cultures, artists and creatives of all types. If you'd like to be involved in any way, please feel free to contact me directly at scott@meshandbone.com or on my cell at 312-898-0951.

MORE ON WHO WE ARE

We launched MESH & Bone to the market in August 2016, and bootstrapped the company for 3-years. We've done no advertising, no social media, no merchandise. Until this year, we didn't even have a traditional website. 

Our products are currently sold in IL, WI, TX  and NYC. Simply by sharing our message to people in stores and letting them taste our products, demand for our products has grown.  

We are now planning to expand our business nationally, and we want to ensure we can bring our message and these amazing products to market in a way that is more personal and enables us to hear from people, like you, around the country.

story:
We Have a Dream

To Bake the World a Batter Place!

We've reached a point in our business where it's time to take a leap. In order to move forward we need our own space to meet the growing needs of our clients. A place we can bake, cater and deliver for the needs of our customers. Our big dream doesn't stop there, as we want to share our kitchen with other food entrepreneurs! We know how difficult it can be and love to #supportlocal!

 

Who Are We?

The Midnight Baker was born at the tail end of 2016. What started out as a funny hashtag, during Christmas baking, became the beginning of our entrepreneurial adventure. Nearly three years later, we've grown from amateur home baking to a truly professional pastry arts business. Within the last year our business has blossomed and continues to grow and that is what brings us here today. We've outgrown our home kitchen and now require our own professional commercial kitchen. With your help, we hope to build and equip a space of our own and share it with the community. Our dream is to bake & deliver directly to you, to offer kitchen time for other food entrepreneurs as well as offer baking workshops. 

 

The Impact

Every backer, big or small, helps us get closer to our goal! Building a commercial kitchen is more complicated than you'd think, but with your help we are sure to navigate all that is needed. Typical commercial kitchens are really expensive for small businesses which is why we want to share our space with other food entrepreneurs. We're really becoming a hit within the Barrhaven community by being a solid presence at The Log Farm this past season and returning to local craft markets. 

 

Risks & Challenges

Feel the fear and do it anyway! No risk. No reward. 

These may be cliches, but they're all true. We admit the fear of branching out on our own full time has been a huge obstacle for us over the years. Here's the thing: we want this dream and we refuse to let fear immobilize us. Having said all of that, we want to reassure you that if for some reason we do not meet our goal we will still invest all we can and make it work some other way. It may end up looking different than what we're asking for here, but NOTHING is going to stop us from moving forward with this dream! 

 

What's the money for?

You may be wondering about the specifics and why we need the amount we're seeking. To achieve our goals we need to rent a commercial space and build the kitchen. The kitchen will need a triple sink with a grease trap, a hand washing sink, an electric convection oven, fridge, freezer, city fees, and of course, construction costs. What started as a pipe dream has quickly turned into a very realistic need to grown our business so we can bring our products to our community. We know we can make this work and we're not afraid to ask for help! 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Look, we get it, not everyone is in a place that they can contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help. Spread the word! Make some noise! Share our campaign. Shout out about us on social media or by word of mouth! Every little bit helps!

story:
Hey guys!

 

Super excited to announce that I took first place in Kansas for the World Food Championships Taste of America competition so that means I'm moving on to Dallas in November to fight for $100,000! There are always expenses that come along with these trips and competitions so I thought it would be fun to create an E Cookbook with a suggested $10 donation to raise money! You can do as little or as much of a contribution as you'd like! If you don't have the $10 by all means send me a message and we'll get you taken care of!

It has around 20 recipes inside the book with photos as well and the best part is, I'm always available via social media to answer any questions you have!

story:
Short Summary

Chef Blackanese Brand has a unique name and story. The name was given to me by the founder of Dragon Inn, Tony Chang. He taught me the fundamentals of Mandarin/Cantonese Cooking. He also taught me how cultures from all over the world can come and work together while sharing the goodness of a delicious meal. My background includes an MBA in Management and over 30 years in sales and restaurant management.  Chef Blackanese Brand is an extension of the Dragon Inn Restaurant, our plan is to introduce America to the great taste that thousands of Dragon Inn customers have enjoyed for over 50 years. My experience as a U.S. Olympian has taught me that no one makes the team without the help from others. Your contribution will allow Chef Blackanese Brand to create a company that will increase employment in Chicago's Southside. Chef Blackanese Brand is made in America by Americans. Below is a short list of where funds will be allocated.

Fund Allocation:

  • Operating cost-(hiring fulfillment center workers) 
  •  Marketing Cost
  • Production (rice, sauces, shipping materials)
  • Rent
  • 3 Delivery Trucks
  • Insurance
  • Administrative services

 

We are raising $ 75,000 to successfully launch and market Chef Blackanese Brand Food Company. We plan to create and maintain a healthy direct to consumer distribution plan for the next 24 months. We will establish a foothold in the Asian and African American markets before expanding into major distribution channels such as Kroger, Super-Valu  and Target etc. We feel that Chef Blackanese Brand, led by our three rice sauces will create new opportunities in fusing style cuisines.   As a contributor you will know that you have helped make  a lifetime entrepreneurial dream come true and positively affect many lives in economically deprived areas of Chicago. You will also have an active part of formulation for current and future Chef Blackanese Food Brand products by participation of an online taste evaluation/recommendation committee.  For the first $100 contributors you will get a one of a kind, Chef Blackanese Bobble Head Doll. In the event we do not reach our goal we will use the funds to reach our financial goals through less costly online/amazon distribution channels.

 

The Impact

As a 1988 & 1992 U.S. Olympian, I have had my share of success. However, after a decade of running a successful restaurant, I have since learned the value of making a difference in another person's life. I have learned that we can make a big impact through employment and affording others to experience economic empowerment. Our restaurant employed up to 30 full and part-time employees. However, these individuals lived in a place where jobs are plentiful. When you make a contribution and help Chef Blackanese Brand rise to a national brand, you will help us employ people in an area where jobs are much needed. In addition, you will be supporting positive role modeling in a community that desperately needs it. For example,  as Head Chef at the Dragon Inn, customers would request me to their table, at least 3 times a week to thank me for a great meal and more importantly to see a Black Chef and owner of a Chinese Restaurant. Lastly, you would be helping the next generation dream bigger, with dreams of business ownership.

Risks & Challenges

There are inherent risks in any business venture. Initially, I was afraid of the name, "Chef Blackanese" and how it would be accepted by the general public.  Admittedly, I was a bit taken when my friend Tony Chang and customers referred to me as such. My acceptance came when I shared my thoughts with my wife, Tina and she explain to me that Tony/Mary Chang loves us and has accepted us into his family. She further explained it was his way of saying we are one big family.  At that point, I understood we were all living a Blackanese life, that is, one of cultural acceptance. It is important to note my wife is Native American/German and she has acclimated to a very southern African-American culture. 

The Challenges are creatively telling that story and letting everyone know we promote diversity and acceptance of all cultures. Hence, our motto: Fusing Cultures and Food Together...One Bite at a Time. However, after the first bite of our sauces the name is just an after thought.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Share on all Social Media Platforms, visit our website for new cooking technics and videos! And Tell Somebody About Us!

story:
Hey! My name is Greg Lister, I'm 24 years old and was born in Glasgow. My wife, Lucie (from Fraserburgh) and I live in Aberdeen with our cat, Daisie and our Puppy, Bali. 

I want to start an Artisan Coffee Shop in the Heart of Fraserburgh's town centre. One of my favourite things to do is to visit Independent Coffee Shops. I've visited shops in Glasgow, Edinburgh, Aberdeen and in the Highlands! Excellent coffee, diversity, an inviting atmosphere, time shared with loved ones and goals and dreams discovered - All of the things a great coffee shop can bring!

Coffee shops do amazing things to the communities that they are within and it is my goal to bring something to the community of Fraserburgh. Bringing something new, something unique, something different. I'd like to bring a taste of the big cities to the town of Fraserburgh. A warm, friendly, relaxed atmosphere with the best coffee beans that Scotland has to offer. A perfect place to hang out with friends, a place to go to work, a place to relax and recharge. A place for everyone.

The other reason I want to start this project is to raise awareness of Ehlers Danlos Syndrome (EDS). We will be giving a percentage of our profits to EDS UK, a charity raising awareness of Ehlers Danlos Syndrome. This is important to me because my sister, Abi suffers from EDS and she continues to inspire me every single day, despite her daily struggle. Here's her story below: 

Abi's Story:
For the entirety of my life I’ve lived in a body that has slowly deteriorated over the years, leaving me crippled in pain, to the point where I can barely get out of bed. After years of struggling to get a diagnosis, I was finally diagnosed with Ehlers Danlos Syndrome in 2017.
EDS is a genetic, incurable, extremely painful & debilitating connective tissue disorder (which basically means it affects your entire body). There are different types of EDS, and everyone is affected differently.

For me it affects my entire body. I have extremely painful joints that sublux/dislocate on a regular basis; My vision is affected; My skin is very fragile so that it doesn’t heal well and bruises/bleeds very easily -  my large surgical abdominal scars (that are more prominent than regular scars due to EDS) often crack open slightly and bleed; aong other things also.
However, what is affected the most is my gastrointestinal system. I had to have my colon completely removed, and now have a permanent ileostomy. My bladder has also slowly deteriorated over the course of my life, leaving me with a long term suprapubic catheter & looking into a urostomy for that. As well as that, my stomach is also deteriorating. It has always emptied very slowly which has now left me unable to eat without either making my severe abdominal pain so much worse, or i just end up vomiting what I ate back up.

The biggest issue with this condition is it is really not very well known in the UK outside of London, which makes it very difficult for sufferers of EDS to get the proper care and medical assistance that is very much required. There is no cure at the moment, but there are ways to help manage it & to try make life with EDS less unbearable.

As ‘Ehlers Danlos Support UK’ says, “Nobody should be left to fight on their own. Every person with EDS should have access to the appropriate medical services & care”.
Supporting ‘Ehlers Danlos Support UK’ will help fund research that could potentially change our lives for the better, and  will help all of us in areas where EDS isn’t really recognised to finally get the help and care we so desperately need.

If you would life to join me on my journey with EDS, you can follow me on Instagram — @strawberry.theostomy

 

My goal is to raise £2,500.  To reach this goal would be absolutely incredible! It would help massively to get the ball rolling for this project and it would be fantastic to have support from locals. A chance to be at the very beginning of what I believe will be a brilliant asset to Fraserburgh.

Here is everything that I need to get started and what your generous contributions would go towards: 

Coffee Machine

Grinder

Filter Machine

Crockery 

Takeaway Cups

Interior

Signage

Fortunately we already have an amazing premise to use and move straight into, which is situated within Unapologetic Studios at 24 Broad Street, Fraserburgh, AB43 9AH.

Pastel coloured walls, plants galore, hints of copper and wood, the aroma of fresh coffee and inspirations from holidays to Bali and our favourite coffee shops in Edinburgh and Glasgow - This Boho vibe Artisan Coffee Shop has everything to offer a great place to be. All that is missing is you! 

 

Seeing this absolute dream of mine come to fruition would be incredible! If you feel like you would like to be part of the story and contribute something - no matter how big or small - it would be greatly appreciated from the bottom of my heart, and then some!

I know that it may not be possible for everyone to contribute financially towards this project but even a simple share on your Social Media channels or a mention to your friends and family would go a long way in helping the dream of this venture come to life. 

I would just like to thank you all in advance and let you know how grateful I am for your contribution and support. I look forward to making this dream a reality with you all!

There's are sharing tool within Indiegogo (this website) so its super easy to get the word out there on Facebook and Instagram.

 

Thanks again,

Greg

story:
All A-Buzz

If you love ice cream, then you're going to LOVE The Craft Creamery! We specialize in infusing our ice cream with your favorite craft beer flavors. The results are delicious! In fact, we've been getting a lot of buzz lately on TV, radio and print publications. Check it out: 

The Sacramento Bee: http://www.sacbee.com/food-drink/beer/beer-run/...

KCRA 3: http://www.kcra.com/article/sacramento-beer-wee..., 

Good Day Sacramento: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Cg8Dvz6JaDY&amp......

Fox 40: http://fox40.com/2017/03/09/craft-beer-ice-crea...

KFBK Radio: http://kfbk.iheart.com/media/play/27681822/%7B%...

Capital Public Radio: http://www.capradio.org/news/insight/2017/03/06...

My Story

My name is Jesse Sahlin. People who know me, know two things: I love craft beer and making ice cream. I'm hoping to launch The Craft Creamery, a perfect blend of my two passions. It all started while growing up in rural Minnesota and Northern California, where I gained a deep understanding and appreciation of where our food comes from, down to the nuances and flavors of freshly harvested fruit, vegetables and herbs. I then translated this into cooking with fresh ingredients. When I left home to attend school at UC Davis, I became much more inspired by California's abundant agriculture and, later on, the booming craft beer community.  My love of food led me to a job at a Davis ice cream parlor, where I began seriously experimenting with fun, new flavors; Maple Ice Cream with Candied Bacon, Goat Cheese with Raw Clover Honey and Figs, Compressed Cantaloupe, and Coffee and Donuts, to name a few.

One day I was in the ice cream lab, drinking a beer, and thought, "why not?" So I dumped a beer into the ice cream base ― it came out terrible. It was a slushy, icy mess, but I could taste the potential. So I kept at it, trying over and over again. Finally, I found a solution ― a new method for creating an amazing beer ice cream. The mouthfeel was smooth and creamy, the beer shined through without clashing with the sweetness, and the notes and nuances of the flavors were in balance. Eureka!

Our Product

After many more experiments with all kinds of beers, I found that the method still worked! My process allows the alcohol to still be retained. Let me repeat, our ice cream DOES CONTAIN ALCOHOL ― you must be of legal age to drink to be able to consume this.

My passion to make the finest-quality product comes from my genuine love for Sacramento’s diverse craft breweries, small businesses, and bountiful farming community. I'm proud of what our region has to offer and want to showcase it as best as we can through ice cream and I want to eventually be able to showcase flavors and breweries across the country and around the world!

In the Sacramento region, the craft beer scene is currently exploding with innovation. The number of quality brews and amazing products that local breweries are producing are fueling my creativity. At the end of the day, I'm simply translating a brewer's passion for their beer into a whole new product: ICE CREAM.

In total, our ice creams have FIVE custom bases:

The Original

  • Eggless, clean, almost a hybrid between a gelato and a premium ice cream. ​

Old School Custard

  • With egg yolks as a stabilizer, thicker, better for ice creams that are being batched with more watery ingredients.

New School Custard

  • No egg yolks, natural stabilizers, some cream cheese added, better for ice creams that have higher sugar content added, not the best for those with high fat being added.

Sorbet

  • Eggless, dairy free, natural stabilizers, not vegan, best adheres to fruit or high acid ingredients.

Dairy Free

  • Soy and almond milk based, natural stabilizers.

All custom bases are crafted from ingredients sourced from local farms, ranches, breweries, and our favorite small purveyors.

I've also developed a process to create ice cream containing hard alcohol, without the use of liquid nitrogen to make or store our product! 

What We Need 

The only thing keeping me from really expanding and bringing the ice cream to you is the equipment I need to make it and a place to store it. With your help, I can turn your favorite beer into ice cream. How cool is that? Please help me make my dream a reality! 

Commercial equipment is expensive. From freezers to mixers and refrigerators, the total racks up pretty quickly. I’m hoping to raise $150,000 with this campaign to get the gear I need to churn out huge batches of ice cream. Here's how it breaks down:

Commercial Ice cream machine - $32,000

Blast Freezer - $9,000

Turbomixer - $8,500

2 Commercial Freezers - $10,000

Commercial Walk-in unit - $6,500

Commercial facility build-out - $200,000 (I'm hoping to garner about half of the build-out costs through this crowdfunding campaign.)

What you get

With the successful funding of The Craft Creamery, I believe I can infuse the world of craft beer with a whole new product line. Breweries won't just be able to sell beer ― ice cream can be a part of their lineup, too. My goal is to have a wholesale contract creamery, where we can make and ship ice cream to your favorite brewery or right to your own home!

We've created some extremely fun perks for you to enjoy, as our way of saying, "THANK YOU" for supporting us! They range from mild to wild, from special recognition at our future location and limited edition Craft Creamery items (and ice cream) to VIP access to our party and even the opportunity to host your own Ice Cream Party and create your own flavor!

The Impact

I truly believe that ice cream can make the world a better place. I love seeing the smiles on people's faces when they try The Craft Creamery. I have no doubt that once you try my ice cream, you will be a true believer!

For the past 6 months, I've really gotten to know Sacramento's amazing craft beer community. The brewers are insanely creative and every one that I've brought ice cream to try ― made from their beers ― has been BLOWN AWAY. They're amazed that the ice cream doesn't hide many of the flavors and nuances that are a part of their beer. Craft beer fans can't believe their tastebuds either!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you're not able to donate, that's OK! All I ask is that you help us spread the word; share this campaign with your beer and ice cream-loving friends, shout us out on your social media channels, and check out our website. Hit "subscribe" to stay up-to-date on all things The Craft Creamery.

Website: http://www.thecraftcreamery.com

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/TheCraftCreamery/

Instagram: @thecraftcreamery

Twitter: @craft_creamery
story_txt:
All A-Buzz
If you love ice cream, then you're going to LOVE The Craft Creamery! We specialize in infusing our ice cream with your favorite craft beer flavors. The results are delicious! In fact, we've been getting a lot of buzz lately on TV, radio and print publications. Check it out: 
The Sacramento Bee: http://www.sacbee.com/food-drink/beer/beer-run/...
KCRA 3: http://www.kcra.com/article/sacramento-beer-wee..., 
Good Day Sacramento: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Cg8Dvz6JaDY&amp......
Fox 40: http://fox40.com/2017/03/09/craft-beer-ice-crea...
KFBK Radio: http://kfbk.iheart.com/media/play/27681822/%7B%...
Capital Public Radio: http://www.capradio.org/news/insight/2017/03/06...
My Story

My name is Jesse Sahlin. People who know me, know two things: I love craft beer and making ice cream. I'm hoping to launch The Craft Creamery, a perfect blend of my two passions. It all started while growing up in rural Minnesota and Northern California, where I gained a deep understanding and appreciation of where our food comes from, down to the nuances and flavors of freshly harvested fruit, vegetables and herbs. I then translated this into cooking with fresh ingredients. When I left home to attend school at UC Davis, I became much more inspired by California's abundant agriculture and, later on, the booming craft beer community.  My love of food led me to a job at a Davis ice cream parlor, where I began seriously experimenting with fun, new flavors; Maple Ice Cream with Candied Bacon, Goat Cheese with Raw Clover Honey and Figs, Compressed Cantaloupe, and Coffee and Donuts, to name a few.
One day I was in the ice cream lab, drinking a beer, and thought, "why not?" So I dumped a beer into the ice cream base ― it came out terrible. It was a slushy, icy mess, but I could taste the potential. So I kept at it, trying over and over again. Finally, I found a solution ― a new method for creating an amazing beer ice cream. The mouthfeel was smooth and creamy, the beer shined through without clashing with the sweetness, and the notes and nuances of the flavors were in balance. Eureka!
Our Product
After many more experiments with all kinds of beers, I found that the method still worked! My process allows the alcohol to still be retained. Let me repeat, our ice cream DOES CONTAIN ALCOHOL ― you must be of legal age to drink to be able to consume this.

My passion to make the finest-quality product comes from my genuine love for Sacramento’s diverse craft breweries, small businesses, and bountiful farming community. I'm proud of what our region has to offer and want to showcase it as best as we can through ice cream and I want to eventually be able to showcase flavors and breweries across the country and around the world!
In the Sacramento region, the craft beer scene is currently exploding with innovation. The number of quality brews and amazing products that local breweries are producing are fueling my creativity. At the end of the day, I'm simply translating a brewer's passion for their beer into a whole new product: ICE CREAM.
In total, our ice creams have FIVE custom bases:
The Original
Eggless, clean, almost a hybrid between a gelato and a premium ice cream. ​
Old School Custard
With egg yolks as a stabilizer, thicker, better for ice creams that are being batched with more watery ingredients.
New School Custard
No egg yolks, natural stabilizers, some cream cheese added, better for ice creams that have higher sugar content added, not the best for those with high fat being added.
Sorbet
Eggless, dairy free, natural stabilizers, not vegan, best adheres to fruit or high acid ingredients.
Dairy Free
Soy and almond milk based, natural stabilizers.
All custom bases are crafted from ingredients sourced from local farms, ranches, breweries, and our favorite small purveyors.
I've also developed a process to create ice cream containing hard alcohol, without the use of liquid nitrogen to make or store our product! 

What We Need 
The only thing keeping me from really expanding and bringing the ice cream to you is the equipment I need to make it and a place to store it. With your help, I can turn your favorite beer into ice cream. How cool is that? Please help me make my dream a reality! 
Commercial equipment is expensive. From freezers to mixers and refrigerators, the total racks up pretty quickly. I’m hoping to raise $150,000 with this campaign to get the gear I need to churn out huge batches of ice cream. Here's how it breaks down:
Commercial Ice cream machine - $32,000
Blast Freezer - $9,000
Turbomixer - $8,500
2 Commercial Freezers - $10,000
Commercial Walk-in unit - $6,500
Commercial facility build-out - $200,000 (I'm hoping to garner about half of the build-out costs through this crowdfunding campaign.)
What you get
With the successful funding of The Craft Creamery, I believe I can infuse the world of craft beer with a whole new product line. Breweries won't just be able to sell beer ― ice cream can be a part of their lineup, too. My goal is to have a wholesale contract creamery, where we can make and ship ice cream to your favorite brewery or right to your own home!
We've created some extremely fun perks for you to enjoy, as our way of saying, "THANK YOU" for supporting us! They range from mild to wild, from special recognition at our future location and limited edition Craft Creamery items (and ice cream) to VIP access to our party and even the opportunity to host your own Ice Cream Party and create your own flavor!

The Impact
I truly believe that ice cream can make the world a better place. I love seeing the smiles on people's faces when they try The Craft Creamery. I have no doubt that once you try my ice cream, you will be a true believer!
For the past 6 months, I've really gotten to know Sacramento's amazing craft beer community. The brewers are insanely creative and every one that I've brought ice cream to try ― made from their beers ― has been BLOWN AWAY. They're amazed that the ice cream doesn't hide many of the flavors and nuances that are a part of their beer. Craft beer fans can't believe their tastebuds either!
Other Ways You Can Help

If you're not able to donate, that's OK! All I ask is that you help us spread the word; share this campaign with your beer and ice cream-loving friends, shout us out on your social media channels, and check out our website. Hit "subscribe" to stay up-to-date on all things The Craft Creamery.
Website: http://www.thecraftcreamery.com
Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/TheCraftCreamery/
Instagram: @thecraftcreamery
Twitter: @craft_creamery

story:
Hello All!!!

               We would like to start this off by formally introducing ourselves. We are Brutal Beerworks. Our team consists of 3 very passionate people. Lets start off with Eric Johnson, he is the founder of Brutal Beerworks. This has been a passion of his since his younger... much younger high school days. He has been brewing his own unique batches for about 10 years. He knew that this was his passion and has been producing some creative and delicious brews.  The second member of the brew crew is Jason Perez. Most of you know him as the former head brewer from Martin House Brewery. He has been brewing for a total of about 8 years and decided that it was time to open something he loved and so he joined forces with Eric These two brew boos are an unstoppable duo. They have an outstanding partnership that will continue to create delicious suds that will always keep you coming back for more. Lastly, there is always that someone that is behind the scenes taking care of the paperwork, phone calls, business plan, and any administrative work..... you know the stuff that no one wants to do but it has to be done..... that would be Sallie McIntyre. She is the never ending support that is needed to keep us pushing and our voice when it comes to negotiating. Now that you know our names, we want you to know our story and the reason behind this campaign. 

         We want to be the first brewery in North Richland Hills and to share our love of craft beer with our community! This is where y'all come in. We need your help and by help we mean your donations and your social media shares. We need to raise money (a lot of money) to get a location, to buy equipment, to pay for permits, and so much more. Opening a brewery is not an easy task but when thinking of the amount of people we can connect each day while slinging out our fresh unique ales makes us excited!! We hope you are excited too! We want you all to be apart of our journey. This means making memories with us, this means struggling with us, and this means working your asses off with us. This brewery will be one that when it opens you will be proud because you know that you were apart of the journey.  Each day the team is coming up with new recipes and ways to make things more interesting for the craft beer world. It is important to us to make people happy. We want people to come in and enjoy what they are drinking. We have been featured in 5 different articles describing our journey and drive. We have placed in several different competitions and even won gold in the Labor of Love competition for our Raspberry Belgian Blonde. 

           Our love for beer is strong but it is not the only reason we want to get things going. We want a place that people can walk into and immediate feel a sense of ease. Life is tough, shit happens. We want you to be able to come in and relax and forget about the craziness in your everyday life. This is the place to meet a new friend / neighbor or have a moment of quiet time when you are normally surrounded by noise. We want you to come in and embrace your chaos. What does that mean you ask...... It means embrace that life is crazy but live and love it to the fullest! Embrace the people around you... yes even the stranger sitting at the end of the bar! We are not all the same we yet we all have something in common,,, we are human beings and that means we matter! Embrace that, love that , live that! We will make sure that the happiness that we feel is shared with those around us! This means we will be getting involved with our community. We will be serving specialty beers and with the purchase of that specialty beer a percentage with go to either our Birdville ISD and or our local police officers and firefighters. We want to give back and build our community because we know that it is our amazing community that will build us!

  I KNOW THIS IS LONG BUT KEEP READING!!!!!!!!!!!! YOU CAN DO IT!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

          Each donation given will be rewarded with some pretty awesome perks. We will be auctioning off a member of the team to be your very own housekeeper and personal assistant for one year..... hahahaha JUST KIDDING! But you will be getting some cool limited edition items depending on the amount you throw at us. Be sure to check our our perks so you can see for yourself what we have to offer.  If you want to help us with this journey but times are tough in the financial section right now, we totally get it! If that is the case then please share us on your social media. Word of mouth goes a long way and that is what this is going to take. We need you to be vocal!  If we do not reach our goal don't stress, we will still put that money towards securing a location. We have a spot in mind and have spoken with the city and they are completely on board with our ideas. They know how great this could be for everyone in the community. We can promise that we will work our butts off to make sure that this brewery that our amazing city needs is opened and able to serve our awesome community with ales that are unforgettable. Know that each dime donated will go towards a piece of our dream. It will help build an unforgettable memory that you will be creating as soon as we open the doors.   

      Overall, this is an exciting time. We are happy to be apart of the craft beer community. We are happy to be sharing our dreams and hopefully soon our beers with you! You are our family and we wouldn't have it any other way!!! Join us in celebrating this outstanding journey. Once again we are asking for you to reach deep in those pockets and donate or at least make sure you share us on all of your social media sites. Help us get the word out so we can start sharing our passion with each of you! We would not be anywhere without our friends and family that support and provide constant feedback! Make noise, scream and shout if you have to but let everyone know that Brutal Beerworks is going to be open for business and we are going to provide you with an open door to the craft beer world but we need your help! We can't do this without you!! We appreciate every penny and every share! Each time you mention our name to someone know that it is extremely appreciated!! Remember we are here for you to EMBRACE YOUR CHAOS!!!!!!!!!! Cheers!!

We would not be anywhere without our friends and family that support and provide constant feedback! Make noise, scream and shout if you have to but let everyone know that Brutal Beerworks is going to be open for business and we are going to provide you with an open door to the craft beer world but we need your help! Remember we are here for you to EMBRACE YOUR CHAOS!!!!!!!!!! Cheers!!

story:
Incredible Story

The Incredible Bakery Company  is a family business created by married couple, Valeria Mizuno-Turner and James Turner. The Incredible Bakery Company makes gluten free and vegan products that are deliciously fresh and innovative and sold in shops and caterers throughout the UK. The Incredible Bakery Company started the business because of brand ambassador and son Leon - now six years. Leon has multiple food allergies and there was little available for Leon to eat when he was born. So, Valeria got baking and James got selling. In three years, the Incredible Bakery Company managed to escape London, move to the countryside and create a wholesale bakery from scratch in the pretty village of Warkton in Northamptonshire.

Now the Incredible Bakery Company wants to have a truck to sell directly to our consumers.  For that reason the idea is create the first Incredible Bakery catering truck.On most weekdays the Incredible Bakery Truck will be operating from the courtyard of Moorfield Farm (Warkton - NN16 9XJ) where our factory is located. On weekends the Incredible Bakery Truck will be reaching outdoor festivals selling our best-selling products, plus making and selling hot meals. Last year, the Incredible Bakery Company sold Margherita Pizzas and Chilli Bean Burgers successfully at the Greenbelt Festival at Boughton House in Northamptonshire.

This year the Incredible Bakery Company wants to go one better. We want to take the Incredible Bakery truck to sell our Gluten Free and Vegan creations like pizzas, freshly baked cakes and our very own roast dinner: chia roast, potatoes, Yorkshire pudding and all the trimmings. Not only selling at the Greenbelt Festival, but to go to as many outdoor festivals as  possible. We also want to take our Incredible Bakery Truck around the country and stage Gluten Free and Vegan food demos.

Incredible Truck

We have already bought our first pizza oven. But is still need to buy our Incredible Truck. The idea is to buy a second hand van and have it converted to be our Incredible Bakery Truck.

The conversion will take care of making sure the Incredible Bakery Truck can operate as food business and will create all those shiny surfaces we need to keep hygiene to the highest standard. The conversion will also create sink, internal lighting and will ensure we have power to have everything working. 

Although we do have a pizza oven, there a many other things we need to transform a simple van into an Incredible Food Truck, including fridge, freezer, food warmers, coffee machine (let's not forget the coffee!!!) and many other little and big things. 

Once the Incredible Food Truck is ready it will be operating from the courtyard at the Moorfield Farm in Warkton (NN16 9XJ) where we have our factory unit on weekdays and some weekends. Most weekends it will be on the road selling the most Incredible gluten free and vegan food in a festival near you. 

Why not be Incredible?

You can be Incredible and help us to spread the gluten free and vegan love around the country. With your help, we can take the Incredible Bakery truck to places where folks wouldn’t dream to have such nice food options and would only rely on packed lunches and cold sandwiches.

What your donation will do

Creating the Incredible Bakery Truck will give us the chance to employ more local people. It will help us increase our volume of sales, that means that all our suppliers will also get more orders. The circular economy will go round and round. 

The Incredible Bakery Truck will help common folks to have access to Gluten Free and Vegan food where there wasn't an option. Some people may even try it for the first time of their life. 

For those people that need to avoid any of the 14 common food allergens we will offer a safe and tasty option. 

The Incredible Bakery Truck will also help the local tourism, as we can forecast many people will come to experience the Incredible foodies in Warkton. 

Incredible Perks

We have created two types of perks: Worldwide Perks and Incredible Bakery Truck Perks. Because we know not all Incredible followers are located in the UK, we have created items we can ship to you. No matter where you are, we will send it to you. 

Worldwide Perks

Incredible Postcard

We will send you this lovely postcard showing the former historical boundaries of Northamptonshire in the 19th century. 

Incredible Mug 

We will send you a lovely porcelain mug to keep your drinks warm.  

Incredible Cap

 

Incredible T-Shirt

Incredible Bag

Incredible Bakery Truck Perks

Food glorious food!

We will send you a voucher that you will be able to redeem from Incredible Bakery Truck. We aim to have the Incredible Bakery Truck parked on Moorfield Farm ( Warkton - NN16 9XJ) where you will be able to come and enjoy the most idyllic country side village, a cuppa, some hot food and a fluffy cake.

If you are going to attend the 2017 Ratrace and 2017 Greenbelt at Boughton House, you can also redeem your voucher there and them.  

Or you can stay put keeping your voucher safe until our Incredible Bakery Truck come by you.  

 
 
 

 

 

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that some of you just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • You can get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools! SHARE SHARE SHARE...

Thank you everybody.

Thank you everybody.

story:
You need a Happy Ending Rub in your life!

  • Passionate and ready to change the way you enjoy your food! No more boring brands without some fun with it! 
  • You will bring a new brand to life and get to see your contribution on the shelves of stores and cabinets of homes. What an amazing opportunity to get to see something you were at the beginning of the creation to have a home in your local markets!

 

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for you!

  • Fundraising to $60K to get the initial blends, packaging and products ready to ship!
  • 3 amazing flavors with flavor and fun in mind! Looking to expand to 6 flavors by year end
  • IF we do not reach our goal - we will take the funds raised and keep going! Even if it is just one blend at a time.
  • Each contributor will get a gift pack of the 3 items and a shirt/apron of their choice

The Impact Your Contribution can make!

 

  • Your contribution will launch the dreams of American Female Entrepreneur with a goal and big dreams to succeed with a fun and flavorful brand.
  • Built brands and successes for others - this contribution will launch our my own brand for a new kid on the market place to make an impact!
  • We are a real brand with real people behind it just trying to have some fun along the way.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Risks - There's always a chance that we may not raise enough funding to launch as big as we want. 
  • Challenges - Blending, Packaging & Shipping. We've partnered with USPS & UPS for shipping solutions! We have 3 blending & packaging companies ready to go pending how big our first runs are after we get a handle on the launch. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please get the word out and make some noise about my campaign.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.
