You need a Happy Ending Rub in your life!

Passionate and ready to change the way you enjoy your food! No more boring brands without some fun with it! 
You will bring a new brand to life and get to see your contribution on the shelves of stores and cabinets of homes. What an amazing opportunity to get to see something you were at the beginning of the creation to have a home in your local markets!

 

What We Need & What You Get
Break it down for you!

Fundraising to $60K to get the initial blends, packaging and products ready to ship!
3 amazing flavors with flavor and fun in mind! Looking to expand to 6 flavors by year end
IF we do not reach our goal - we will take the funds raised and keep going! Even if it is just one blend at a time.
Each contributor will get a gift pack of the 3 items and a shirt/apron of their choice




The Impact Your Contribution can make!
 

Your contribution will launch the dreams of American Female Entrepreneur with a goal and big dreams to succeed with a fun and flavorful brand.
Built brands and successes for others - this contribution will launch our my own brand for a new kid on the market place to make an impact!
We are a real brand with real people behind it just trying to have some fun along the way.


Risks & Challenges
People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

Risks - There's always a chance that we may not raise enough funding to launch as big as we want. 
Challenges - Blending, Packaging & Shipping. We've partnered with USPS & UPS for shipping solutions! We have 3 blending & packaging companies ready to go pending how big our first runs are after we get a handle on the launch. 


Other Ways You Can Help
Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please get the word out and make some noise about my campaign.
Use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Niche Zero's Ready For Shipping

Niche Zero's Being Built and Assembled 

Meet the Niche Zero - the simplest way to get freshly ground barista quality coffee every time, perfect for all your coffee types and brewing methods

 

Do you remember the time when you went into that new coffee shop and you tried that coffee and it tasted like nothing you had ever had before? And no matter how hard you tried, you just couldn’t find anything close? You used all the brewing methods, you tried all the other coffee shops and you tried everything you can think of. But still you couldn’t recreate it?

Well maybe we’ve just found the way to get that taste every time. Not many people realise it, but truly fresh ground beans are essential for great coffee taste. And you can’t get truly fresh ground coffee without a great grinder like the Niche Zero.

The Niche Zero’s clean path design gives you only the freshest grind every time, meaning you can have that fresh ground coffee shop experience in your kitchen or living room whenever you want it. When you put the coffee to your lips you will taste the flavours dancing on the tip of your tongue, that’s when you know you have reached coffee nirvana. The warm, rich aromas will make your mouth water, and you will know it started with the Niche Zero.

"A game changer in coffee grinding"

Click here to read the amazing independent review on the Niche Zero Grinder

 

 

Why the Niche Zero Grinder for better coffee?

Once out of a sealed bag, coffee beans stay fresh for a day. Once ground, the powder stays fresh not for hours, but minutes. Then the volatile oils and aromatics quickly turn stale and bitter. In all other grinders, this residue of soured coffee grounds stays in the machine, tainting every subsequent batch of ground coffee. No matter how great your coffee beans are, they’ll be mixing in with this unpleasant residue. 

The Niche Zero Grinder's unique technology means that there’s virtually zero retained grind. You get all the taste and quality of the beans you’ve paid for. All of the beans are ground and all of the ground coffee leaves the grinder. And  because you know everything leaves the grinder, it’s much easier to determine the right quantity of beans you’ll need.

That’s what makes the Niche Zero Grinder different, better and the best thing to happen to coffee for years.

 

 

Niche values

 

Niche features

 

Our optimised grind thread gives you total control over your grind size, making all your coffee brewing a truly bespoke and personal experience. The Niche Zero’s grind dial is light to operate and infinitely adjustable, giving you full grind range from espresso to French press.
Take control of your coffee.​

 

Burrs are the machine parts that do the grinding. Our large industrial-grade burrs have been carefully selected to have twice the grind area of standard burrs. The Niche Zero Grinder’s burrs deliver outstanding quality whilst leaving your grind unburnt and tasting great.
Cool, quiet, calm grinding.

 

Accessibility is key for quick and efficient grinding. Current grinders are bulky, taking up way too much space and often not fitting under average cabinet heights (50cm). But not the Niche Zero Grinder - designed with innovative cord storage in the base and no hopper. 
Perfect for your environment.

 

The Niche Zero Grinder is is a premium-quality product built from the finest materials and to the highest standards. It’s a product you will be proud to own. The Niche Zero Grinder's classic design is complimented by an all metal body and solid, oak features. 
Quality never goes out of style.

 

Featured in

 

 

 

Testimonials

"We had the absolute pleasure of trying out the Niche Zero grinder in our busy speciality coffee shop. Quiet, easy to use with a great design and perfectly petite. It's an all-round great piece of equipment in which every detail has been thought about." Baristas at Southsea Coffee, Hampshire. 

"The Niche  is being used a lot and Ollie (our main weekend barista) has really got the hang of it and said now that he has got used to it ,it’s the easiest grinder to dial in, he really loves it! It is very sensitive and different beans need dialling in as required  –but that is the job and when you have the hang of it its brilliant.  I have used it for decaff and regular beans myself and apart from being  fun to use, the grind is consistently good. It’s a work horse, its quiet, does not take up much space  and looks amazing too! Every café should have one. I liked it in the beginning but it’s really grown on all of us. Finally, container (grind cup) that fits in to the coffee holder (portafilter) is brilliant and saves a lot of time." Chris Rendle Director, Edgcumbes Tea and Coffee Co Ltd, West Sussex.

 

 

What makes the Niche Zero so different from other Grinders?

 

How to use

 

 

 

Designing the grinder.

 

Martin Nicholson likes a challenge. 

He looks at things and imagines how they could be made better. He thinks and designs; he builds and invents. He has many patents to his name, on everything from gearboxes to food processors. He loves really good coffee.

Martin is an accomplished designer with over 30 years of industry and design experience. He has worked with a vast number of global companies, including; Kenwood, Phillips, Braun, Tefal, Bombay Sapphire, Anglepoise, Airbus, Russel Hobbs, AEG, Dualit, Sanyo and Sunbeam.

It occurred to Martin that the basic design of the coffee grinder hadn’t changed since the 1950’s – and most other technologies have changed almost beyond recognition in that time span.

Martin saw an opportunity to design and build a revolutionary coffee grinder incorporating game-changing technology. The goal has always been to bring coffee grinding of the highest professional standards within reach of everyone who loves truly great coffee.

This didn’t just happen overnight.  The ground-breaking Niche Zero Grinder is the result of significant self-funded investment; with 4 years of technical engineering, refinement and development, with over 30 prototypes.

For Martin, being able to have an impact on the quality of coffee people consume represents the fulfilment of a lifelong dream and something that continues to drive him every single day.

By backing and sharing our campaign we will be able to fund the initial tooling and production of the Niche Zero Coffee Grinder.

 

 

Specifications

 

FAQs

Price & Shipping

1. What is the value of the Niche Zero Grinder?

RRP £499.

2. Is shipping included?

Shipping, handling and other local charges vary from country to country. Please select your reward tier on the Indiegogo site to see more information about the shipping costs relevant to your country. Please be aware that we cannot mark any shipments as gifts or samples, due to legal reasons. Please see below for more on taxes and custom duties.

3. Who pays taxes & custom duties?

Campaign contributors are responsible for any taxes or customs duties levied by their own countries.

4. What countries do we ship to?

Currently we can deliver to UK, Europe, Israel, Singapore, Australia, New Zealand,  USA and Canada. 

5. Can I buy replacement burrs?

Replacement burr sets will be available.

6. Plugs and voltage for the Niche Zero Grinder?

UK contributors will be supplied with a Niche Zero Grinder fitted with a 230v/50-60Hz motor  and UK plug.

Rest of European Union contributors will be supplied with a Niche Zero Grinder fitted with a 230v/50-60Hz motor and Euro plug.

USA contributors will be supplied with a Niche Zero Grinder fitted with a 120v/60Hz motor and USA plug.

 

Technical

1. What burrs does the Niche Zero Grinder use?

The Niche Zero Grinder will be supplied with premium grade hardened steel 63mm conical burrs.

2. Can you easily access the burrs for cleaning?

It is easy to access the burrs by simply unscrewing and removing the top bean funnel.

3. Is your grind setting lost when cleaning the burr set?

You can keep your grind setting when cleaning. Simply note where the grind dial is set, unscrew and remove the bean funnel, clean the burrs and grind chamber. Replace the bean funnel and screw clockwise until finger tight, then unscrew the bean funnel anti-clockwise back by about half a turn to your original set point.

4. What is dose consistency?

We define dose consistency as the difference between the weight of coffee beans you put into the grinder and the weight of the ground coffee you get out of the grinder when grinding is finished.

5. What is the dose consistency of the Niche Zero Grinder?

Independent testing confirms a dose consistency with a variation of less than +/- 0.2g of grind. This was tested with a range of coffees and roast levels.

6. What is the approximate grinding speed of the Niche Zero Grinder?

1.5g/s fine (espresso), 1.8g/s medium (chemex), 2.1g/s coarse (French press).

7. What motor does the Niche Zero Grinder use?

We use a permanent magnet DC motor.

8. Does the Niche Zero Grinder have a hopper?

The Niche Zero Grinder is designed for single dosing. We have designed it with no hopper so you can keep your beans fresh in their bag. You then only have to weigh out the beans you need ground for your next recipe, confident that the grind will be as fresh as the beans you use.

9. What is the paint finish on the Niche Zero Grinder?

The paint finish is powder coated, which is tough and has remained white and unstained over more than two year’s heavy testing with oily coffees. 

10. Does the Niche Zero Grinder have step-less or stepped grind adjustment?

The Niche Zero Grinder has an infinite step-less adjustment, giving you a very high degree of grind size control.

11. Have you tested the Niche Zero Grinder with a variety of beans?

We have used a wide variety of bean types and the Niche Zero Grinder consistently ground them all to a very high standard.

12. Will the Niche Zero Grinder launch with a choice of different woods?

For logistical reasons, we are only able to produce solid oak user interchangeable feet and panels at launch. However, we plan to offer different wood types in the future.

13. Maximum amount of beans?

          The Niche Zero bean funnel can hold and grind 50g coffee beans into the grind cup.

story:
Hemp Way Foods

26279 Highway 74 #C
Kittredge, CO 80457
(720) 205-2100

www.hempway.net

Hemp can change our world. As Hemp Way Foods’ owner and management team of one, hemp has really changed my own life!  My mission statement, “Not only to feed people, but also to nourish them with health,” is essentially my company’s operational blueprint. My vision is to start a food revolution and my love of hemp is the driving force behind Hemp Way Foods.

“Necessity often being the mother of invention,” it was my own experience with food intolerance and my quest to identify realistic food options to fuel my body after I survived a severe car accident in 1996.  In my quest to maintain optimal health, I turned to hemp as a source of complete nutrition. Hemp Way Foods has identified its’ niche as an up-and-coming forerunner company in an industry that is currently trending worldwide.

Located in the Evergreen, Colorado area, Hemp Way Foods was established in 2014 using a recipe I developed in 2013. I have been recognized locally in the Denver metro and Denver foothills areas for my business acumen, energy, passion, and quick thinking.

The company operates as a wholesale food supplier of hemp burgers and hemp seed crumbles to restaurants and markets focused on healthy foods for healthy living.

In addition, many other Hemp Way Food product options are on the drawing board, including: a Sriracha flavor burger and Sriracha flavor crumbles, a hemp (plant-based) nacho cheese, a hemp “butter” spread, and a hemp truffle (a vegan version of a sweet treat), featuring hemp, coconut oil, and cacao.

Hemp Way Foods is founded upon a solid foundation using my diverse background with 10+ years of successful management, marketing and outside sales experience, as well as strong knowledge of building solid client relationships.

Some of my past work experience includes being an Operations Manager for an Alternative Health Care Facility, a Marketing Manager and owner of Boyd Insurance Agency (a personal line insurance agency I sold in August 2010).  I won several awards during that time, including a Blue Vase Award and Rookie of the Year Award, and management/marketing of Cannabis dispensaries.

2009-2012: I was a facet of the evolving medical marijuana industry in Colorado, and was an integral part of the Denver chapter of the Mile High NORML board (National Organization for the Reform of Marijuana Laws).

August 2010-August 2011: I was involved in consulting with several medical marijuana dispensaries handling management task; hiring, rules & regulations, budtending, marketing, and advocacy to name a few. 

In 2012, I was the Program Coordinator for Hemp Cleans™.  I assisted this grassroots nonprofit in its quest for the regulation and cultivation of industrial hemp, while the groundwork for hemp legislation was being laid. (The organization was the focus of several articles that discussed their assistance in educating farmers and others about the myriad uses of hemp.)

Through all these business associations I have thoroughly learned and put into action all phases of starting, running, and operating successful businesses.

The Market: The Hemp Industries Association (HIA) estimates that the retail value of North American hemp food, vitamin and body care products was in the range of $156 to $171 million in 2012. When clothing, auto parts, building materials and other non-food or body care products are included, the HIA estimates that the total retail value of U.S. hemp products is about $500 million. [1] 

With health foods on the rise, consumers are turning to new food trends for the latest way to take in nutrients. According to GrubHub Inc., an online and mobile food ordering company, demand for trending health foods such as chia seeds, and quinoa increased more than 100 percent in the last year. Hemp grew 110 percent with women in the past year, which bested the demand for chia seeds in the GrubHub study.[2]

Targeted Customers: Hemp Way Foods’ targeted market is "clean eaters"—people looking for healthy, and delicious, alternative foods. These customers aren’t vegan or vegetarian but they do focus on healthy foods in their diets, like farm-raised animals and foods without GMOs (Genetically Modified Organisms). 

Business Operation: Hemp Way Foods, structured as a Limited Liability Company (LLC) within the State of Colorado, has been operating with limited funding, and without employees, by its owner Carla Boyd, the company’s greatest asset.

The products (burgers and crumbles) freeze well and have no taste degradation at 13 months so a large back stock can be completed to make sure inventory is always available.  Production usually involves two to three days per week of working 6-8 hours per day and producing approximately 100-130 hemp burgers an hour.

Competition:

The companies noted below are competitors of Hemp Way Foods, which indicates the market is viable for these products.

Hilary’s

http://www.hilaryseatwell.com

Hilary’s Hemp n Greens Burger is a product competitor. The business in based in Kansas with about 25 outlets in Colorado that carry its products.

The Good Seed Hemp Co.

http://www.goodseedhemp.com

With products carried nationally in Whole Foods Markets, and regional Natural Grocers and Kroger Markets, this company, with major distribution outlets, is Hemp Way Foods’ biggest competitor since it is also in the hemp world.

(Organic) Sunshine Burger

http://www.sunshineburger.com

This company has a good website, large distribution outlets and an impressive online (Google) presence.

Marketing: On the days I am not in production I spend my time identifying upcoming food events, researching potential venues that may benefit Hemp Way Foods, and planning marketing strategies accordingly as noted herein this Business Plan. I am active with social media (Instagram, Twitter, and Facebook) where I posts pictures of food. This works well to spread word about my business and its products.  I am involved in marketing my business with many organizations in which I teach hemp cooking demonstrations, and hemp food sampling.  These are all pieces which have brought us much attention and press.    

Company Press:

February 2016: Hemp Way Foods was featured in a write-up/review in THC Magazine, “Hemp Connoisseur” (“Take a Bite Out of Something Delicious from Hemp Way Foods,” written by Carolyn Hayes; p.40)

•June 2015: Hemp Way Foods at VegFest Colorado! (denverpolitics.org)

•April 2015: Business Q&A: Hemp Way Foods, Kittredge (The Denver Post, YourHub)

•October 2014: Hemp Fest 2014!

•August 2014: Denver’s Delicious Gluten-Free Food Fair-Hemp Way Foods! (Wellitude)

•March (5-6) 2016: Press Release - http://growhempcolorado.com/index.php/hemp-events/2015-hemp-events/2015-hemp-awards-festival/24-2015-hemp-events/136-2nd-annual-hemp-awards-festival

March 6, 2016: 1:30 pm – 2:15 pm – "Cooking with Hemp" – Presented by Carla Malone-Boyd with Hemp Way Foods – learn how to incorporate hemp into your everyday recipes and new ones that your family will love while giving them an extra boost of hemp health.  

April 2015: Business Q&A: Hemp Way Foods, Kittredge (The Denver Post, YourHub)

HIGH TIMBER TIMES NEWSPAPER (Interview with Carla Boyd)

At Hemp Way Foods, it's all about the burger

Posted:  05/03/2016 

Article re-released in the Canyon Currier (Interview with Carla Boyd)

At Hemp Way Foods, it's all about the burger

Posted:  06/22/2016 

Company Awards:

March 2016 Industrial Hemp awards & Expo: "Best Colorado Made Hemp Food" 

December 2015 Cannabis Business Awards: "Best Hemp Product/Facility”


CAPITAL REQUIREMENTS:

Proposed Annual Budget for 2017:

Operations

$5,000

Permits, Licenses, Insurance, Worker’s Comp

$5,000

Facility Rental

$10,000

Utilities

$0

Staffing (3 p/t staff; 2 kitchen staff, 1 web & blog contractor.)

(covering 8 months of staffing)

$22,000

Marketing/Events

$4,000

Advertising

$4,000

Organizational Memberships:

*Evergreen Area Chamber of Commerce

*Naturally Boulder

*National Hemp Association

$1,000

Product Supplies and Packaging:

Bulk  ingredients 

Burger molds

Pots

Storage containers

Vacuum sealer

Packaging bags

Labeling 

Flash Freezer

$7,000

Transportation/Product Distribution Expenses

$2,000

Proposed Capital Requirement in the amount indicated →  $60,000 

would support projected budget line items as indicated above.

[1] Ray Hansen, content specialist, AgMRC, Iowa State University

[2] Jeremy Gerrard, Food Engineering

experience includes being an Operations Manager for an Alternative Health Care
Facility, a Marketing Manager and owner of Boyd Insurance Agency (a personal
line insurance agency I sold in August 2010).  I won several awards
during that time, including a Blue Vase Award and Rookie of the Year Award, and
management/marketing of Cannabis dispensaries. 
2009-2012: I was a facet of the
evolving medical marijuana industry in Colorado, and was an integral part of
the Denver chapter of the Mile High NORML board (National Organization for the
Reform of Marijuana Laws).

August 2010-August 2011:
I was involved in consulting with several medical marijuana dispensaries handling management task; hiring, rules & regulations, budtending, marketing, and
advocacy to name a few.  

In 2012, I was the
Program Coordinator for Hemp Cleans™.  I
assisted this grassroots nonprofit in its quest for the regulation and
cultivation of industrial hemp, while the groundwork for hemp legislation was
being laid. (The organization was the focus of several articles that discussed
their assistance in educating farmers and others about the myriad uses of hemp.)
Through all these business
associations I have thoroughly learned and put into action all phases
of starting, running, and operating successful businesses. 
The Market: The Hemp Industries Association (HIA)
estimates that the retail value of North American hemp food, vitamin and body
care products was in the range of $156 to $171 million in 2012. When clothing,
auto parts, building materials and other non-food or body care products are
included, the HIA estimates that the total retail value of U.S. hemp products
is about $500 million. [1]  

With health foods on the
rise, consumers are turning to new food trends for the latest way to take in
nutrients. According to GrubHub Inc., an online and mobile food ordering
company, demand for trending health foods such as chia seeds, and quinoa
increased more than 100 percent in the last year. Hemp grew 110 percent with
women in the past year, which bested the demand for chia seeds in the GrubHub
study.[2]
Targeted Customers: Hemp Way Foods’ targeted market is "clean
eaters"—people looking for healthy, and delicious, alternative foods.
These customers aren’t vegan or vegetarian but they do focus on healthy foods
in their diets, like farm-raised animals and foods without GMOs (Genetically
Modified Organisms). 
Business Operation: Hemp Way Foods, structured
as a Limited Liability Company (LLC) within the State of Colorado, has been
operating with limited funding, and without employees, by its owner Carla Boyd,
the company’s greatest asset. 
The products (burgers and crumbles) freeze well
and have no taste degradation at 13 months so a large back stock can be
completed to make sure inventory is always available.  Production usually involves
two to three days per week of working 6-8 hours per day and producing
approximately 100-130 hemp burgers an hour.
Competition:
The companies noted below are
competitors of Hemp Way Foods, which indicates the market is viable for these
products.
Hilary’s 
http://www.hilaryseatwell.com
Hilary’s Hemp n Greens Burger
is a product competitor. The business in based in Kansas with about 25 outlets
in Colorado that carry its products.
The Good Seed Hemp Co.
http://www.goodseedhemp.com
With products carried
nationally in Whole Foods Markets, and regional Natural Grocers and Kroger
Markets, this company, with major distribution outlets, is Hemp Way Foods’
biggest competitor since it is also in the hemp world.

(Organic) Sunshine Burger
http://www.sunshineburger.com
This company has a good
website, large distribution outlets and an impressive online (Google) presence.

Marketing: On the days I am not in production I spend my time
identifying upcoming food events, researching potential venues that may benefit
Hemp Way Foods, and planning marketing strategies accordingly as noted
herein this Business Plan. I am active with social media
(Instagram, Twitter, and Facebook) where I posts pictures of food. This works well to spread word about my business and its products.  I am involved in marketing my business with many organizations in which I teach hemp cooking demonstrations, and hemp food sampling.  These are all pieces which have brought us much attention and press.    Company Press:February 2016: Hemp Way Foods was featured in a write-up/review in THC Magazine, “Hemp Connoisseur” (“Take a Bite Out of Something Delicious from Hemp Way Foods,” written by Carolyn Hayes; p.40)•June 2015: Hemp Way Foods at VegFest Colorado! (denverpolitics.org)•April 2015: Business Q&A: Hemp Way Foods, Kittredge (The Denver Post, YourHub)•October 2014: Hemp Fest 2014!•August 2014: Denver’s Delicious Gluten-Free Food Fair-Hemp Way Foods! (Wellitude)•March (5-6) 2016: Press Release - http://growhempcolorado.com/index.php/hemp-events/2015-hemp-events/2015-hemp-awards-festival/24-2015-hemp-events/136-2nd-annual-hemp-awards-festivalMarch 6, 2016: 1:30 pm – 2:15 pm – "Cooking with Hemp" – Presented by Carla Malone-Boyd with Hemp Way Foods – learn how to incorporate hemp into your everyday recipes and new ones that your family will love while giving them an extra boost of hemp health.  April 2015: Business Q&A: Hemp Way Foods, Kittredge (The Denver Post, YourHub)HIGH TIMBER TIMES NEWSPAPER (Interview with Carla Boyd)
At Hemp Way Foods, it's all about the burger
Posted:  05/03/2016 
Article re-released in the Canyon Currier (Interview with Carla Boyd)
At Hemp Way Foods, it's all about the burger
Posted:  06/22/2016 
Company Awards:
March 2016 Industrial Hemp awards & Expo: "Best Colorado Made Hemp Food" 
December 2015 Cannabis Business Awards: "Best Hemp Product/Facility”CAPITAL
REQUIREMENTS:

Proposed Annual Budget for 2017:






Operations


$5,000




Permits, Licenses, Insurance,
  Worker’s Comp


$5,000




Facility Rental


$10,000




Utilities


$0




Staffing (3 p/t staff; 2 kitchen staff, 1
  web & blog contractor.)
(covering 8 months of staffing)


$22,000




Marketing/Events


$4,000




Advertising


$4,000




Organizational Memberships:
*Evergreen Area Chamber of Commerce
*Naturally Boulder
*National Hemp Association


$1,000




Product Supplies and Packaging:
Bulk  ingredients 
Burger molds
Pots
Storage containers
Vacuum sealer
Packaging bags
Labeling 
Flash Freezer


$7,000




Transportation/Product
  Distribution Expenses


$2,000














Proposed Capital Requirement in the amount indicated →  $60,000 
would support projected budget line items as indicated above.








[1]
Ray Hansen, content specialist, AgMRC, Iowa State
University



[2]
Jeremy Gerrard, Food Engineering

story:
Hello Everyone

Thank you for taking the time out of your day to become familiar with me and my product. 

I'm a very hard worker and small business owner looking to create an opportunity to better the world. I want to someday be in a position to employ thousands of individuals, which is the purpose of my campaign. Expansion is needed in order to manufacture and ship my beverages to the many people that are interested and enjoy it. My current financial state does not allow me to do that at this time, and has become quite overwhelming. Based on what I do achieve from this campaign, if I don't reach my goal, will still allow some expansion. I will have great appreciation for whatsoever I do receive to help me produce and ship my product.

I am 40 years old today, and ever since a child I've been motivated to be an inventor. Yes, way before innovation was ever thought of! I have many prototypes, and I hope someday I can also introduce those to you. However, I am highly confident about this beverage. It is an intricate and expensive process to naturally infuse water with the flavor of bourbon with the extraction of alcohol content. So the funds will be used to help with the formulation process as well.  

To show my appreciation for your generosity, I will send a 18 pack of El'ajure Bourbon Flavored Water to each individual for every $50 they donate. That includes free shipping. Please allow 14 days for its arrival upon your donation.

For those that can not donate and have taking the time to review my campaign, I want to thank you dearly for your time and ask that you please spread the word and tell your friends to stop by to be informed of this exclusive product.

story:
Who I Am

My name is Emily and I've always cared deeply for the environment but it wasn't until I moved to California a few years ago and started seeing plastic litter on the beaches that I realized the magnitude of plastic waste in the world today. I'm looking to launch this campaign and make an item that will change the world for the better. 

The Product 

The idea is a straw, kept in a small portable pouch, that opens like a telescope and twists into place so it can be used at restaurants, movie theaters, lunch rooms, even at home! I'm looking to use the funding from this campaign to create my first round of prototypes for both the straw and the small pouch that it will come in. I would also use this money for social ad buys and marketing as well as ordering the first batch of units to be sold to consumers. A percentage of each purchase will also be donated to Ocean Conservancy- an organization that works to fight the biggest threats to our oceans today.

The Ask

If you are able, I would greatly appreciate a donation to my campaign to get this venture off the ground. I would also be thrilled if you could share this page on social media as well as tell your family and friends! Let's help make the world a better place.

story:
Who We Are

Our mission is to offer the finest quality African food products in the global market by creating and pioneering an African segment to reach customers of various races and nationalities. 

Our vision is to dominate the African segment of the specialty food industry.

By raising $20,000, we will be able to begin production for all six flavors of our sauce line and all 4 flavors of Meg's Sumptuous plantain chips. This campaign is meant to cover the cost of ingredients, inventory, graphic design, nutritional facts and freight.

After arriving in the United States, Nana noticed a gap in the market for African food products. He missed his mother's home cooking and craved several Ghanaian snacks and dishes with no means to satisfy his cravings. In August 2011, he was invited to join the Hiram College team to compete against 9 other colleges for the best business idea. Their team fell short of winning the $5000 prize. However it did not deter Nana from pursuing his dream of seeing African food products on the shelves of local grocery stores. He soon met Tim Skaryd of the Cleveland Culinary Launch Kitchen to make small batches who connected him to a manufacturer called Dorina So Good to produce Supreme Sauce marinade in 100 gallon batches for each run. By the summer of 2015, Supreme Sauce marinade was sold in over twenty locations. Today, it is retailed in 40 grocery stores and is projected to be in over 100 locations by the end of 2018. During the summer of 2017, Nana asked his mother to teach him how to make her salsa recipe to expand the sauce line after having an epiphany to scale up the business. Supreme Sauce salsa will be  available in 3 flavors. He also started research on plantain chips after his father encouraged him to do so. He taught himself how to make plantain chips from scratch and developed four unique flavors (classic, sweet and spicy, sweet and fire hot, sweet).

story:
Nice to meet you all :)

Hello and a very warm welcome to Seeds For The Soul – the 100% vegan eatery project. Thank you so much for taking the time to check us out. First of all, let us introduce ourselves. We are a Scottish-Lithuanian vegan family: Daddy Thomas, Mummy Roberta and our little son TJ. 

Daddy Thomas has run three businesses in the past and currently works as a project manager in construction (managing 150 employees). He is also a Krav Maga (self-defence) instructor. He has lots of previous experience in management and the overall running of businesses.

Mummy Roberta is an artist, blogger and a self-taught chef who has been cooking since childhood. She has two years of experience working in hospitality. 

After Roberta gave birth to baby boy TJ two years ago she got very ill. She was diagnosed with epilepsy and severe anxiety. She had tried many different options to help herself and to improve her poor health, but nothing worked. After one and a half years of searching, we came across the Vegan diet and lifestyle.

After learning of all the good reasons why we should become Vegan (to save animals, to boost your immune system and your overall health, to decrease our carbon footprint for environment, to give our children and our children’s children a fighting chance of still having a beautiful planet to live on in years to come), there was no way back. 

We as a family love good food, eating out and cooking at home too. In first six months of eating a 100% plant-based diet, we have learned so much about Vegan food. It’s delicious, easy to make, cheaper and healthier, with less of an impact on our planet and the environment. This is when we decided to open our own place selling clean, freshly prepared, healthy food. A place where we could educate and maybe open a few more people’s eyes to the death, torture and destruction caused by animal agriculture. 

We want to share our knowledge about the Vegan lifestyle with people by opening a 100% Vegan eatery. We want this eatery to become a place not just for eating amazing Vegan food, but also a place to learn more about the vegan lifestyle, Eco-friendly products, recycling, and to become inspired. Hopefully, we will inspire enough people in this world to make a difference for all of our futures.  When we first started to try and find places to eat out vegan style, we quickly realised that there weren't that many 100% vegan eateries out there. In fact right now as I write this, if you want to go out somewhere sit in and eat a Vegan Breakfast or Lunch in a 100% plant based establishment (that does not sell any animal products whatsoever), there are only a few options in Edinburgh. Recently we conducted market research of our own and found that people wanted more variety of vegan food and places to be more baby friendly. Taking this on board we will offer up a varied menu (which will be posted as an update) and definitely have baby changing facilities. Further to the research, we attended our very first market (see picture below) selling some of our food. This went well with lots of nice comments from vegans and non-vegans alike about our food. This along with the fact that Veganism is a growing movement all over the world, with Edinburgh one of the most Vegan-friendly cities in the UK, we feel the timing of this is perfect and this is why we feel there is a definite need for our new business.

Turning vegan was a wonderful life changing experience for us, we got inspired so much that there was no other way than to share it with the world. We love everything about vegan lifestyle, from food to recycling and helping to save our planet. To wake up in the morning knowing that the choices we make are saving animal lives and helping the environment is so fulfilling and uplifting, that it is really hard to describe in words. So we are here to inspire others, and to show that change is so easy and rewarding.

 

Thanks For Staying With Us So Far

Sooo, let's get down to what we are looking for :)

We have found the perfect premises in the heart of Edinburgh's old town area just off of the Royal Mile.

For those who don't know the Royal Mile is the bustling stretch of road running straight from Edinburgh's iconic castle down to the door-step of Her Majesty’s Holyrood Palace which is exactly one mile long hence the name. It has the perfect mix of footfall for us, with tourists, students, businesses and locals alike, and the property itself has a great character as it was once a church in its hay day, which I feel breathes life into our name, Seeds For The Soul. The Church has now been developed into apartments with a restaurant/cafe retail space on the ground floor. As you can see from the above artist’s impression it will be quite an impressive looking unit once completed and it will only be possible with your help.

We need funds for the following bits and bobs that add up to a lot more than we expected originally. As in it's current state there is absolutley nothing in it, not even the main services are conected i.e water, gas, electricity so it's a big job but nothing i can't handle given the right people and funds of course :)

  • Fit out cost based on three separate quotes from local companies, (£82,524 the property is a shell, has no electrics, plumbing, floors, walls, boiler, toilets etc completely bare)
  • Equipment for the Kitchen(£10,000)
  • Tables, Chairs, Dishes, Cutlery (we are looking for secondhand to upcycle ourselves)
  • Smoke Alarm system(£860)
  • Security Alarm (£575)
  • Solicitor fees (£1140)
  • Architect fees(£1250)
  • Stock(£8990.33)
  • Staff wages(£7467.10 month 1)
  • Shop front fitted with new Double glazing (£16,060.80)
  • Deposit for premises(£7500)

We will try and do as much as we can ourselves to bring down the costs were possible.

Perk Your Bum Right Here

We have tried to be as creative as possible with the perk in the hope that you all really enjoy them and get to feel a part of our awesome journey. With perks from a simple high five from us to graffiti in our toilets, meals and hot drinks, you can give something back to less fortunate people and animals.

Swung And Missed

The funds generated will be used towards having a huge party where we will all get very drunk and drown our sorrows LOL.

Seriously though they will be used to reduce our start-up costs and the need to borrow more from the banks.

The reality of failing to reach our target would almost certainly mean us having to find another location as we could not afford to open in this prime retail site without your backing to make it possible.

We really really really hope that this is not the case and we get the opertunity to open in this fantasic location.

Plant A Little Seed In Your Soul

This is a time of great change on our planet. Maybe you have heard people say veganism is a fashion that is trending right now? Well, here at Seeds for the Soul we believe that it's a great fashion to follow and oh my, we just love to be trendy! :-)

We are on an inspiring mission to show people that vegan food is not just 'grass', oh no, it’s so so so much more! What you can make with tasty veggies, nuts, seeds, and beans is actually amazing and the possibilities are limitless! From different kinds of milk to delicious rolls and sandwiches, and vitamin-packed smoothies, to tasty bakes that are actually good for you. Yes, you heard us, it’s not just tasty but it is also packed with vitamins and minerals. And what about all the salads and the soups? We are also very excited to introduce different superfoods to you, from amazing green-blue algae like spirulina and chlorella to super power seeds like hemp and chia.

Good clean food is so important when it comes to good health and happiness, and that is why here at Seeds for the Soul we make it our priority to use the best ingredients available, free from preservatives, chemicals, refined sugar and all sorts of other nasties. We want our food to nurture your body and soul, that’s why we make it with love and care. We use only the best ingredients, many of them organically grown on local farms.

We are on a mission together with other clean eateries to try and reduce the pollution of our beloved planet so that the future generations can still enjoy it and see the beauty of our home. All our takeaway boxes, bags, cups, cutlery, and napkins are 100% biodegradable. And all the waste that we produce when working is composted or recycled daily.

At Seeds For the Soul will offer something different. We will have the following running at our new place:

  • Mother/Father and baby days
  • Easy Vegan Cooking classes
  • Guest speakers
  • Vegan Meet Ups
  • A place to hold Vegan events like potlucks, picnics
  • Free space for young artist to display/sell their work(Roberta is an artist and knows exactly how hard it is to find somewhere to display your artwork)
  • Completely child-friendly with their own menu, play area and changing facilities
  • Half portions available to buy for everyone
  • Open for dinner
  • Sell Vegan Wines/Beers

We hope that these stand us out from the crowd and offer something that's a little nicer and makes our place feel more comfortable, welcoming just like home :)


 

Our future vision is to plant 'Seeds for the Soul' in every city of this great country. We want to support and promote natural food, local organic producers, to educate people about the benefits of a vegan diet, and to help keep our planet as clean as we possibly can.

So let's spread love and health to as many people as we possibly can! :-)

Would You Risk It for a Chocolate Biscuit

The one major risk we have is property related, our architect has concerns over the separating ceiling between our unit and the basement below. This has to achieve 1-hour fire separation and reach 57dB of sound insulation. This could be an additional cost if the landlord does not want to pay for these works. I don't have a quote for this as yet as it may not be a problem as we await word back from the landlords and will update once we receive word back.

I suppose the fact that we have never run an eatery/cafe/restaurant before is a risk, but as with every business I have run there is always an element of risk. To combat this we will ensure we have the right people in the right positions, as having the correct team around you is crucial to any businesses success and cannot be under estimated.

We think the biggest risk will, of course, be us eating all of our delicious food ourselves and not making any money lol :)

Can't Fund Our Campaign, You Can Still Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help, there are still plenty of ways to help and support us by doing the following. Pleeeeeeaaaaassssseeee!!!

  • Spread the word about our compassionate journey and campaign
  • Which is very easy to do by using the Indiegogo sharing tools
  • Come along during the build phase and lend a hand, as they say "many hands make light work" or is it just the light switch :)

We wish everyone Love, Peace, Hope and abundance in their lives and would love to see you at our new place once we open.

If you got this far Thank You Soooo Much! for taking the time to read our campaign Lots of love from us to you :)

Architect fees(£1250)
Stock(£8990.33)
Staff wages(£7467.10 month 1)
Shop front fitted with new Double glazing (£16,060.80)
Deposit for premises(£7500)



We will try and do as much as we can ourselves to bring down the costs were possible.


Perk Your Bum Right Here

We have tried to be as creative as possible with the perk in the hope that you all really enjoy them and get to feel a part of our awesome journey. With perks from a simple high five from us to graffiti in our toilets, meals and hot drinks, you can give something back to less fortunate people and animals.

Swung And Missed
The funds generated will be used towards having a huge party where we will all get very drunk and drown our sorrows LOL.
Seriously though they will be used to reduce our start-up costs and the need to borrow more from the banks.
The reality of failing to reach our target would almost certainly mean us having to find another location as we could not afford to open in this prime retail site without your backing to make it possible.

We really really really hope that this is not the case and we get the opertunity to open in this fantasic location.


Plant A Little Seed In Your Soul
This is a time of great change on our planet. Maybe you have heard people say veganism is a fashion that is trending right now? Well, here at Seeds for the Soul we believe that it's a great fashion to follow and oh my, we just love to be trendy! :-)
We are on an inspiring mission to show people that vegan food is not just 'grass', oh no, it’s so so so much more! What you can make with tasty veggies, nuts, seeds, and beans is actually amazing and the possibilities are limitless! From different kinds of milk to delicious rolls and sandwiches, and vitamin-packed smoothies, to tasty bakes that are actually good for you. Yes, you heard us, it’s not just tasty but it is also packed with vitamins and minerals. And what about all the salads and the soups? We are also very excited to introduce different superfoods to you, from amazing green-blue algae like spirulina and chlorella to super power seeds like hemp and chia.

Good clean food is so important when it comes to good health and happiness, and that is why here at Seeds for the Soul we make it our priority to use the best ingredients available, free from preservatives, chemicals, refined sugar and all sorts of other nasties. We want our food to nurture your body and soul, that’s why we make it with love and care. We use only the best ingredients, many of them organically grown on local farms.
We are on a mission together with other clean eateries to try and reduce the pollution of our beloved planet so that the future generations can still enjoy it and see the beauty of our home. All our takeaway boxes, bags, cups, cutlery, and napkins are 100% biodegradable. And all the waste that we produce when working is composted or recycled daily.
At Seeds For the Soul will offer something different. We will have the following running at our new place:

Mother/Father and baby days
Easy Vegan Cooking classes
Guest speakers
Vegan Meet Ups
A place to hold Vegan events like potlucks, picnics
Free space for young artist to display/sell their work(Roberta is an artist and knows exactly how hard it is to find somewhere to display your artwork)
Completely child-friendly with their own menu, play area and changing facilities 

Half portions available to buy for everyone
Open for dinner
Sell Vegan Wines/Beers

We hope that these stand us out from the crowd and offer something that's a little nicer and makes our place feel more comfortable, welcoming just like home :)
 
Our future vision is to plant 'Seeds for the Soul' in every city of this great country. We want to support and promote natural food, local organic producers, to educate people about the benefits of a vegan diet, and to help keep our planet as clean as we possibly can.
So let's spread love and health to as many people as we possibly can! :-)


Would You Risk It for a Chocolate Biscuit
The one major risk we have is property related, our architect has concerns over the separating ceiling between our unit and the basement below. This has to achieve 1-hour fire separation and reach 57dB of sound insulation. This could be an additional cost if the landlord does not want to pay for these works. I don't have a quote for this as yet as it may not be a problem as we await word back from the landlords and will update once we receive word back.
I suppose the fact that we have never run an eatery/cafe/restaurant before is a risk, but as with every business I have run there is always an element of risk. To combat this we will ensure we have the right people in the right positions, as having the correct team around you is crucial to any businesses success and cannot be under estimated.
We think the biggest risk will, of course, be us eating all of our delicious food ourselves and not making any money lol :)


Can't Fund Our Campaign, You Can Still Help
Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help, there are still plenty of ways to help and support us by doing the following. Pleeeeeeaaaaassssseeee!!!

Spread the word about our compassionate journey and campaign
Which is very easy to do by using the Indiegogo sharing tools
Come along during the build phase and lend a hand, as they say "many hands make light work" or is it just the light switch :)

We wish everyone Love, Peace, Hope and abundance in their lives and would love to see you at our new place once we open.If you got this far Thank You Soooo Much! for taking the time to read our campaign Lots of love from us to you :)

story:
We are a team of Sydney-based entrepreneurs that are excited to bring Australian honey powder directly to you. 

Honey has many powerful benefits over alternatives such as sugar. Our honey can build immunity against pollen, supplies a long-lasting energy boost, contains healthy antioxidants and tastes amazing.

With the current decline in the Australian bee industry, we need to find new and innovative ways to keep bee farmers and their bees working to pollinate flowers and producing honey. This is not only important for the economy, but also for the environment. 

When we discovered this new dehydration technique, the possibilities seemed endless. We are currently producing honey powder and plan to produce honey lozenges. Can you think of any other products or application for honey powder? We'd love to hear from you.

Most importantly, we'd love you to TRY our product and provide us with 

 

Our Team

Karl - Lecturer in Entrepreneurship at Macquarie University; Advisor to the CSIRO on research and business opportunities

Robert - Admitted lawyer and current teacher with a passion for marketing and business development.

Zizhu - Current PhD candidate: Information Systems expert with an intimate knowledge of supply chain management

Yan - Current PhD candidate: IT expert focusing on distribution and marketing

 

Our current plan is to use the money to fund the production of our starting batch of honey. Most importantly, we want to start a conversation with our customers to see how to improve the product and where this honey powder can go.  Buy a test pack and use the honey in any way you want!

What are YOUR ideas for using this honey powder in other products?

story:
Sweet Life Gelato & Cupcake Co

 

Taken quite literally from the Italian expression "La Dolce Vida", Sweet Life embodies everything that is good in life: Family, Friends, Food, and Fun.  Everyone wants to live the Sweet Life! Sweet Life Gelato & Cupcake Co. was incorporated as an LLC in January 2017 with a short list of intentions: 

  • We intend to bring delicious from-scratch baked goods and artisan crated small-batch gelato to SWFL through events, farmer's markets, caterings, and eventually a cafe.
  • We intend to include delicious Gluten-Free, Dairy-Free, and Vegan options for people with special diet restrictions.
  • We intend to give back directly to the local community through charitable contributions, fundraising events, donations, and other means as they become available.
  • We intend to grow as a company and as a brand while never losing sight of the previous three intentions.

Sweet Life Gelato & Cupcake Co was founded by couple Treva Nadreau and Christina Polite after some long conversations and late nights looking at our dreams.  Treva was classically trained in Gelato by Chef Gabriele Scarponi, and quickly became passionate for his work creating signature flavors and recipes for Gelato Lab and Sweet Ginger's Gelato before both businesses closed due to management issues and lack of owner direction.  Crushed, Treva closed the lid on his dream until he could figure out how to once again make a living doing what he loved (and was damn good at!)

Christina is a self-taught baker who decided to start making cupcakes with a stand mixer she got for Christmas and hasn't looked back.  While she has a flair for traditional styles she shines when it comes to blending old world style with modern flavors. One taste of her Pistachio Rose or Lavender with White Chocolate Buttercream cupcakes brings you a subtle notion that we do things a little differently than most. 
 

    What We Need & What You Get

    Now, we got the ball rolling.  We have crude yet adequate equipment but cannot operate as efficiently as we'd like to be able to.  Treva is making his gelato in a small capacity machine and Christina could use a larger mixer to save her a ton of time.  They could both use packaging, a web presence, ingredients, manufacturing equipment, and more.  We set our goal at 10K because we've identified this to be the financial burden of the next step.  Meeting our goal means that we would have all of the equipment that we will need to both manufacture AND sell our gelato and cupcakes to the public at a rate that puts us into a physical building significantly faster, with the majority of our funds being used on the following:

    • Industrial counter top gelato batch freezer, used ($2500)
    • Industrial gelato display case, used, ($2000)
    • Industrial heat treatment machine to properly blend and treat mix, used ($1500)
    • Hitch and trailer to transport for events ($750)
    • Supplies for both production, distribution and storage. (Remaining)
    • Should we manage to blow the lid off of our goal, additional funding will be used to progress to the next step of opening a physical location: Sweet Life Gelato & Cupcake Cafe

    Perks. Perks. Perks.

    Perks come in all forms, from cupcakes & Gelato to helping us pick flavors, or maybe even naming a flavor after you!  Or, if you throw enough of that beautiful green paper our way, maybe some big things can happen!!

    The Impact

    Why us?

    • This business let's us finally escape the rat race and get paid to do what we love, create amazing desserts and give back to the community.
    • You get to be a part of something that gives back. The love you give doesn't stop with us.  We put it in every dessert we make and even sprinkle it throughout the community!
    • We're local!  Christina was born and raised here in Cape Coral and I moved here over 20 years ago from a small sleepy New England town.
    • We love what we do!  Whether it's slaving away in the kitchen, creating new recipes, catering weddings or corporate events, or meeting all kinds of new people, this lifestyle is our passion and allows us to live every day through our values.
    • We have both short and long term visions for the company from start-up home-based, to single unit cafe, to multi-unit expansion, we are looking at this business as an opportunity to grow and explore the possibilities as they come our way.
    • We have business management and operational experience!  Treva has over 20 years of retail and restaurant management experience and has been handling P&L and controlling expenses the whole time!  Christina is an organizational guru who has worked in administrative and office settings, often creating new systems or improving existing ones.  We not only have a dream, but the know how and experience to back it up!

    Risks & Challenges

    There are over 40,000 gelato shops in Italy and less than 2000 in the United States.  Companies that make the machines, ingredients, etc, have been aware of this for years yet 3 out of 4 gelato shops that open in the United States fail to stay open.  Our business model takes the mystery out of gelato by presenting it in  a different way, with design cues and marketing strategies much different than what is currently being used.  I have done my research and I know exactly why these shops fail and what has to be done differently to succeed.  The first step was in diversifying the product by adding baked goods to the offerings. The second step is to educate and inform the public on what gelato is and how it differs from other frozen treats.  The third and most important step is in the marketing and presentation, which I'm not going to discuss openly but am willing to discuss privately at a donor's request and after the proper paperwork has been signed to protect our brand.

    Any way you look at it, cupcakes have been thrust into the mainstream in the last few years, and one stroll down the ice cream aisle at your local grocery store will show you how hard the powers that be are trying to thrust gelato into the mainstream in the US.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

    • Can't donate but still want to give us love? Share, share, share!!  Be a warrior for us!  Help us get the word out to other people who may be able to help us out.  The most important connection for us could be one that you could make happen!!
    • We need help with website and logo design so anyone willing to help out with these would also get all kinds of love from us!

story:
Our Mission

We strive to produce unique high quality goods while operating within standards that are sustainable, low impact and environmentally friendly. We use locally sourced products whenever possible in order to minimize our carbon footprint and strengthen our local community. Curley Brewing Company will house local artisan goods and support many non-profit community groups and organizations that we value. 

 

Who We Are

Nigel Curley (Founder and Master Brewer) Nigel is the founder of Curley Brewing Company. Growing up, he brewed beer with his dad at local facilities. Years later he invested in his own 10 gallon all grain home brew system. After years of creating delicious recipes for friends and family he has decided the time has come to start a public brewery.

Nigel has over ten years of business experience operating his own music school and junk removal company. He is eager to start this new endeavor and advance his knowledge of business management.

Nigel is always researching and testing new trends in the brewing industry. He is constantly working on perfecting his craft.

Kelsey Watkinson (Co-Founder, Baker, and Events Coordinator) Kelsey has been working in the service industry for ten years. She has gained valuable knowledge and experience within the industry.  

Kelsey discovered her passion for baking as a child when she started helping her mother in the kitchen. She has always dreamed of working for herself and starting a small bakery. She began a small side project called The Rabbit Hole where she creates handmade gifts, loose leaf teas, and healthy vegan treats. Kelsey plans to kick things up a notch and devote her time to creating delicious vegan baked goods for Curley Brew Co.’s craft beer café.

Kelsey is a recent graduate from the Recreation and Leisure Services program at Fanshawe College. During her program she took courses on business management, marketing, finance, team building, leadership, and event planning and fundraising. Through her placement at a local not for profit agency, Kelsey discovered her passion for planning events and fundraisers. She hopes to use Curley Brew Co. as a platform for hosting special events and fundraisers.

 

What We Need

We need your help to raise $15,000 for renovations, equipment costs, and licensing fees.

Below is our estimated break down of our estimated expenses:

Brite Tank - $1,500

Beer Bottles - $1,000

Hood Range Ventilation - $2,000

Signage - $2,000

Display Fridge - $1,800

Alcohol Manufacturing License - $3,150

Liquor License - $1,055

Swag - $1,200

Standing Mixer - $600

Glass Washer - $2,000

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can’t contribute, you can still help us by sharing our campaign through social media and by coming to visit us in the future. Help spread the word about London’s first craft beer cafe!
