Concession at Barclay's Center in Brooklyn 
For the past few months, I have had the idea to bring my mobile operation to indoor concessions at sporting arenas. The Barclay's Center in Brooklyn that hosts the Nets, Islanders, and a number of concerts and events throughout the year. After a number of conversations, they seem just as eager to have us at their facility as we are to be there. The only thing holding us back from being there is a lack of capital. 
With your support, we will be one of the first vegan companies be a food vendor at major league sports arenas!
 
ULTIMATE GOAL
If this project really and I mean REALLY takes off,  it will enable me to purchase my own plot of land and create Try Vegan HQ.  I would purchase a farm and build a commercial facility that we can certify vegan and gluten-free where we could produce all of our meals and products as well as a place to store the food trucks. I also plan on farming the land in order to ensure we are providing the highest quality produce while saving carbon emissions for transportation. Being vertically integrated would allow us to ensure quality every step of the way while maintaining the lowest cost possible. We would also create an animal sanctuary on the land to provide animals the life humans deserve to give them. 
 
Referral Program
 
We have also set up a Referral Program as a thank you for your support in sharing our project with others who you think would also like to help support us :)  
Be sure to be logged in when generating your link to receive credit
$500 - If you are within our delivery range, you will receive a complimentary week of meals. If you are outside of our meal delivery range, you will receive a $50 gift card to our online apparel store. 
$1000 - If you are within our delivery range, you will receive 2 weeks of complimentary meals. If you are outside of our meal delivery range, you will receive a $100 gift card to our online apparel store. 
$2500 - If you are within our delivery range, you will receive 1 month of complimentary meals. If you are outside of our meal delivery range, you will receive a $150 gift card to our online apparel store. 
$5000+ Wow, you must be a real influencer! Thank you for all of your support in getting the word out! Aside from 1 month of complimentary meals or a $250 gift card to our apparel store, I would love to have you as a guest on my podcast to share with the world what you are all about -I will be sure to reach out
 
Looking to help further? 
If you have any skills, talents, or think you would be a good fit for the Try Vegan team, feel free to send me an email Info@TryVeganLLC.com

story:
What is Fawesome Foods?

Fawesome Foods is made up of a two-person team—David Dellosa and Scott Kessler, and we’re looking for your help in taking our protein-packed vegan jerky to the next level. 

After adopting plant-based diets in an effort to better our planet, our health, and most importantly end our own contributions to animal cruelty, we thought we could do more. Fawesome Foods was born from our desire to help people transition to a more plant-based diet and thus decrease the exploitation of animals.

We started making our own vegan jerky after finding the current options out there lacked in flavor, texture, and quality ingredients. Our culinary goal from the start was to make a product that was non-gmo, free of preservatives, low in sodium, you get the idea. We spent months and months researching ingredients, developing processes, and testing our recipes. After solidifying 4 different flavors/recipes, we narrowed it down to the top two favorite flavors. The response we’ve received has been overwhelmingly positive, from both herbivores and carnivores. People love the chewy texture, authentic flavor, and option to eat it by itself as a snack or as an add-on to their favorite food.

  • Toasted Sesame Pineapple. Seasoned to perfection with toasted sesame oil, the full flavor of soy sauce, the texture of sesame seeds and just a hint of sweet pineapple.
  • Black Pepper Lime. Some serious spice from a combination of black and cayenne pepper. Subtle notes of lime give it just a hint of sweet.

 

How the Money Will be Used

What began as a passion project in 2016 has evolved into a meaningful business that has us both working nights and weekends on-top of full-time jobs. So far, we have funded Fawesome entirely ourselves. From our initial brainstorm almost two years ago to our most recent trip to the kitchen, every dollar and minute spent on this has been our own. Currently, we’re members of a food business incubator in Cleveland, Ohio—utilizing a shared kitchen space—but we have aspirations of securing our own private commercial kitchen space here in Northeast Ohio. We also hope to purchase our own equipment, produce our new packaging, and continue to grow this business and help people and animals live better lives. Join in, be a botanical builder, and help us change the world for the better. :) Plus, we have some pretty great Fawesome swag to send your way. And if you are unable to contribute at the moment, any help spreading the word is greatly appreciated!

 

Healthy and Delicious!

 

 

Perks!

Check out some of our hand-crafted incentives (besides our jerky) that are available. This first run of t-shirts and screen printed posters are hand made by us for our launch. See the perks to the right and select the one that is right for you. All prices include shipping.

Distressed Tri-Blend Shirts
Pick your size and then show it off! Get one for a friend. Check out our three different vintage style hand-made t-shirt designs below.

"Hell Yeah I'm An Herbivore"
Racer Back Tank—Heather grey, available in XS, S, M, L, XL.
Unisex Tee—Charcoal grey, available in S, M, L, XL, 2X.

 

"Botanically Built"
Racer Back Tank—Heather grey, available in XS, S, M, L, XL.
Unisex Tee—Charcoal grey, available in XS, S, M, L, XL, 2X.

 

"FAWESOME"
Unisex Tee—Charcoal grey, available in XS, S, M, L, XL, 2X.

A few steps in the shirt making process:

 

Trucker Ball Cap—"Botanically Built"
Embroidered tagline and logo with mesh back and snapback in charcoal grey

 

Sticker—"Friends Not Food"
3" sticker to show off your care for our animal friends!

 

Screen Printed Poster—"Friends Not Food"
Hand-made, limited-edition run, 17" x 22" poster, that you can hang proudly to show off your care for our animal friends! Each poster has a unique finish as they are made by yours truly.

A few steps in the poster making process:

 

Embroidered Jacket—"Hell Yeah I'm An Herbivore"
Denim is back, baby! Grab our one-of-a-kind Fawesome denim jackets to wear around town.

story:
Short Summary

My name is Kitzia Kokopelmana, I have devoted the last 20 years to botanical preservation. In 1999 I co~founded Buena Fortuna Gardens in 11 acres in La Ribera, BCS, Mexico. Our Botanical  Garden features over 3000 organically grown plant species from the tropical regions of the world.

Our goal is to Research, preserve, educate and create products of many highly medicinal plants from around the world.

What We Need & What You Get

We are looking for support to

finish the illustrations for the tarot deck and print the book and cards.

 

As a backer you will get

$ 55 to $110 usd One canvas printed from the original paintings of the cards.

$111 usd Tarot book and cards. One set

$ 1111 or more. You will get your name mentioned in the acknowledgement section of the book as one of the sponsors for the printing. Plus a book and cards.

 

The Impact

Our goal is to contribute to the overall health of people in the local and international community to strength the good health against the most common illness of these times. 

At Buena Fortuna Gardens we host educational workshops and healing retreats. Integrating more healing plants will help to raise awareness towards the natural healing benefits or organically grown edible and medicinal plants.

The sale of the printed copies will create a source of income to preserve Buena Fortuna Living Seed Bank in Baja California Sur, Mexico.

Risks & Challenges

For the last 20 years i have devoted my life to the preservation of Botanical Diversity, as a single mother of 3 children I have been able to continue fundraising with landscape consultations, botanical garden tours and organic meals. With this project i envision i can create an additional source of income to support the Living Seed Bank while educating and sharing the wealth of information i have discovered over the years.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to make a financial contribution, please share this project with others.

Thank you for your support!

Kitzia Kokopelmana

story:
Short Summary

  • Hi! I'm Cody Castiglia, the Chef/Owner of Della Terra. I grew up in a family of chefs and foodies in Western New York, then earned degrees in culinary arts and hotel and restaurant management. I then gained hands on experience by working in high-volume catering as well as intimate, fine-dining, James Beard Award-recognized restaurants throughout New York and Texas.
  • Last year, I moved to the Seattle area to finally be in the same city as my lovely (then-girlfriend) wife, Lia. Della Terra started up soon after, and we now live and work in our dream town, the charming Historic Downtown Snohomish. With Della Terra, I aim to merge the experiences I've had with my own flavors and creations, providing truly farm-to-table dining and warm hospitality to groups of all sizes. I'm SO eager to continue to share all that I have learned from my family, my education and my experiences working under some of the best farm-to-table chefs throughout the country.

  • Meaning “from the earth”, Della Terra ventures include catering, cooking classes, and events, all staying true to the philosophy of using the best ingredients available from the local harvest. This allows us to be creative with the vast bounty we have available in the Northwest, resulting in better tasting and better-for-you food. We source the majority of our ingredients from within the community from local farms and producers, many of which are located just miles from our kitchen in Snohomish.

  • I believe that through real, local food and warm hospitality, we can make a substantial impact on our local economy, community and the environment at-large. Outlined below are a few ways in which we have achieved this, and how we plan to continue in this pursuit.

  • We have an upcoming incredible opportunity to obtain and renovate a kitchen of our own, in our beloved Historic Downtown Snohomish. But we need your help! If you believe in our mission and vision as a business, would you consider joining with us on this journey, and supporting this next chapter however you are able?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • We are seeking $35,000 in funds to launch Della Terra's transition into a culinary kitchen of our own. 

  • Della Terra has been operating out of the Hungry Pelican restaurant as a commissary kitchen. Unfortunately, the owner of the Hungry Pelican, closed operations last year, due to a family tragedy. To stay in Snohomish and keep operating as a business, we assumed the building's lease. The next step is to purchase the existing equipment and renovate a bit to fit the needs of our business.

  • We will use the funds to purchase the existing equipment and (if we reach our entire goal) renovate the space a bit to fit our business needs: more cooking equipment to be able to take on larger events, furthering our mission to support local farms, and providing an inviting and comfortable space for cooking classes & events. 

  • We are SO excited to be able to offer an incredible line-up of edible, enjoyable, or experiential perks and gifts for your contribution, all of which, in line with our business, represent our region well.

Where We've Been

  • Della Terra started with $10 and ten years of dreams, education, experience. The goal was to fill the niche for a truly farm-to-table caterer and to provide authentic, warm hospitality to our community. This has quickly come true, as we have served guests in the areas of professional athletic events, weddings, corporate and family functions, and developed a pop up dinner and cooking class program that has featured local, seasonal ingredients and built a sense of community in our area.
  • Tremendous amount of thought has gone into the details of our business plan and the sourcing of each ingredient, as to benefit the local community, economy, and environment.
  • Della Terra is not only “from the earth”, but we strive to be “for the earth” as well. The majority of our ingredients are sourced from within the community, with preference to small, family farms. Our dedication to sourcing locally means that not only are the ingredients as fresh as possible, but they also have less impact on the environment than sourcing from elsewhere. We are dedicated to using Non-GMO and organic ingredients, providing containers and utensils that are recyclable or compostable, and striving for zero waste.
  • We’re also committed to growing our local community economically. Our motto is “Community Over Competition”. We believe in partnering with other local businesses, in an effort to learn and grow together. This enables both parties to share in knowledge, exposure, and to develop a sense of team. Operating in Snohomish has been an excellent opportunity to work with local businesses, including ranchers, cheesemakers, winemakers, many of which are right down the road.
  • We have also had the pleasure of impacting our community socially. We believe that small business is best used as a vessel to give back to the local community. We have had the opportunity over the last year to partner with many programs that give back, specifically in the areas of hunger and homelessness, and organizations that support local farming.
  • Through our cooking class program, we have created a sense of community, empowering our neighbors to cook real food using local and seasonal ingredients. Featuring recipes that are easy to replicate at home, the classes are hands-on, fun, and engaging. The cooking classes are led by a deep and diverse line-up of chef-instructors, who all have incredible education and experience to bring to the table. Our guests take with them not only recipes, but techniques and confidence to create fresh, mouth-watering dishes at home. Our cooking classes have become increasingly popular, and have caught the eye and taste buds of the local media, as we have been featured in 425 Magazine, Everett Daily Herald, Basil & Salt Magazine, Eat Stay Love, and more.
  • We are inspired by the “Slow Food Movement”, which started in Torino, Italy. Slow Food encourages taking time to prepare meals from scratch and share them with family and friends. It was started as an alternative to fast food and, as such, strives to preserve traditional and regional cuisine, advocating for the farming of plants, seeds, and livestock characteristic of local ecosystems. We believe that dining together comforts people and builds community.
  • Our cooking classes, catering, and events have caught the eye and taste buds of the local media, as we have recently been featured in 425 Magazine, Everett Daily Herald, Basil & Salt Magazine, Eat Stay Love, and more.

  • We've grown the business very conservatively, purchasing only what's needed for each week, and operating without debt or investors, but now it's clear that we will need additional funding to take the business to the next level. For the second half of 2017 and much of this year, I have been working three other part time jobs to make ends meet personally and for the business, while paying for start up costs to launch the business out of pocket. Each month we're learning and growing, as we figure out how to build trust in the community, increase revenue, cut costs and book consistent business. 

Where We're Going

We have an upcoming incredible opportunity to obtain and renovate a kitchen of our own, in our beloved Historic Downtown Snohomish. But we need your help! The project, in total, will cost at least $35,000.

When faced with the options of funding the opportunity, none of the predictable options sounded like the best fit for our long term goals and mission for the business. 

It was important to us to start the business virtually debt free, and free of other investors that may wish to deter Della Terra in it’s core mission and vision, in favor of increasing profits.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • We understand that not everyone can contribute large amounts. We would be so grateful for any support, or simply sharing this page with friends or family via e-mail or social media, or just by considering us for any future catering or event needs.

story:
Hey all!

My name is Rochelle, and as a beauty professional, entrepreneur, and fitness enthusiast, I could not be any more excited than I am to talk to you about Beautylixirs today. I tried countless beverage products over the years, and all fell short in one way or another, failing to give my body the support it needs that would enhance beauty and physical performance.   Everything I tried caused jitters, headaches, and was a sugar overload. To top things off, most of these products were even excessively high in calories. No thanks!

So, why is Beautylixirs different? Beautylixirs will provide you not only the inner boost you need but also a light refreshing taste. Conducting extensive and rigorous research, I have developed Beautylixirs with the help of a group of skilled beverage architects and sourced the highest quality of Ayurvedic / Organic Ingredients possible. Beautylixirs contain minerals and vitamins, chromium picolinate, B12, and zinc, all ingredients that will boost your energy and optimize your hair, skin, and mental health. With Beautylixirs, you can expect more from your water! There are no preservatives inside my product – guaranteed!

 

Our Herbal extracts benefits:

MAXIMIZE HAIR, SKIN AND NAILS, HIGH IN ANTIOXIDANTS, INCREASE ENERGY, BOOST BRAIN POWER, INCREASE METABOLISM TO HELP BURN FAT, IMMUNE HEALTH

Organic Green Tea extract(High Potency 45% EGCG & 75% Polyphenol Catechins) 

https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/26093535

Organic Yerba Mate extract-

https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/m/pubmed/18034743/

Ayurvedic Guggul extract- Known for its Anti-Aging properties, Guggul is one of the oldest Ayurvedic herbs that is mostly found in the Indian subcontinent. The term ‘guggul’ in Sanskrit means “protect against diseases”

https://www.selfhacked.com/blog/guggul-health-b...

https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/m/pubmed/25025986/...

Other key Ingredients:

B12- Increase energy production

https://ods.od.nih.gov/factsheets/VitaminB12-Co...

Biotin- Plays an important role in the vitality of your hair, skin and nails.

https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/m/pubmed/19727438/

Zinc- is a important mineral that will boost immunity.  

https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/m/pubmed/9701160/

Folate, Folic Acid-

https://www.medicinenet.com/folic_acid_the_bene...

Beautylixirs are available in three flavors: BlackBerry Sage, BlueBerry Watermelon, and Raspberry Acai. 

 

 

What We Need & What You Get

Right now, we have come to you, on Indiegogo, for help raising the funds that we need to get the Beautylixirs brand out to a worldwide audience. Rochelle, leading our team into the future, is prepared to do whatever it takes to make this brand work, and our current funding goal is $18,500. To show our appreciation for your crucial support at this moment, we are offering some exciting rewards for all our contributors, including early access to bottles of Beautylixirs and big discounts on larger orders! 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

In addition to making a monetary contribution, you can help us with this campaign by sharing our campaign link on Instagram, Facebook, Twitter, and any other social media platforms you use. Spread the word! We appreciate all your support, and we thank you for your time.

 

Don't just take our word for it

As women we must look after ourselves and be mindful of the things that we are consuming.  Green tea is on my list of “go to drinks”.  It is packed full of antioxidants and minerals, and studies have proven it’s consumption increases brain function, lowers anxiety levels, and helps to improve your overall mood.  The most important benefit that I see as a health care professional is that is reduces the risk of heart disease, which is the leading cause of death of women in the United States.  

~L. Holloway, DC

 

Zinc is an essential mineral that is often underestimated.  It is a powerful immunity booster that helps to fight off the common cold, aids in the wound healing process and can help combat age related muscular degeneration. 

~L. Holloway, DC

 

Yerba Mate has a long tradition of medicinal uses and proven health benefits.  It is an energy boosting powerhouse that is chocked full of vitamins, minerals and antioxidants. Yerba Mate is a healthy replacement for caffeinated drinks such as coffee and soda.  Here is my favorite part….. Yerba Mate has been scientifically proven to help with weight loss!

~L. Holloway, DC

 

“B12 is needed in the human body to produce healthy red blood cells, maintain a normal neurologic function, and DNA synthesis.  So, to break this down in terms of understanding, B12 is needed for energy, concentration, cognitive functions, balance and gait. Taking B12 in the recommended dose and form can prevent Vitamin B12 deficiency and malabsorption. “

~Kennosa Gunn MSN-Ed, BSN, RN

 

“Biotin is a B7 vitamin that is needed for metabolism, nerve, and cardiovascular function and most importantly healthy hair, nail and skin protection.  Biotin can aid in younger looking skin by preventing acne, dry and flaky skin.  It also plays a vital role in hair growth by preventing brittle, dry and flaky scalp that can cause breakage and damage.  Biotin strengthens your hair follicles promoting healthy hair growth.  Dry, cracking, thinning and splitting of nails can benefit from biotin supplementation producing healthier and stronger nails. “

~Kennosa Gunn MSN-Ed, BSN, RN

 

" The first step in living our best life is proper nutrition. Being active doesn't always provide time to allow us to take in all the nutrients we need. Beautylixirs provides the perfect blend of vitamins and nutrients to keep you looking and feeling your best on the go."

~Anna Edwards 

Dotfit Certified Fitness Professional

story:
Beloved kuaʻāina (fishers, farmers and people of the land throughout the islands) near and dear to Hawaiʻi nei have prepared and generously donated big, beautiful bottles of their special recipe chili pepper waters--for our fundraiser auction and for your table! Your generous winning bid is a donation to KUA and helps make our shared work possible. We are seeking to raise $10,000 by January 5, 2019. Click here to check out the auction and make your bid! 

http://kuahawaii.org/pakipika-auction/

New bottles will go up for auction each week, so stay tuned!

Fridge already full? You can also make a gift directly:  hit the pink "back it" button above to back this fundraiser, and grab some great PAKIPIKA swag as a mahalo from us to you!

ʻO ka wā kēia ʻo ka ʻono la...
Now is the delicious time…

 

TWO WAYS TO GIVE: BID or BACK IT

Bid:  Go to the auction and put a bid on the bottles you like! Auction closes Dec 26, 2018.

Back: Donate directly to this fundraiser on this indiegogo campaign by clicking the pink "BACK IT" button or selecting a perk. Back this fundraiser and get PAKIPIKA perks our mahalo to you!

All proceeds support grassroots kuaʻāina action around the islands.

 

ABOUT THE LOGO/ARTWORK

We want to shout out a HUGE mahalo to Keola Rapozo, co-founder of FITTED Hawaii, who designed the logos/artwork for this PAKIPIKA fundraiser. Playing on a 90s vibe, the logos are intended to evoke a sense of joy, funk, and spice. The concentric shapes symbolize source, safety, and the ripples out of abundance. And also, some inspiration from Wu-Tang Clan. 

With strong support from the local community, FITTED has established itself as a world renowned and respected brand. The flagship FITTED store is located in the heart of Honolulu, Hawai’i, across the street from world famous Ala Moana Shopping Center and its beaches. FITTED has matured from a simple hat brand into a fully-fledged clothing company that produces t-shirts, accessories, and outerwear. A large attribute of FITTED’s success is the exclusivity and unique story behind each product, pulling from Hawaiian history and culture. www.fittedhawaii.com

if you don’t plant seeds
it won’t be forever

 

WHY YOUR GIFT MATTERS

Your donation goes to power this work. KUA is a movement-building non-profit connecting fishers, farmers, rural community leaders and others across the islands caring for Hawaiian land and ocean resources. A major connection for us all is the ʻono of our ‘āina — all that is delicious from our places, our craving for it, and a shared vision of abundance. Abundance in food, but also abundance in joy, in connection, in water, in beauty, in time, in community and personal power! ʻĀina MOMONA. (Mo’ momona, yo.)

Your gift helps bring it all together.

We are seeking to raise $10,000 by January 5, 2019. These funds will provide critical seed funds to help community ideas get rolling, including things like strategic support for community advocacy where needed and helping folks get projects in the ground through collaborative work days. Your gift to this work helps our hui stay nimble, focused and self-determined.

story:
Ralph Madril was born and raised here in Pueblo and is now raising his family in his home town. He works long hours to pay the bills and make a better life for his family.  Ralph is described as a family man and everyone’s friend; he would do as much as he could for anyone who asked for help.   Not afraid of stepping out to achieve his dreams, he is ready to take a big chance.

Ralph is looking to open a food truck which serves gourmet burgers and sandwiches with a twist.  Possible menu items include fajita burgers, the B.L.D. (breakfast, lunch, dinner), and the club burger. He has several great ideas though, and plans to have many creative food options.

A graduate of Central High School and Pueblo Community College, Ralph holds a double degree in Culinary Arts Production and Management.  His schooling has taught him the ins and outs of the food industry, but his skill comes naturally.  Ralph says, “When I realized how much others enjoyed my cooking and saw the smiles and enjoyment on their faces, I knew cooking was my calling.”  12 years of management at his current employer has taught him the ins and outs of business, to complement his natural culinary talent. 

With the combination of Ralph’s business knowledge, cooking skill, and big heart, this business is the real deal.  Ralph is a home-town guy trying to help his family and the community grow in a positive way.  He could easily take his skills to a bigger city, but he wants to give back to the town he calls home. 

Help this eager, small-business owner get his start.  No donation is too small, and all is greatly appreciated.

story:
The whole concept of Willard's comes from what I would say are two things I've always valued.

Ice Cream and people.  

So many of my earliest memories involve standing in line after t-ball, trips to hutches after Ticat games, or just sitting with family and friends with a big bowl of ice cream, and I mean big.

As far back as I can remember I have loved ice cream.  Something about the deliciously cold taste has always captured my heart but right alongside that has been my love for people and community.  I firmly believe there is nothing better than sharing laughs and ice cream with those you love.

So when I got a small ice cream machine for my birthday it was only natural that I wanted to share my experiments with others.  Creating unique and different flavours- always trying to find something new and finding ways to allow all to enjoy it; making both traditional ice cream and vegan dairy-free options to bring smiles to everyone.

As this passion grew I wanted to see where it could lead.  So two years ago I started selling through local businesses and now with my wife, we want to take on the next experiment and open up a shop of our own.

After searching we have found a place to call home - in the city we love, surrounded by the community we love - finding a way to celebrate those two loves once more.

And spread what I have always known.

That sometimes its okay to eat your feelings 

Whether it's a celebration of something good, or finding comfort through the rough times, Willard's wants to be with you through both. We want to join you through it all to bring a smile, a laugh or even just a little bit of comfort.

We value community, simplicity and creativity and hope to see all three reflected in every scoop of ice cream and every smile brought to someone's face.  From simple ingredients to simple joys we aim to help people come together over food - deeply believing that good food often breeds good community.

With creative flavours we hope to inspire creativity in others, in whatever form that may take.  To us, this is much more than just a business but something in which we hope to make a difference in this city, even if it is just a smile.

So with that, we're asking for your help.  We've poured our hearts, our energy, and money into this and would love to join with the greater Hamilton community - our family, our friends and our future friends to help make this a reality. 

Why we need your help

From the very beginning Willard's has been about more than just ice cream.  It's been about being a part of something bigger, about creating community.  Without the support of businesses and people in Hamilton, Willard's would never have existed.  From starting out in the Kitchen Collective making food with other businesses in the city, to the support given by the businesses that carry our product, to the friends who encouraged us, did our branding ,and supported us every step of the way- we didn't do this on our own.  

We're hoping we can rely on that help again.

Renovations are expensive, commercial ones more so.  We've gone all in on this; Buying the building, doing the early labour ourselves, getting grants and loans in addition to our own money. We're committed to this long term.

With all that being said, If you're going to partner with us you deserve to know where the money is going.

Indiegogo fees - 8% of funds raised - $800

Permits, Architect fees, etc - $8000

Renovation costs- $70000

Equipment costs -$20000 - Range, Dipping cabinet, Exhaust Hood, Freezer, Prep Tables

As you can see, the money raised here is just a fraction of what's being put into the space so even if we don't make our goal we're pushing forward - but hope to do it with a bit less burden in terms of what we owe, all while giving you guys great rewards to say thanks for your help.

From delicious ice cream, both dairy and vegan, to sweet products like pins and shirts to creative ice cream experiences we want to make this worth it and say thank you for all of your support.

Every bit can help

Having helped run the Kitchen Collective campaign that had almost 200 backers and raised $22000 we've seen first hand what a difference the support of a community can be.  The Kitchen Collective wouldn't exist without this support and now it is thriving and providing great opportunities in the community and we hope to do the same. We want Willard's to be more than an ice cream shop but to be a place for people to laugh, connect and build friendships.

Risks & Challenges

This has been a journey.  We've already been working on the space for months and have the design done, done demolition, and it's tiring and stressful - but ultimately will be worth it.

We're sure there are hurdles and obstacles along the way but we believe we've got the right people to support us and to make this dream a reality.

More than money

This campaign is more than just about money (though it's huge help).  If you're not able to help please share this campaign, tell your friends and family- both about the campaign and the store when it opens. 

Help us spread more joy.

story:
Meet SymBowl & Find Your Inner Flavor

SymBowl is a healthy, fast-casual restaurant located in Kirkwood, Chesterfield and St. Charles that focuses on specialty diets such as gluten-free, anti-inflammatory, vegan, paleo and more. SymBowl also offers whole fruit smoothies and fresh juices made to order. The customizable menu utilizes healthy recipes for a fresh, whole-food meal.  Since opening in 2012, we have evolved into a crazy, quirky hybrid: part juice and smoothie bar, part fast-casual “steam-fry” shop.

Over arching all of this is our commitment to using whole food ingredients, local products and providing great versatility in our menu. We are the place that uses ingredients from the “perimeter” of the grocery store.

We have developed auto immune protocol friendly dressings and sauces that incorporate global, fresh flavors pleasing to all customers. Our goal is for our customers following restrictive, healing protocols to be able to enjoy dinner at home with their families.  No more stress of preparing two meals or feeling left out.  

The first two products we are determined to make widely available are the No Tomato Pasta Sauce and the No Tomato BBQ sauce.  Kate from The Bejuled Life makes a quick dinner with her kids using our Pasta Sauce here.  

What makes our products different? Check out these ingredient lists:

Pasta Sauce: Carrot, Beet, Onion, Garlic, Raisin, Salt, Lemon, Basil 

BBQ Sauce: Raisin, Onion, Garlic, Celery, Cinnamon, Sea Salt, Clove, Beet, Carrot, Apple Cider Vinegar

Find Your Inner Flavor is much more than a line of sauces and dressings used in our SymBowl restaurants.  It is an educational and community building platform that Greg and Becky use to connect customers with information, experts, opportunities and methods of healing.  Check out our podcasts featuring a variety of guests at our YouTube channel. 

We know the difference we have made in the lives of our St. Louis community.  Through Yelp, Facebook and other social media we have met many travelers that "wish there was a SymBowl in my city!"  The need for lifestyle food is increasing and we can begin our eventual journey across the country with our product line of sauces.  

What We Need & What You Get

We need $30,000 to begin to test-batch, bottle our sauces and distribute on a larger scale.  Our sauces are made of whole foods, no pre-packaged purees.  We have had a challenging time finding packers and suppliers that can help us scale our sauce production to the next level, but we are getting there.  

Chef Gregory Owens has been developing sauces and trouble shooting the distribution process while overseeing the 3 current SymBowl locations and contributing to Find Your Inner Flavor podcasts.  Our Crowdfund will allow Greg to focus on recipe development and streamlining the product line.  

Perks

Our Crowdfund Perks are unique to SymBowl & Find Your Inner Flavor and will please our current customer base and new Symbowl/Find Your Inner Flavor fans.  Customers can enjoy full sized bottles of our sauces, special Ambassador status at Symbowl restaurants or opportunities to spend personal time with Chef Greg & Becky.  You can also donate to the National Kidney Foundation on behalf of Wes, one of our Chef/Managers.  You can check out his story on our podcast!

If Find Your Inner Flavor does not reach the entirety of our $30,000 crowdfunding goal, we will devote all funds to our original mission of developing, production and distribution of our existing product line, but to a smaller audience.  We opened our first restaurant with $300 left in our checking account and we made it work.  We have expanded slowly and surely over the years, avoiding multiple opportunities to take food quality short cuts that would have saved us money, but we stuck to our mission and we made it work.  We will continue to make it work, but with your support we can flourish on a faster and larger scale! 

We need your support! We know we can make a difference. It happens each and every day in our restaurants. We appreciate any donations to our Crowdfund and we appreciate all social media shares, or personal invitations to contribute.  If you have a story that resonates with our mission of food as medicine, please share it! Plant a seed with friends and family that they have the power to live differently through daily choices.  

Continue letting us know how we can help you to eat well and live well! Our restaurant and products have evolved to meet your needs and we will keep growing! 

SymBowl is interested in meeting investors with a passion for making this change.  If you have any questions or would like to reach out, you can find us at:

becky@mysymbowl.com OR  greg@mysymbowl.com
story_txt:
Meet SymBowl & Find Your Inner Flavor
SymBowl is a healthy, fast-casual restaurant located in Kirkwood, Chesterfield and St. Charles that focuses on specialty diets such as gluten-free, anti-inflammatory, vegan, paleo and more. SymBowl also offers whole fruit smoothies and fresh juices made to order. The customizable menu utilizes healthy recipes for a fresh, whole-food meal.  Since opening in 2012, we have evolved into a crazy, quirky hybrid: part juice and smoothie bar, part fast-casual “steam-fry” shop.
Over arching all of this is our commitment to using whole food ingredients, local products and providing great versatility in our menu. We are the place that uses ingredients from the “perimeter” of the grocery store.
We have developed auto immune protocol friendly dressings and sauces that incorporate global, fresh flavors pleasing to all customers. Our goal is for our customers following restrictive, healing protocols to be able to enjoy dinner at home with their families.  No more stress of preparing two meals or feeling left out.  
The first two products we are determined to make widely available are the No Tomato Pasta Sauce and the No Tomato BBQ sauce.  Kate from The Bejuled Life makes a quick dinner with her kids using our Pasta Sauce here.  
What makes our products different? Check out these ingredient lists:
Pasta Sauce: Carrot, Beet, Onion, Garlic, Raisin, Salt, Lemon, Basil 
BBQ Sauce: Raisin, Onion, Garlic, Celery, Cinnamon, Sea Salt, Clove, Beet, Carrot, Apple Cider Vinegar
Find Your Inner Flavor is much more than a line of sauces and dressings used in our SymBowl restaurants.  It is an educational and community building platform that Greg and Becky use to connect customers with information, experts, opportunities and methods of healing.  Check out our podcasts featuring a variety of guests at our YouTube channel. 
We know the difference we have made in the lives of our St. Louis community.  Through Yelp, Facebook and other social media we have met many travelers that "wish there was a SymBowl in my city!"  The need for lifestyle food is increasing and we can begin our eventual journey across the country with our product line of sauces.  
What We Need & What You Get

We need $30,000 to begin to test-batch, bottle our sauces and distribute on a larger scale.  Our sauces are made of whole foods, no pre-packaged purees.  We have had a challenging time finding packers and suppliers that can help us scale our sauce production to the next level, but we are getting there.  
Chef Gregory Owens has been developing sauces and trouble shooting the distribution process while overseeing the 3 current SymBowl locations and contributing to Find Your Inner Flavor podcasts.  Our Crowdfund will allow Greg to focus on recipe development and streamlining the product line.  
Perks
Our Crowdfund Perks are unique to SymBowl & Find Your Inner Flavor and will please our current customer base and new Symbowl/Find Your Inner Flavor fans.  Customers can enjoy full sized bottles of our sauces, special Ambassador status at Symbowl restaurants or opportunities to spend personal time with Chef Greg & Becky.  You can also donate to the National Kidney Foundation on behalf of Wes, one of our Chef/Managers.  You can check out his story on our podcast!
If Find Your Inner Flavor does not reach the entirety of our $30,000 crowdfunding goal, we will devote all funds to our original mission of developing, production and distribution of our existing product line, but to a smaller audience.  We opened our first restaurant with $300 left in our checking account and we made it work.  We have expanded slowly and surely over the years, avoiding multiple opportunities to take food quality short cuts that would have saved us money, but we stuck to our mission and we made it work.  We will continue to make it work, but with your support we can flourish on a faster and larger scale! 
We need your support! We know we can make a difference. It happens each and every day in our restaurants. We appreciate any donations to our Crowdfund and we appreciate all social media shares, or personal invitations to contribute.  If you have a story that resonates with our mission of food as medicine, please share it! Plant a seed with friends and family that they have the power to live differently through daily choices.  
Continue letting us know how we can help you to eat well and live well! Our restaurant and products have evolved to meet your needs and we will keep growing! 
SymBowl is interested in meeting investors with a passion for making this change.  If you have any questions or would like to reach out, you can find us at:
becky@mysymbowl.com OR  greg@mysymbowl.com

story:
Short Summary

My name is Alphonzo Cross and I am the owner/operator of Parlor Cocktail Den located in downtown Atlanta, GA.  With over 25 years of experience in retail sales, commercial property management, hospitality management, & general project management, I moved to Atlanta, GA and co-founded (with my sister) The Boxcar Grocer in an underserved community.  The Boxcar Grocer was a healthy corner market that sold quality food products and flourished before closing its doors in 2015.  The following year I launched Quintessential, a brand development company that concepts, brands, and executes integrated boutique hospitality experiences. In 2017, we hosted a 5-part speaker series titled, “Hospitality & Retail in the New Atlanta" before launching Quintessential’s first brand Parlor in 2018.  Over the last decade I have worked with our community to redefine the landscape of one of Atlanta’s most unique neighborhoods, Castleberry Hill, and continue to push for the positive development of our community.  

Our campaign is about growing the business and scaling the brand up.  We are looking to move from our 800 sq. ft. space into a space that is 2,000+ sq. ft.  By moving into a larger space it would allow us to build out a kitchen, have a larger bar, and triple our seating capacity for guests.  While this would all equal increasing our revenue, it also means being able to employee 3-4 times as many people from our community, work with more artists of color, engage with more musicians, and collaborate with more culinary professionals.  All of this engagement would ultimately allow us to be a blueprint for black-owned hospitality in Atlanta and a beacon of inspiration for food & beverage everywhere, while positively affecting the long-term development of our community.

Our Goal

Our goal with this campaign is to raise $750K.  The funds will be used to:

 $600,000 – Project Development, Design & Construction

$100,000 – Restructure Current Debt

$50,000 – Operating Expenses

Our Thanks To You

Contributors will receive:

Donations of $100 - $1000

~ Recognition in our monthly newsletter

~ 2 Complimentary cocktails during an evening of your choosing

Donations of $1001 - $10,000

~ Recognition in our monthly newsletter

~ 3 Months free access to our Social Club

Donations of $10,001 - $50,000

~ Recognition in our monthly newsletter

~ Complimentary food & cocktails for 2 for an evening

~ 3 Months free access to our Social Club

Donations of $50,000 - $100,000

~ Recognition in our monthly newsletter

~ Complimentary food & cocktails for 4 for an evening

~ 6 Months free access to our Social Club

Donations of $100,001 +

~ Recognition in our monthly newsletter

~ Private dinner for 2 with the owner, chef, and bartender

~ Lifetime free access to our Social Club

Parlor's Impact

We believe that Parlor has the tremendous opportunity to positively change the landscape of the hospitality industry for African-Americans in Atlanta. Part of our business model is to be a springboard for Black chefs, cooks, bartenders, artists, musicians, and various vendors to be seen, heard, and experienced.  This is something we successfully accomplished with The Boxcar Grocer during which time we were the first retailer to showcase products like Chuice beverages, Southern Culture pancake mix, and Just Add Honey tea products (just to name a few). 

Also, just like The Boxcar Grocer, Parlor acts as a meet up space for people in our community that allows them to feel safe, relaxed, and have access to individuals they might not normally get an opportunity to meet in their daily circles. For many communities of color, safe SPACE is a valuable, and sometimes rare, commodity that serves as community center, networking platform, political engagement hub, and social arena.  This is what transpired with The Boxcar Grocer and THIS is what happens when people walk through the doors of Parlor.  People engage with people.

Risks & Challenges

As with any new venture, there are risks & challenges to realizing the full potential of the project.  We know that brand awareness and brand connectivity will be our largest challenge as this is a national campaign and we are a very local brand here in Atlanta. But while we know many people have not heard of us, we believe that it’s exactly this kind of hyper local focus that makes us unique.  Our story is not uncommon, as many local brands can be more helpful & impactful in their communities with a wider swath of national support behind them. There are many local businesses that can serve as a lighthouse of inspiration for their communities and fellow business owners by being better capitalized and having access to resources that allow them to flourish with a proper team and operation in places.  Our ability to overcome this hurdle will be guided by intimate brand storytelling and getting in front of the right people. We are confident that once people understand who we are and what we are trying to accomplish we will accomplish our goal.  This will be done by way of intentional social media outreach, on-site communications, a strong online presence, and making sure that we continue to tell our compelling story.

Other Ways YOU Can Help

Posting instructions for Instagram: 

Please place the IndieGoGo link in your bio.

#parlorv2

#blackmoneymatters

#buildblackwealth

#buybacktheblock

#let'swin

Please place the IndieGoGo link in the caption.

story:
What is Waffle-lot?

Seriously, who doesn't love Waffles? That's where Waffle Lot started, Just a pure love of the deliciousness and versatility of waffles. They can be a breakfast, lunch, or dinner item, and and that's what Waffle Lot wants to build on.

My name is Marcel, and I'm a co-owner of Waffle Lot.  I'm honestly just a normal person that has always had a passion for cooking for people and providing smiles. In the small amount of time Waffle Lot has been active its provided just that; food and smiles.

Our campaign is just a way for kickstarting Waffle Lot to achieve its ultimate goal of opening a small cafe where people can come relax and enjoy waffles at any time of day. For now, we'll settle for a place where we can sell you waffles on the go, so you can enjoy a quick bite as you go about your day. Our $5,000 goal is a small goal to help us with the different licenses we need, some more supplies, and even provide us with the ability to market our business further.

Waffle Lot has a ton of awesome plans including unique menu items and events. Remember, Waffle Lot was founded on the premise of spreading happiness through our food. To do this we will be giving back to those in need in two special ways. First, Waffle Lot will help feed the hungry by donating unsold food. Secondly, we will be donating a portion of our special event proceeds to schools.

Overall Waffle Lot wants to provide smiles, food, and a warm welcoming environment, unlike most big brand restaurants. We want to see people as excited about each waffle as we are. So please feel free to donate any amount to help our cause. Visit our facebook page or our Instagram page and give us a like. We appreciate anything you can do for us.

story:
Dishwasher Safe

 
 
 
 
 

A Word From The Founder

 

 

 
 
We have teamed up with artist Jonah Allen to design packaging that we believe is truly a work of art.  These tubes are not only beautiful but also free of plastic!
 
You can see more of Jonah's work at his site:
jonahallen.com (opens in new window)
 
 

 

 

Why shouldn't you be able to customize the colors of the straws that you want to carry?  

 

Turn your straws into telastrås.  Decide how long you want your straw to be!  

 
 
 
The lastrå clip allows you to attach your lastrå kit to a bag, coat, clothes, anything you want to secure it to.  
 
 
 
 
You asked us for an additional pipe cleaner, we couldn't say no! 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 

 

 
 
 
Inspire change by offering beautiful and brag-worthy alternatives to disposable plastics, and support the removal of plastics from the oceans.

 

 

 
 
One thing that excites me even more than setting lastrå free to the world is the potential that this release has to bring about lasting change.  Once the company is established, we will launch the Ocean Clean Up Program where the lastrå community will see the true power of the dollar.  A percentage of each lastrå sale will go towards ocean clean up and towards preventing more plastics from entering our oceans and waterways.  
 

The program will focus on supporting and backing programs that have already been proven successful.  We will also lobby cities, states, governments, and countries to enact legislation to stop the ever-increasing flow of plastics into landfills and the oceans.  

Arix Zalace - lastrå Founder

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 
 
 

 

 

 

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest risk and challenge that we face is not being able to deliver these products to you before Christmas.  We believe that we can accomplish this with your help.  That does not change the realities of manufacturing.  Things can sometimes take longer, or problems can arise which will slow the process.  We promise to communicate often.

 

 

 

Corporate or Business Christmas Gifts

What would be a better gift for your employees this year than a lastrå straw set?  Want to give lastrå sets out to your employees for Christmas?  Contact us and we can arrange a larger custom perk for you.

 

 

 

The lastrå promise

At lastrå we promise to always focus on forward-thinking projects.  Projects that not only offer beautiful and brag-worthy alternatives, but projects that are structured to go a step further and give back to help eliminate the problem each product was designed to address.  

 

 

Will eliminating plastic straws really make a difference?

Yes, it can!  I have a personal story to share that will help to drive this point home.  Years ago I invented a product designed to help protect sea turtles.  Living along the coast of Florida we have a sea turtle nesting season.  During this season female turtles will swim along the coastline looking for a dark beach on which to lay their eggs.  Any confusing light cues can cause her to abandon the nesting attempt.  Our turtle nesting season happens to coincide with the peak of our tourist season, so we have a lot of visitors in town who know nothing about sea turtles or their needs.  Many of these visitors go down to the beaches at night with flashlights in order to look for ghost crabs and other critters.  These flashlights are enough to confuse a female turtle wanting to nest.  I invented a special filter that you can stick to the lens of any flashlight, and it will filter out all the wavelengths of light that nocturnal animals see with their specialized eyes.  The remaining wavelengths of light are still visible to the human eye, but are not visible to the nocturnal animal.

When I first released the product many people questioned whether the flashlight filters could really have an impact on the nesting habits of sea turtles.  As organizations around the world slowly began to adopt and offer the filters to their communities there was an unintended bonus that occurred.  The filters were not only doing their job but they became a talking point, a simple galvanizing tool that made it much easier to educate people about the situation.  When someone would see the filters being used they would ask questions, and inadvertently they would learn about sea turtles.  Most importantly, they would begin to care.  These people would then go out and share with ten other people and so on.  Our filters are now used on coastlines the world over, and organizations report that they are one of the best "ice breakers" in terms of approaching people and talking with them about sea turtles and lighting.

The conversation about disposable plastics has already begun.  Offering solutions that peak interest, curiosity, and pride can only bring about change exponentially.

Lastrå will not only offer real alternatives to destructive disposable plastics, but we will spark conversation because our products will always be designed with art and beauty in mind.  It is these conversations that spread like wildfire and bring about lasting change.  (you can see the flashlight filters here www.turtlesafeproducts.com)

story:
Opuntia

Opuntia is the botanical name for the genus of cacti that we have all come to know as the prickly pear. It’s a symbol of unique beauty and adaptation as it sustains life in the desert.  

Opuntia Santa Fe - a place for Tea, Fare & Natural Curiosities. 

And here at Opuntia, we hope you hear laughter the minute you walk in through our doors and find a place for inspiration, community and quality sustenance. We would like you to find shelter in our thoughtful design and amongst the diverse collections of plants, intentionally placed to learn from, admire, or to bring home with you. 

Opuntia should transform your mood with the smell of select teas brewing behind the counter and the tastes of transcending dishes prepared for you by careful hands.

May you discover something new here and often return until it feels like home. 

Photo by Kate Russell 

A New Beginning 

We are very proud of the progress happening in the build-out of our new home in the Santa Fe Railyard. The new Opuntia will be flooded with light, making it the perfect environment for an abundance of life. The space has a generous floor plan for expanded seating and three garage doors that all open for that wonderful indoor-outdoor experience. The balcony looks out on the historical Santa Fe rail lines, with the perfect view of the Sangre De Cristo Mountains.

Photo by Alex Ignacio

Get Involved

We are offering unique opportunities for our community to get involved as we make the last push to open this spring! The bones are all in place, and we need your support to make the magical details happen.

In this expanded space, we need to double our seating and dishware, install extra lighting and add the concrete countertops. Join our community of support and participate in making Opuntia the place to spend time, meet with friends or colleagues for some locally sourced food or enjoy a drink and laugh with our staff.

We created some special offerings to inspire you.

Thank you for your support; we can’t wait to open our doors and celebrate sharing this with you!

Photo by Alex Ignacio

Opuntia is the botanical name for the genus of cacti that we have all come to know as the prickly pear. It’s a symbol of unique beauty and adaptation as it sustains life in the desert.  
Opuntia Santa Fe - a place for Tea, Fare & Natural Curiosities. 
And here at Opuntia, we hope you hear laughter the minute you walk in through our doors and find a place for inspiration, community and quality sustenance. We would like you to find shelter in our thoughtful design and amongst the diverse collections of plants, intentionally placed to learn from, admire, or to bring home with you. 
Opuntia should transform your mood with the smell of select teas brewing behind the counter and the tastes of transcending dishes prepared for you by careful hands.
May you discover something new here and often return until it feels like home. 

Photo by Kate Russell 

A New Beginning 
We are very proud of the progress happening in the build-out of our new home in the Santa Fe Railyard. The new Opuntia will be flooded with light, making it the perfect environment for an abundance of life. The space has a generous floor plan for expanded seating and three garage doors that all open for that wonderful indoor-outdoor experience. The balcony looks out on the historical Santa Fe rail lines, with the perfect view of the Sangre De Cristo Mountains.

Photo by Alex Ignacio

Get Involved
We are offering unique opportunities for our community to get involved as we make the last push to open this spring! The bones are all in place, and we need your support to make the magical details happen.
In this expanded space, we need to double our seating and dishware, install extra lighting and add the concrete countertops. Join our community of support and participate in making Opuntia the place to spend time, meet with friends or colleagues for some locally sourced food or enjoy a drink and laugh with our staff.
We created some special offerings to inspire you.
Thank you for your support; we can’t wait to open our doors and celebrate sharing this with you!

Photo by Alex Ignacio

story:
Hi, I’m Harri,

I never started out trying to improve the way we home brew, I was just trying to make friends at Uni. After countless brews I thought to myself "there has to be an easier way ", one that doesn't look like a scene from breaking bad (tubes, bottles, jars and white plastic buckets).

Introducing harribrew

'harribrew' is a three tier gravity fed system, the only one of its kind that filters tap water, brews, automatically, self siphons and transfers your wine or beer into the detachable base ready for your fridge. It requires less than a minute of preparation to start a brew. 

I built a proof of concept prototype using common parts like buckets, filters and tubes , then set off to patent the product. I am currently patent pending stage with two patents belonging to the product along with the formation of Alechemy Ltd. l've have a small passionate team ready to develop the product potential.

Together we are developing the harribrew cartridge system, a plugin cartridge in the same vein as a coffee machine capsule, where all the ingredients and yeast are stored. Making the process a simple: click in the cartridge, add water in the top and your set to go!

 

 

 

This is a working prototype of the harribrew kit witch i have used as a functional work piece during university. It's crude but is a functional example of the product. the renders shown thought the campaign are the evolution and optimization of this concept.

 

 

Short term - 12 months:

Assuming funds, I will be building the pre-manufacturing prototype from my extensive designs,  testing and adjusting, and finalising the cartridge range, this activity leads to tooling.

After tooling and the initial manufacture plan is to make 100 test units, leading to 10,000 full production units. I have already met with two leading industry equipment companies, who both independently see a significant consumer uptake potential of 'harribrew', particularly with women. I have also met with a manufacturer to establish production capability.

 

 

 

 

 

Midterm 18- 24 months cumulative

I will be developing  the global patent extension in each relevant country as the due date arrives.

The estimated retail price of the harribrew unit is  £125, the wine and beer cartridges are estimated in the  £10-20 range making 4.5 litres wine or beer.

Planned sales for year 1 are the harribrew kit and cartridges followed by a larger version in year 2 and a digitally controlled version in the future.

story:
The Village Kettle Brewing Company is opening in Frankfort, Illinois!

Craft beer has been sweeping the nation for the last ten-plus years starting from a handful of microbreweries to over 5,000 world class producers at the end of 2016.  Illinois has over 100 breweries, (delivering $2.2 billion of economic impact to the State) each one crafting unique and delicious beers that defines the brewery and adds to the charisma of their town.  Craft brewers have responded to a cultural shift in the nation’s beer consumption (or were they responsible for it) and it’s here in Frankfort.  As you look over the beer section in any grocery store or the collection of tap handles behind the bar of your local tavern,  the shelves are an amalgamation of beer representative of our Country’s unique quilt work of identities.  Frankfort will be a part of this vibrant movement with our own brewery and it’s about time because towns around us have opened their own.  Each town, or Village in our case, should have their own brewery and Frankfort's will be called The Village Kettle Brewing Company.  If things go according to plan, we hope to be brewing by September / October of this year.

Before the days of Prohibition, the village brewery served as the community hub where neighbors gather, share ideas, stories, news and have a beer.  While we don’t expect our Brewery to be the spindle that Frankfort will revolve around, we hope you will drop by from time to time and hoist a pint with your neighbor or a make the acquaintance of a new friend.  Whatever the occasion may be, The Village Kettle Brewing Company welcomes you.  Come around enough times and it might just become that place “where everybody knows your name.”  You will also find our beer at the local taps and restaurants in the area.  There's nothing more refreshing than locally brewed beer.

So why are we on IndieGoGo?

Breweries cost a bunch of money to open and we already spent quite a bit just to get to this point.  We will spend a bunch more before we brew our first batch.  Our equipment is ready to be built, we found  a location (in Frankfort), and we are working on getting our license to brew.  Between the legal stuff, equipment fabricators, plumbers, electricians, carpenters and other vendors that will ask for payment, we could use some help.  Here are some pictures of our future brewery.

It looks nice, clean and empty but when we're done fixin' it up, it'll be one gorgeous production brewery.  We are not opening just any shop here.  Before we hang an "open for business" sign, there are a few things we need to prepare at the location:

  • Plumbing:  breweries require lots of water to operate.  We’ll need to run plumbing to our brewing equipment, boiler room, reverse osmosis gizmo,  and other areas in the brewery.  As you and I know, plumbers ain’t cheap.
  • Electrical:  Nothing major like brain surgery but we need to run power all over the place; several transfer pumps, boiler, cold storage room, etc.  OK, it is like brain surgery and brain doctors electrician rates are scary.
  • Floor Modification:  remember all that water I was talking about earlier?  It has to drain somewhere.  That means we need a floor drain.  A big one.  Like 50+ feet of drain.  We also need to pitch the floor towards the drain which means pouring concrete on the floor.  Standing water in a brewery is not a good thing.
  • Boiler Room & Milling Room:  Every brewery needs one of these and ours will be pink and purple (just kiddin').

We negotiated hard with our local contractors but at the end of the day, these guys need to make a living too.  The round numbers to cover the costs is approximately $65,000.  That is our fundraising goal and it starts from March 15 and runs through April  30.  With tax filing season in full swing and you're thinking the Fed and State might need to get paid, supporting a brewery might be the last thing on your mind.  Life happens and we understand.  But perhaps you're getting a refund and maybe you're looking to support a good local cause.  Keep us in mind.  If you're looking to invest some of that refund and having some ownership in a craft beer brewery sounds like something you want to learn more about , let us know and we'll send you some information. 

The funds raised through this campaign will pay for site improvements.  If there’s a little left over from your generous contributions, we'll use those funds to make the place look nice.  We want you to feel right at home at The Village Kettle Brewing Company and here is what we have in mind:

What’s in it for our Village, the surrounding community and you?

In 2015 craft beer sales grew by 18%.  Craft beer now makes up 12% of total beer shares and continues to grow every year.  The beer market is over $105 Billion and the craft segment makes up around $22.3 Billion so plenty of room left to grow.  In 2014, the Craft Brewing Industry contributed $55.7 Billion to the US economy, employing more than 424,000 persons across all segments. https://www.brewersassociation.org/statistics/n...

Supported by these statistics, craft breweries improve the economic footing of the communities they serve generating employment opportunities, sales tax as well as improving the overall image of the township.

With a strong presence across the 50 states and the District of Columbia, craft breweries are a vibrant and flourishing economic force at the local, state and national level. As consumers continue to demand a wide range of high quality, full-flavored beers, small and independent craft brewers are meeting this growing demand with innovative offerings, creating high levels of economic value in the process.

Bart Watson, Chief Economist for the Brewers Association

As a contributor to the cause, you will forever have earned our gratitude and depending on the level of your generosity, we are not ashamed to say thank you with our VKBC branded swag.  Check out the list on the right side and join the VKBC brethren.  There will be legions of fans who will help us raise the dough and we as the beneficiary of your benevolence will strive to remember your name, wish you a “good evening / good day or good morning” (yes, we are brewing breakfast beers) as you walk through our door, and we will make every effort to ensure your pint is exactly 47 degrees on your first sip.

Our beer and why it’s good.

Our research included visiting breweries of all sizes, across this great Nation of ours, in all directions the road took us.  We talked with brewers galore, some with proper education and training, and some who were originally home brewers with infinite passion for the craft, tons of courage, and brass the size of a bulldozer.  The common thread with these guys is the crave for delicious drops of beer.  While we share many commonalities with our fellow brewers on passion, desire and the outright need to make killer beer, our reasons extend to putting Frankfort on the map as a craft beer destination in the County, State, Country and beyond.  We’re going to make such good beer folks from Fiji will come over to Frankfort.

We’ve got four flagship beers at the get go:

  • Working Americans’ Double IPA:  It’s been a long hard day and your sweat is baked on your skin and you’re just aching for the company of your significant other and a cold beer.  Are you really gonna crack a “something Lite” and pretend to be “the most interesting person on earth” or are you craving for something genuinely American, with big hops, and just downright delicious!  Grab a Working Americans' Double IPA and reward yourself for an honest day’s work. 
  • Bluegrass American Wheat Ale:  The Almighty blessed our Country with "amber waves of grain" and we show our thanks by crafting our American Wheat with a touch of Citra and a healthy dose of Amarillo hops; this is Red White & Blue to the core.  Enjoy!
  •  Rake and Paddle Imperial Brown Ale:  The Order of the Rake and Paddle is a secret society of beer snobs bent on global domination through beer.  Notable past members include Goldfinger, Darth Vader, the notorious Genghis K.  See the bar keep for an application to join.  The Society keeps everything secret, including the recipe of this beer.
  • Scalliwag in a Barrel:  A salute to Billy’s pirating days, we brew this ale with a wee bit of dark malt and lighten up the hops; gives it a malty finish.  Malty, rhymes with salty, which is Billy’s outlook on life.

We’ll have more offerings but we are going with these four as our first brews.  We operate under solid beer brewing fundamentals with no gimmicks and 100% American muscle!  This is the Midwest my friends and we do it the hard way, the only way, the right way.

The People Behind the Dream:

Will Rafol:   Chief Brewery Grunt, Market & Sales, Co-Founder

Originally from Chicago, Will and his growing family moved to Frankfort in 2003  to be near family.  The "good livin'" was interrupted with work taking him down to Florida and then Georgia but he and his family eventually found their way back home in 2010.  Will is a home brewer and likes to experiment with the ingredients and processes but always arrives at the same spot, great tasting home brewed beer.  Will, his wife and two boys make Frankfort their home and enjoys the Village life it offers.

Andy Hunt:  Quality Control (takes 1st sip), Chief Bar keep, Co-Founder

Born and raised locally before starting his quest for "the perfect pour". After a quick swing out to Washington D.C. and an extended stay in Denver, CO; Andy moved the family back to Illinois and landed in the best town possible. The love affair with craft beer started while visiting Fort Collins, CO in 2002. One sip of La Folie and a whole new world opened up...."many tasting rooms later, it is time to put my energy into something of my own."

Brewer X:   Runs the production; enough said, Co-Founder

Contrary to what some people believe, Brewer X is not related to Racer X.  At this time, we cannot disclose Brewer X’s identify because:

a)  Brewer X is really a super-secret spy for the Fed who happens to be a gifted brewer;

b)  Brewer X is wanted in 5 star systems for collaborating with the rebel scum to overthrow the Galactic Empire;

c)  Brewer X is currently employed by another brewery and if said brewery learns of his plans to defect to a rival brewery, he will lose his membership in the Brewers Guild.

If you chose A or B, there’s this bridge in London I want to sell you.  All kidding aside, we have an experienced and incredibly talented brewer who will be running the show from day one.  Our brewer is currently with another successful brewery but he feels the need to move on and follow his vision of brewing solid recipes and running his own shop.  Working and learning from some of the best brewers out there and living the dream, Brewer X has gained the knowledge and experience that will position VKBC for success.  We can't wait for the big reveal and for you to meet him.  Brewer X runs a very tight ship with the core of the team doing double or triple duties.  We may even rely on some of you to help with a few things here and there and your reward is a cold pint of beer.  And maybe a sandwich if Brewer X is feeling generous.

Our consultant tells us running a brewery is a lot of hard work.  It has to be something you believe in and would be willing to make sacrifices just to keep the doors open and the kettle boiling.  We think this is a worthwhile endeavor, something we'll pour (pun intended) our hearts and soul into because the belief in the vision is worth the risk.  Don’t laugh but for us, brewing beer is a labor of love.  This is only the beginning of a wonderful journey and more chapters will be written.  Your name will be alongside ours when the story is printed and no matter the amount, your contribution will help start this brewery.  You can also help spread the word; tell your family, friends, neighbors, folks at the office, tell everybody that we are building a brewery in Frankfort and we could use their help.

For those of you intrigued and interested enough to participate as an equity owner, send a note to will@villagekettlebrewing.com and we'll send you some information. 

Thank you for helping us make the Village Kettle Brewing Company a reality!
