story:
The January 2015 issue of the New Brewer expects craft brewing to own 20% of the market by 2020. However, the Brazos Valley in Texas is currently under-served by breweries and brewpubs compared to many other University locations and we have created an awesome brewing destination in old town Bryan, TX . So . . . now what? Now we need you to come play.

You may have seen brewery cooperatives but a Zoiglbrewery is more than that. Instead of you just being a member, you can join the corporation and share the brewery. We have a place to learn, a place to just have fun. We are bringing the home brewers out of the backyard providing an outlet to ‘step it up a notch’ - or teach you how to do so.

Game on?

 

Background

We are a small brewery that opened our taproom January, 2016 and are having so much fun with what we are doing that we cut a trailer (as you've seen above) and need you to come have some fun too. We are currently raising money for expansion. We will be taking over the rest of the building we are in and setting down 20 barrels worth of production equipment. Right now we are finishing the build-out of the beer garden. If you want to brew, you have to become an officer of the company. If you want swag, here's your opportunity. Either way, we are here for you (and for the beer).

A Zoiglbrewery (Zoiglbraurei) is a concept in brewing and distribution dating back to the 15th century, but currently found only in a small region of Eastern Bavaria close to the Czech Republic. The brewers (Kommunbrauer) share the calendar days for brewing depending on their level of involvement in the brewery.

The name Zoigl is a Bavarian word derived from the German word "Zeigen" meaning sign.The brewer hangs the Zoigl when his or her beer is ready as an invitation to the neighbors to come over and have some beer. The town becomes a revolving pub of sorts and a treasure hunt ensues to find the next Zoigl, and the next fresh Zoiglbeer. (see Zoigl.de)

(The 20 oz pint mug)

 

This is the concept that we set down in Bryan, Texas. A shared brewery for the whole town. We are gathering participation from local homebrewers who will now have the ability to come in to cook and sell beer in our taproom, and then we will be scaling up production next door to include pubs and restaurants in the Bryan / College Station area that would like to develop their own style. The "scaling up" part is where your help is needed.

This has been a cumbersome affair setting this concept down under Texas laws but we have a handle on it. We opened as a manufacturer so we could get permit submitted and the beer garden opened. We will be converting to a Brewpub which will be on the retailer level, so restaurants and clubs can develop recipes too. In Texas you have to be an officer of the corporation to come brew, and we can make that happen in the rewards section. Right now we are spending all of our beer sales revenue on upgrades and could sure use your help.  It's such a fun concept  that right now we just want to get the story of Zoiglbeer out there.

 

(Mini-keg Growler)

Highlights

20 oz pint: That's right, a 20 oz 'pint' glass. Bring it in and we will fill it at pint prices for the life of the glass (better take care of it). That's gets you a 25% bragging right boost.

Brewer for a Day: Come on in a learn the craft. Or do it with friends. Once you are finished you will return for bottling and claim 10 liters of your creation (for better or worse!). We will probably have to go through a retailer to make it all copacetic and stuff, but we'll get 'er done.

Join The Corp: In Texas you have to be an officer of the corporation to brew under our permits. We will bless you in so that you can brew at our facility and sell in our beer garden. NOTE: Brewer sharing is based on your input. The more you buy, the more priority you get - but we'll work you in no matter what.

Lifetime Mug: Yep, you got it. The mug that's re-fill-able for life. The catch here is that we will monitor what you do at the beer garden and keep things safe. So don't expect to fill it, and fill it, and fill it all at the same time. Let's try and keep it to one fill per visit - but that's for the life of the mug  so take care of 'Precious'. Laser etched glass stein with your name, our logo, pewter lid with a hop cone. Cool!

 

Why Indiegogo?

Indiegogo is an excellent way to launch a project like this. Many people who are passionate about craft beer already stay connected online. Indiegogo helps further these communities by building a group of like-minded people invested in the project's success. . We are already connected with these audiences but will strengthen efforts while we expand, so crowdfunding through Indiegogo just makes perfect sense.

 

How Funds Will be Used

Funds raised through this campaign will cover materials and equipment for the expansion and you're helping us. We're asking for enough to cover any little or large part of the build-out. There are a lot of costs to cover and any little bit helps.

If we exceed the fundraising goal with your help we will keep applying any excess to making the Zoigl better and better. All of the extra funds will go towards equipment, marketing, and distribution.

          (the Lifetime Stein)

 

Risks & Challenges

Like just about everything else, this will take time, energy, and hard labor and doesn't always go as planned. Hell, from the time we filed a permit to the time we served our first pint was almost a year! But we did it and the beer garden is now open and serving. Our budget is being built as we sell beer. However, what we lack in advertising dollars, we plan to make up for in creativity and hard work. We will move as we have the support, and with your help, we hope to go faster.

We've been working on this for a while now and everyone we've met has been incredibly supportive, enthusiastic, and willing to share. We also have a team of talented, passionate people helping -- led by people that are committed to seeing a quality finish no matter what. These things make us confident that we will be a success despite any risks and challenges that might lie ahead.

The beauty of crowdfunding is that you'll experience all of the trials and triumphs along the way.
 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We know that not everyone can help out monetarily and that's okay! You can high-five us in other ways:

  • Make some noise and share this campaign page with your friends and neighbors.
  • Shout us out on social media. The more people we can reach, the greater chance we have of reaching our goal.
  • Send words of wisdom and any questions.
  • Drink local beer and send us some good vibes (Highly recommended)
  • Visit us now that we are open! We will be happy to share a drink with you or just sit and chat.

And that's all there is to it.
story_txt:
The January 2015 issue of the New Brewer expects craft brewing to own 20% of the market by 2020. However, the Brazos Valley in Texas is currently under-served by breweries and brewpubs compared to many other University locations and we have created an awesome brewing destination in old town Bryan, TX . So . . . now what? Now we need you to come play.
You may have seen brewery cooperatives but a Zoiglbrewery is more than that. Instead of you just being a member, you can join the corporation and share the brewery. We have a place to learn, a place to just have fun. We are bringing the home brewers out of the backyard providing an outlet to ‘step it up a notch’ - or teach you how to do so.
Game on? BackgroundWe are a small brewery that opened our taproom January, 2016 and are having so much fun with what we are doing that we cut a trailer (as you've seen above) and need you to come have some fun too. We are currently raising money for expansion. We will be taking over the rest of the building we are in and setting down 20 barrels worth of production equipment. Right now we are finishing the build-out of the beer garden. If you want to brew, you have to become an officer of the company. If you want swag, here's your opportunity. Either way, we are here for you (and for the beer).A Zoiglbrewery (Zoiglbraurei) is a concept in brewing and distribution dating back to the 15th century, but currently found only in a small region of Eastern Bavaria close to the Czech Republic. The brewers (Kommunbrauer) share the calendar days for brewing depending on their level of involvement in the brewery.
The name Zoigl is a Bavarian word derived from the German word "Zeigen" meaning sign.The brewer hangs the Zoigl when his or her beer is ready as an invitation to the neighbors to come over and have some beer. The town becomes a revolving pub of sorts and a treasure hunt ensues to find the next Zoigl, and the next fresh Zoiglbeer. (see Zoigl.de)

(The 20 oz pint mug)

story:
Our Story

Heavy Metal Ice Cream was conceptualized over several weeks of fun brainstorming between myself (Jay Smith, Crestwood, Mo.) and my 11 year old Daughter, Chloe. In short, we both love food, cooking together, and who DOESN'T LOVE ICE CREAM?!?!

Most importantly, the driving force between my wanting to open this parlor is the hopes to start a family business with the one person I trust most in the world and has never let me down. My little girl. Making her smile or laugh makes my day, but  starting a family business that we would live, breathe and love TOGETHER? That would make my life complete.

Now, obviously due to her age Chloe would not be a true employee, but believe me she'll be the main consultant and 50% of the creative force until the day she can work legitimately.

Why "Heavy Metal" Ice Cream???

Growing up in the late 80's / Early 90's, I was a Metal Head through and through. I picked up a guitar at 13 and learned from the greats. Van Halen, Hair Bands, Classic Rock, Metal...all of it consumed me. And though being a full fledged rock star never panned out, I have made some pretty decent money and success playing in some wildly popular St. Louis cover bands over the years. Somehow, the dichotomy of Heavy Metal's abrasiveness mixed with the soft, fluffy yumminess of Ice Cream just seemed to SCREAM...."Whoa, this is a GREAT idea!"

What Makes Your Ice Cream So Special?!

There are SEVERAL Gourmet Ice Cream shops in the St. Louis area and we love and respect them all! Here is where we feel we are different...and awesome!

Heavy Metal Ice Cream whenever possible will always use fresh, organic ingredients from local farmers, dairies, hatcheries, and farmers markets. Our Ice Cream has an expiration date just like the big chains. But instead of nearly a month, ours is 3 days from the morning the batch was made fresh. What goes beyond that is discarded for a fresh new batch or donated to local soup kitchens and shelters for the homeless and shelters for battered women.

Also, while not divulging our recipe for our base, sweet scream Ice Cream, we will share that we WILL use as many local farm raised egg yolks per batch just this side of crossing over from being able to call it ice cream and it becoming technically frozen custard. Ole' Ted Down the street has the corner on that market and we are NOT trying to step on those toes...as if we could. Nothing but respect to the Original Gangsta of St. Louis frozen treats!

Also, our flavors and rich, custardy, velvety texture are what sets us apart ALONG WITH our wild flavors and scoop names. Here's what you WON'T find in our shop.
- NO Neon, Tutti Fruity, Super Loud artificially colored Ice Cream. Rarely, we will use a couple of drops if it suits the theme of the cone, but most times, you get the natural color of the batch plus whatever mix-ins are in the ice cream
- NO glass jars of run of the mill toppings. You're not gonna find sprinkles in this joint. No cookie dough balls, crushed peanuts, bland chocolate chips or stale coconut sprinkles. Our Scoops and Mix-In's stand on their own
- NO generic or store bought cones! All of our waffle cones are made in house on our own irons using our own, secret, sweet butter-milky recipe. Mmmm....can you smell THAT?!
- AND MOST IMPORTANTLY.... NO tiny scoops or servings. Our cones runeth over. A common complain about other gourmet shops. We may not be the cheapest cone in town, but you WILL get your money's worth!

Where would we like to plant our flag?

From ages 3 - 40 I've lived in a St. Louis Suburb called Crestwood. I've loved it since I was a little kid. I attended the Lindbergh School District from Kindergarten through Senior Year Graduation. But my little hometown saw a mighty rise in the 80's and a sad crushing fall in the last decade. In short, I want to give back. Crestwood was mostly supported by one of the first ever wildly successful Shopping Malls. But factors ranging from the dot com shopping boom, to slum lord management taking over the mall, to other malls opening closer to highway exits....it met a sad end a few years back. The good news, the property that has sat dormant, falling apart, and molding for years now, is to be demolished and newly redeveloped over the next couple of years. Oddly enough.... right in line with our projected storefront opening. We, Heavy Metal Ice Cream, want to be there front and center. Enjoying success and giving back to the community that gave me so many childhood memories.

Our town has seen historic landmarks perish or move. Our mall was dead. Our Drive In Movie Theater killed by a wrecking ball for a grocery store and Best Buy. Our Mom 'n Pop restaurants replaced by bank after bank.... It's time to bring something unique and FUN back home. Your contribution won't just be to help start a family business, but breathe life back into a community many have given up on.

What We Need & What You Get

We plan to operate in 3 phases each with it's own individual IndieGoGo campaign. Please be aware that THIS campaign is for "Phase 1". NOT for the actual storefront location opening. That will be "Phase 3". Contributors to each level will qualify for some REALLY cool perks to be given out once each phase's goal is reached!

  • Phase 1 - Acquire basic kitchen materials such as a top of the line non-commercial ice cream maker, various kitchen supplies, and stock up on ingredients. In this phase we spend 6-10 months concocting our various flavors after first perfecting our perfect vanilla, sweet scream, Ice Cream base. At this point it will be tested among friends and family to see what flies and what doesn't make the cut. In this phase we will not be allowed to sell our product. We also use this phase to secure legal advice, our official trademarking process, and have 3 sessions with a business planning firm.
    This will require our first of 3 IndieGoGo.com campaigns.
  • Phase 2 - Rental of a Culinary Incubator. (A building with multiple commercial kitchens that have already passed inspection and rent their space by the hour or day to chefs learning the ropes and perfecting their methods.) At this point after being given the ok by the Mo. Dept. Of Health, we can begin selling and shipping in small batches for minor profits and begin "catching a buzz" around town and building anticipation and a fan base. These kitchens can range in price from $20 an hour to $200 per day. Many, MANY days will be required and that adds up. This will require a 2nd IndieGoGo.com campaign
  • Phase 3 - This is where we put the pedal to the METAL. We acquire a storefront rental space. We hope to secure one on historic route 66. We build our kitchen, build out the decor, install freezers, machines, scoop counters, and furniture and hopefully, open to critical acclaim and great local success, all in thanks to you, our amazing supporters, contributors, and backers!

Other Ways You Can Help

Not everyone can contribute. We totally get that! So here are some other ways you can help if you believe in us:

  • Share Our Campaign On Facebook and ask others to consider contributing
  • Be sure to "Like" our Facebook page
  • Think about purchasing some swag from our website

We truly appreciate you taking the time to learn more about our venture. It means the world to my Daughter and I. To see this come to fruition would be  a dream come true for our little family and my community!

Thank you,

Jay & Chloe Smith
Crestwood (St. Louis), Missouri

story:
Hello, Friends!

As many of you know, we've made a big commitment to downtown Allentown over the past year, reflecting our family's history in the city and my own work for the last 7 years as an advocate around the issues of urban food insecurity, homelessness and sheltering, poverty, access, and good governance.  

Our business has grown very quickly over the last 3 years in general.  In this short amount of time we've expanded our footprint in mobile concessions with new stands and revenue streams at the Kutztown Folk Festival, our two food trucks, and our brick-and-mortar operations in Lynnville and Downtown Allentown.   

Right now, as the slow season with the mobile part of our business (which is the more profitable part) comes to an end, and we look to spring and summer, I'm looking for people interested in helping us bridge the gap to the busy season. If you'd be interested in helping us continue to invest in the business and in downtown Allentown, I'm looking for a three-month term at 5% (annualized).  I'm interested in investments of all sizes, from micro loans of a few hundred dollars on.  For smaller amounts, and for some big ones, we've set up some fun perks in addition to repayment.  I am looking to collectively raise $5000 - $10,000 in working capital to pay-off short-term debt and invest in continued growth.

We just won the 2017 Lehigh Valley Style best cheesesteak award and are so proud of that in our 60th year of business! If you can help us bridge the gap between now and the busy season, please consider it and help become part of a growing good news story! Blessings and thanks. - Chris

story:
Our story

Our restaurant has two main aspects to create all our differentiation from other restaurants in Piura and Latin America. These two aspects are: our Dragon Ball thematic and our business philosophy focused on worker’s value.

First - Our Dragon Ball thematic

Dragon Ball is an anime series that begins with the adventures of an extraordinarily strong young boy named Goku as he searches for the seven dragon balls. These balls, when combined, can invoke a mythological dragon called Shenron who has the power to make wishes come true. Along the way he makes many new friends, and enemies. Goku trains to become the strongest fighter in the world, while at the same time he is always willing to save the world. The story continues in the second season called Dragon Ball Z.

We are going to decor the place with the main characters and landscapes of the series. We want people feel they are living within the Dragon Ball adventure.

We believe that every person has a special wish in heart- "that wish". By dining with us, we want to inspire Latin Americans, beginning by Piura, Peru, to make "that wish" reality. Because of this, our slogan is: make “that wish” reality.  Our wish is to turn our restaurant into a business model that can impact the way companies are run in our region.

Second (and most important) - Our philosophy

We want to be much more than a themed restaurant with a fascinating decor and tasty food. While that is our company’s roof, but our bases are much stronger and deeper. Saiyajin buffet is the materialization of two deep passions of its founder- a love born in his childhood and a strong desire to improve his community.

In his own words: "During the last 5 years I have been collecting information on entrepreneurship and business values, reading many books and attending many conferences, both live and on YouTube. My initial desire was to analyze business behavior scientifically, but soon I recognized a devastating reality. I used to read a lot about companies with wonderful purpose, with strong values whose missions and business values transcended into the community, empowering employees and many other businesses. I fell in love with this kind of vision, but unfortunately, none of this happened in Latin America.

Everything I learned happened in places like the United States, Europe or Japan. There were companies with purpose, with higher values missions that impacted in the community, but here in Latin America there is so much labor exploitation and many employees are treated as things and not as people. Many companies do not satisfy even basic physiological needs, such as health and safety.  For some of these business, their purpose is to produce as much income as possible even though they must trample the community, the environment and employees’ self-esteem to do it. This happens especially in the food business.

While companies in the United States, Europe and Japan were aiming to bring their employees and clients to the top of Maslow's needs pyramid of self-actualization and esteem, in Latin America we were not even fully satisfying the base.

It was then that I decided that the only way to generate change was to create a company where I could apply these values that I wanted so much for myself and never received in any job. Some of these values include providing an environment of esteem, accomplishment and inner fulfilment for the workers. I firmly believe if the staff feel valued and motivated they will provide an exceptional customer service.

I chose the restaurants sector because it is a business area that I love and know. This is also an area where much work exploitation is currently being experienced in Latin America. In many restaurants and bars, the normal 8 work hour day is a dream. Because there are no fixed departure times, workers are forced to work extra time, which on many occasions is not paid. Even worse, you cannot aspire to benefits like medical insurance.

The tips that are supposed to be shared in equal parts for the workers, in many cases  are taken by the business owner. Restaurant jobs are also classified as low-paying jobs, with little prospect of personal and professional development, where there are not recognitions or training.”

Therefore, as a company, our commitment is to recognize the personal value of our workers with specific actions such as:

- Fixed entry and exit times.

- Training in business subjects as well topics for their personal development such as assertive communication, entrepreneurship, digital competences, personal finance and self-management of knowledge.

-Creation of a system of social recognition and support for creativity. Ex: if a worker has an initiative and is approved by the management, he/she becomes the manager of the new project, receiving a benefit according to the monetary impact produced by that project.

To achieve these worthwhile goals, we have created a values philosophy with a view to becoming our company heart.

3 Pillars

Fantastic Experiences: All our efforts are focused on our visitors, so they can create an emotional connection, have fun, laugh and, above all, believe again in "that desire" of their heart.

Raise Personal Esteem: If workers feel valued and motivated, they will provide an excellent service and visitors will enjoy an extraordinarily positive experience.

Honest People and Products: We do not deceive our visitors, what we promise is what we deliver.

Our rewards for your help

Today we are a group of entrepreneurs who have joined this desire, but we still need your help. With just $35 collaboration, you will be supporting a company that is born to create a revolution in values. As a reward we will put your name, city and country in a special metal plate called Shenron's Honor Roll, that will be in the center of our restaurant, since like the powerful Shenron you are making our wish come true and we always want to remember you.

We have more rewards. With a donation of $20, if you send us a picture of you, our designer is going to create a digital customized postcard where you will be the Dragon Ball hero. With a donation of $50 you are going to receive the digital customized postcard, as well as having your name, city and country in the Shenron´s Honor Roll and a special dinner will be waiting for you the first time you visit our restaurant.

Please help us to share this campaign with your family, friends and social media. Thank so much, and

                                                         MAKE "THAT WISH" REALITY
story_txt: Our storyOur restaurant has two main aspects to create all our differentiation from other restaurants in Piura and Latin America. These two aspects are: our Dragon Ball thematic and our business philosophy focused on worker’s value.First - Our Dragon Ball thematic Dragon Ball is an anime series that begins with the adventures of an extraordinarily strong young boy named Goku as he searches for the seven dragon balls. These balls, when combined, can invoke a mythological dragon called Shenron who has the power to make wishes come true. Along the way he makes many new friends, and enemies. Goku trains to become the strongest fighter in the world, while at the same time he is always willing to save the world. The story continues in the second season called Dragon Ball Z.We are going to decor the place with the main characters and landscapes of the series. We want people feel they are living within the Dragon Ball adventure.We believe that every person has a special wish in heart- "that wish". By dining with us, we want to inspire Latin Americans, beginning by Piura, Peru, to make "that wish" reality. Because of this, our slogan is: make “that wish” reality.  Our wish is to turn our restaurant into a business model that can impact the way companies are run in our region.Second (and most important) - Our philosophy We want to be much more than a themed restaurant with a fascinating decor and tasty food. While that is our company’s roof, but our bases are much stronger and deeper. Saiyajin buffet is the materialization of two deep passions of its founder- a love born in his childhood and a strong desire to improve his community.In his own words: "During the last 5 years I have been collecting information on entrepreneurship and business values, reading many books and attending many conferences, both live and on YouTube. My initial desire was to analyze business behavior scientifically, but soon I recognized a devastating reality. I used to read a lot about companies with wonderful purpose, with strong values whose missions and business values transcended into the community, empowering employees and many other businesses. I fell in love with this kind of vision, but unfortunately, none of this happened in Latin America.Everything I learned happened in places like the United States, Europe or Japan. There were companies with purpose, with higher values missions that impacted in the community, but here in Latin America there is so much labor exploitation and many employees are treated as things and not as people. Many companies do not satisfy even basic physiological needs, such as health and safety.  For some of these business, their purpose is to produce as much income as possible even though they must trample the community, the environment and employees’ self-esteem to do it. This happens especially in the food business.While companies in the United States, Europe and Japan were aiming to bring their employees and clients to the top of Maslow's needs pyramid of self-actualization and esteem, in Latin America we were not even fully satisfying the base.It was then that I decided that the only way to generate change was to create a company where I could apply these values that I wanted so much for myself and never received in any job. Some of these values include providing an environment of esteem, accomplishment and inner fulfilment for the workers. I firmly believe if the staff feel valued and motivated they will provide an exceptional customer service.I chose the restaurants sector because it is a business area that I love and know. This is also an area where much work exploitation is currently being experienced in Latin America. In many restaurants and bars, the normal 8 work hour day is a dream. Because there are no fixed departure times, workers are forced to work extra time, which on many occasions is not paid. Even worse, you cannot aspire to benefits like medical insurance.The tips that are supposed to be shared in equal parts for the workers, in many cases  are taken by the business owner. Restaurant jobs are also classified as low-paying jobs, with little prospect of personal and professional development, where there are not recognitions or training.”Therefore, as a company, our commitment is to recognize the personal value of our workers with specific actions such as:- Fixed entry and exit times.- Training in business subjects as well topics for their personal development such as assertive communication, entrepreneurship, digital competences, personal finance and self-management of knowledge.-Creation of a system of social recognition and support for creativity. Ex: if a worker has an initiative and is approved by the management, he/she becomes the manager of the new project, receiving a benefit according to the monetary impact produced by that project.To achieve these worthwhile goals, we have created a values philosophy with a view to becoming our company heart.3 PillarsFantastic Experiences: All our efforts are focused on our visitors, so they can create an emotional connection, have fun, laugh and, above all, believe again in "that desire" of their heart.Raise Personal Esteem: If workers feel valued and motivated, they will provide an excellent service and visitors will enjoy an extraordinarily positive experience.Honest People and Products: We do not deceive our visitors, what we promise is what we deliver.Our rewards for your helpToday we are a group of entrepreneurs who have joined this desire, but we still need your help. With just $35 collaboration, you will be supporting a company that is born to create a revolution in values. As a reward we will put your name, city and country in a special metal plate called Shenron's Honor Roll, that will be in the center of our restaurant, since like the powerful Shenron you are making our wish come true and we always want to remember you.We have more rewards. With a donation of $20, if you send us a picture of you, our designer is going to create a digital customized postcard where you will be the Dragon Ball hero. With a donation of $50 you are going to receive the digital customized postcard, as well as having your name, city and country in the Shenron´s Honor Roll and a special dinner will be waiting for you the first time you visit our restaurant.Please help us to share this campaign with your family, friends and social media. Thank so much, and                                                         MAKE "THAT WISH" REALITY

story:
Dear music lovers & chocoholics,

 

would you like to start the New Year 2020, the "Choco Twenties" with a WOW? 

With my music "New Silk Road" performed by wonderful Virtuosi?

a chocolate record 6 min single album  

And would you even go one step further and enjoy the record you have listened to after several times as your special vegan dessert? Then go for this unique single album "Viktoria & Virtuosi: with Yaoyao Brandenburg (piano), Katharina Hanstedt (harp), Ernesto Villalobos/Katharina Sames (flute, pan flute), Francesco Petri (clarinet), Weimo Gao (cello), Youjin Sung (gayageum), Ahmad Hussein (saz), Johannes Schubert (zither) and me as violinist, composer and creative director.                                       

LISTEN & EAT IT!

the final product - a functioning record made from delicious vegan 100% chocolate;

One can see the super fine record grooves on top of it. It is really amazing how this chocolate record sounds like old shellac records from the 1920s!!

interview in a TV-show you can watch here:

https://deggendorf.niederbayerntv.de/mediathek/...

the packaged chocolate record, ready for shipping

Viktoria & Virtuosi

Chocolatier Christoph Wohlfarth shows a chocolate record to Viktoria in his Bio

Gläserne Schokoladenmanufaktur in Berlin

 

Saz player Ahmad from Syria & Viktoria after having listened to the premiere of "New Silk Road" as a chocolate record

After having worked in South Korea since 2010 as youngest Western professor of violin, teaching gifted students, playing many concerts and being inspired as composer from traditional Korean Gugak music it was my idea to produce an homage to this Eurasian bridge - the "New Silk Road" - in a globalized time - on an edible medium: chocolate.

YOU can help us through supporting this campaign!

THEN we can play more wonderful international live concerts together, share music and above all the best artisan chocolate - as functioning sounding chocolate record.​ YOU will never forget the taste of this music and record with its nice scents of cacao beans and: YOU will have enormous FUN with this round product.

 

Background story

The project already origins in summer 2016 when I was asked to write a piece for a concert in Hélène de Beauvoirs former house in idyllical Goxwiller in Alsace. The title of the piece is "Bernstein & Co" for violin, clarinet, cello & piano. It also includes the audience and performance of all players.

Later I was asked to compose a piece for violin and string orchestra for a performance in Seoul in April 2017. So I took two pieces from the quartet "Bernstein & Co": "Emerald" (Orient) & "Rubin" (Asia). I thought about theses jewels, their geological appearance and decided to finish my new piece with "Andalusit", a mineral one can find in Spain. This represents Europe.

 

Then "Silk Road" and after arranging it for a unique ensemble with typical EurAsian instruments  "New Silk Road" was born with a span from far East Asia to Western Europe, nowadays a trade route probably beyond the whole space.

Originally it was planned performing "New Silk Road" with Virtuosi in Munich.  We realised that our journey wanted to reach out a der audience: By coincidence I found Wohlfarth Gläserne Schokoladenmanufaktur in Berlin in summer 2019. I was immediately impressed by the chocolate record as I really could die for chocolate. It came to my mind like a flash finding this "musical" space inside of us humans. A synesthesia  of taste & music -  food inspired by Pythagoras and the Ancient Chinese! They even had used and theoretically systematised  the interval of the Third thousands of years (!) earlier before Oriental countries and the Ancient Greece. However, later the Chinese did not use these intervals - so one even could wonder if Plato took the knowledge of them and forbid certain scales in music because of evoking certain statues of affects he did not want to be practiced in his Academia? 

Welcome all chocolate and sound GOURMETS on our "New Silk Road" journey!

 

The whole project included:

1. Composing, arranging and editing the music, copy costs

2. Rehearsing with Virtuosi in Berlin for one week. 

    Excellent clarinet player Francesco Petri came extra from Saarbrücken and

    inspiring Johannes Schubert took his zither from Fulda to Berlin.

Rehearsal in Berlin´s Osterkirche: Youjin Sung (Gayageum), Yaoyao Brandenburg (piano), Francesco Petri (clarinet), Katharina Hanstedt (harp) and Viktoria

3. Recording Sessions at HM Studios in Berlin Schoeneberg, May 2nd/3rd, 2019

Ernesto Villalobos prepares his flute before recording

Cellist Weimo Gao has finished recording and zither player Johannes Schubert tunes his instrument

Smile: Ahmad Hussein, a refugee from Syria, had lots of fun with his saz

Morning session with harp player Katharina Hanstedt, pianist Yaoyao Brandenburg, clarinet player Francesco Petri and Viktoria

Youjin Sung prepares her gayageum while sound engineer Clémence Fabre installs mics

Clémence supervises the session

A page of "Andalusit"

4. Video Session at Workstadt Berlin on May 4th/5th, 2019. Nuno Martini and Diego Sapienzia filmed a whole night in the wonderful atelier of Dieter Menzel (Lumenzel): https://lumenzel.wordpress.com

I had written a precise screenplay focusing on solo parts of each instrument, chamber music sets while the musical dramaturgy and the whole ensemble.

We changed our clothes three times according to the colours of Emerald (green), Rubin (red) and Andalusit (golden). Harp player Katharina Hanstedt told me she had taken her harp home - the first time in her long life as thought-after musicians, also and especially for modern music - AFTER sunrise.

decoration in Lumenzel atelier 

beautiful lamps

 Einstein lamp, I integrated in the "New Silk Road" music video

5. Postproduction of all material, video edit, sound file edit, mastering e.g.

6. Publishing the video "New Silk Road" on Youtube:

   https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=p0hbKLmwjiI

 7. Production of the chocolate records with Wohlfarth Gläserne Schokoladenmanufaktur Berlin

In total the project needed an investment 9800 Euros from the very first arranged note until the first record produced in January 2020.

 

YOU can support

this campaign in buying perks - like "Cinnamon" or "Emerald". Besides a chocolate record or more you receive other musical presents related to the New Silk Road, beautiful classical music, high quality paper greetings in a fine calligraphic style.

AND

You can book concerts with us!

 

These people contributed to the project:

chocolate production            Wohlfarth Gläserne Schokoladenmanufaktur Berlin

                                                       wohlfarthschokolade.de

sound engineer                        Clémence Fabre

film team/ edit                         Nuno Martini, Diego Sapienzia, Jonas Niemann

studio rental                              HM Studio Schöneberg

piano tuning                              Daniel Sikarew     sikarew.de

music edit                                  Stephan Schoenlau & Dennis Schwachhofer 

church rental                            Osterkirche Berlin

travel costs/ food                    all

assistant                                     Robert Grabein

artist fee                                     Virtuosi

organization                              Victory Academy Berlin for musical excellence

 

Many thanks to Peter Erben Geigenbau München for donating 500 Euros!

erben-geigenbau.de

 

This chocolate record: a WOW

This world wide unique chocolate record "New Silk Road" is sustainable and 100% ecological made from vegan chocolate fed with green electricity. Wohlfarth chocolate has won several prizes in important chocolate competitions.

My colleagues, Virtuosi, are musicians of highest caliber. We are an international team (flute, clarinet, violin, cello, saz, piano, harp, zither, gayageum) and share musical background from Eurasian cultures. I used the string set of harp - zither - gayageum (a kind of Korean harp) to show the rich sound palette of this trio, combinations of silk, gut, steel with silver-golden mounted strings of violin, cello and even nylon of the Oriental saz.

"New Silk Road" feels like film music and my conception is based on this idea:"Emerald" tells through maqam scales in a long melodic line the mythological story of the Egyptian God of Wisdom, the Moon and Writing "Thoth" whose scriptum can be seen on an Emerald tablet. "Rubin" shows pentatonics and Asian lightness, referring to Thoth´s words in the Coda while all musicians improvise. "Andalusit" combines the Malaguena cadence scheme with Korean rhythm Chinyangjo and is a very fast, energetic movement.

Next to performing international concerts, my CDs (Hänssler, Oehms) received excellent reviews from journals such as American Record Guide, Fono Forum, Pizzicato, was awarded with the American Critic´s Choice and three Echo Klassik nominations. My Ysaye CD is benchmarked among the top 3 world wide. So the music on this chocolate record is of finest quality, performed with my outstanding colleagues on highest level.

Enjoy a caleidoscopic sensuous experience! Listen and eat "New Silk Road" in your concert hall at home and cook with it in your kitchen a nice cake with spices from the Silk Road such as kardamom, cinnamon, vanilla, rose, pepper e.g. What about inviting your friends and sharing all your impressions on social media - Make the "New Silk Road" grow further!

The "New Silk Road"

The ancient "Silk Road"

 

An EXCLUSIVE LIMITED WINTER EDITION!

Chocolate melts as soon as winter says "farewell" to spring. Be sure the record is stored in the fridge before you put it on your record player. Clean the needle of your record player with a fine brush.

In case the record is broken because of shipping via post - it happens rarely - please email me immediately and take a foto of the record including the postal tracking number, insurance might cover it.

NOTE: Please open the record while receiving it from the postal currier and check whether it is in a perfect condition! 

 

Anyone of you who loves this product, its amazing idea behind and above all this outstanding team of musicians is welcome to share this link with friends - also on social media. Please tell the story to journalists or any persons who might promote this project.

 

Thank you from the bottom of a chocolate heart!

HAPPY NEW YEAR 2020 - Golden & "Gretesque"!

Yours,

Viktoria & Virtuosi

viktoriakaunzner.com

story:
Becrit es la Proteína de doble calidad, con más beneficios que la proteína animal y más sostenible que la proteína vegetal. Cuida de tu cuerpo y cuida del medioambiente.

Becrit es el ingrediente perfecto para tus recetas proteicas saludables.

 

 

 

 

 

Esta Proteína de Doble Alta Calidad se creó para cubrir las necesidades de una nueva generación fitness que desea cuidarse comiendo productos saludables mientras respetan su cuerpo y la naturaleza que les rodea. Con esto en mente, hemos diseñado Becrit con la proteína más revolucionaria.

 

Sabiendo que la ganadería representa el 15% de los gases de efecto invernadero, es imperativo que hemos de encontrar nuevas fuentes de proteína sostenibles para nuestro planeta.

 

 

 

 

 

Muchos vegetarianos están dispuestos a comer insectos por 2 razones:

  • Es un alimento muy sostenible con el medio ambiente y no supone ningún peligro para el calentamiento global.
  • Los insectos tienen sistema nervioso central simple sin receptores de sensibilidad, por lo tanto no sufren ningún dolor.

Ser vegetariano es una decisión personal de cada uno tomada por diferentes razones. Nosotros no comemos carne y sí comemos alimentos con proteína de insecto por su contribución nutricional y porque su producción respeta el medio ambiente.

Este tipo de dieta se conoce como entovegetariana.

 

 

 

 

La harina de insecto tiene valores proteicos más altos que cualquier otro alimento natural sin procesar. Esto la hace el alimento más eficiente del mundo en términos de proteína.

 

 

 

Los insectos se crían en una granja de Holanda con más de 40 años de experiencia en la cría de insectos. Siguen las estrictas directivas de la UE, así que no usan antibióticos, hormonas ni pesticidas.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Después de meses de investigación, búsqueda y desarrollo, hemos diseñado un polvo de proteína de insecto con unos valores nutricionales impresionantes, una textura muy suave y un sabor dulce y natural.

 

 

 

Becrit Fresa con Chocolate Blanco y un toque de Baobab

Ingredientes: proteína vegetal (soja, guisante), polvo de insecto entero (Alphitobius diaperinus larvae) (14%), miel natural en polvo, betanina (jugo de remolacha en polvo), maltodextrina, arom natural, saborizante, extracto de pulpa de baobab orgánico (0,8%), espesante (goma de xantano), endulzante (sucralosa). / Alérgenos: Gluten, soja. Si eres alérgico a los moluscos, crustáceos o motas de polvo doméstico, es posible que seas alérgico a la proteína de insecto.

Becrit Vainilla con Coco y un toque de Canela

ngredientes: proteína vegetal (soja, guisante), polvo de insecto buffalo entero (Alphitobius diaperinus larvae) (14%), miel natural en polvo, maltodextrina, saborizante (vainilla y coco), canela (0,6%), espesante (goma de xantano), endulzante (sucralosa). / Alérgenos: Gluten, soja. Si eres alérgico a los moluscos, crustáceos o motas de polvo doméstico, es posible que seas alérgico a la proteína de insecto.

Becrit Chocolate con un toque de Maca

Ingredientes: proteína vegetal (soja, guisante), polvo de insecto buffalo entero (Alphitobius diaperinus larvae) (13%), polvo de cacao, miel natural en polvo, extracto de raíz de maca (1,5%), saborizante, espesante (goma de xantano), endulzante (sucralosa). / Alérgenos: Gluten, soja. Si eres alérgico a los moluscos, crustáceos o motas de polvo doméstico, es posible que seas alérgico a la proteína de insecto. ten, soy. If you are allergic to mollusks, crustaceans or house dust mites, you may also be allergic to insect protein.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

En Becrit, tenemos un espíritu de colaboración que abrazamos desde el principio. Después de haber vendido las mejore marcas de productos de entomofagia en Europa, decidimos hacer uestra propia marca. Para lograr esto, unimos a los mejores socios posibles de toda Europa, todos alineados con nuestra filosofía, para crear un producto revolucionario. Para nosotros era esencial encontrar un grupo de empresas que apoyara nuestro proyecto y nuestra filosofía detrás de él. Juntos, a través de nuestros esfuerzos de colaboración hemos avanzado poco a poco para crear el mejor polvo de proteína de insecto del futuro. Ahora, gracias a la comunidad de Indiegogo, estaremos listos para producir el primer Becrit Insect-Protein y dar los primeros pasos para cambiar el mundo.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Al comienzo de Becrit, nos sentamos para hablar del futuro en un chiringuito de la playa mientras bebiamos unos “zumos”. En ese momento escribimos algo que dictaría el camino de nuestras futuras decisiones.

 

 

 

 

 

 

El Basque Culinary Center es la mejor universidad culinaria de España y un centro de investigación e innovación en el mundo de la alimentación y la gastronomía.

Eligieron a Becrit entre las start-ups gastronómicas con más potencial del país. Nos enseñaron los entresijos del negocio de la alimentación, desde restaurantes hasta online retailers.

Aprovechamos este momento para mostrar nuestra gratitud al BCC por todo lo que aprendimos, por toda la ayuda que nos ofrecieron y, por su puesto, por los buenos amigos que hicimos en el camino.

story:
Remember Pop Rocks?

As kids, we’ve all gotten excited about candy. Remember running down the towering candy aisles with no adults in sight? Remember being the coolest kid around because you had the goods? Remember that excitement of emptying your Halloween bag after a long night of trick or treating?

 

Somewhere along the road to becoming adults, we lost that magic and excitement. Instead, we sit at our desks, tired and exhausted. But what if we could bring that childhood excitement back, while giving you the energy you need to power through your day feeling awake and refreshed?

 

So What Is Crystal 51?

Crystal 51 is like Pop Rocks...
but it gives you energy.

 

We wanted to give you the energy boost you need to get through your day with caffeine, while bringing back the sense of childlike joy and excitement.

Every pack of Crystal 51 gives you 80mg of caffeine - as much energy as a cup of coffee. 

However, Crystal 51 wasn't created to replace coffee. It was created to give you energy when coffee simply isn't an option.

Energy boosters (like coffee and energy drinks) that are currently on the market work well, but they have their flaws. Energy drinks make you jittery, and are about as healthy as a Snickers bar. Coffee leaves you with coffee breath, yellow teeth, and isn't something you can drink when you're pressed for time.

Crystal 51 solves everything.

Not only does it not leave you with jitters, it only has 5 calories a pack, gives you fresh breath, and is portable enough to fit in your pocket.

 

  

Crystal 51 is like Pop Rocks that give you energy. We wanted to give you the energy boost you need to get through your day with caffeine, while bringing back that sense of childlike joy and excitement.

 

Crystal 51 is an energy boost you can feel good taking. It has just the right amount of caffeine (80mg per pack), helping you feel awake and refreshed.

Our Blue Ice flavor uses isomalt as a sweetener, so it is lower in calorie count while protecting your teeth, and Green Ice uses natural sugars while still staying low-calorie and low-carb.

Make Crystal 51 Cheaper
By redesigning the packing process itself and making some needed adjustments to the equipment, we'll be able to reduce the mass market retail price of Crystal 51 from $4.50/pack down to $2.99/pack so it is cheaper than leading premium coffee, energy drinks and shots on the market.

Bring Crystal 51 To Convenience Stores
This requires inventory that needs to be placed on consignment. By contributing to the campaign, you’re helping us get the next round of inventory for convenience channels all over the USA.

Increase Manufacturing Capabilities
By pre-ordering ingredients used in our secret formula in higher quantities, we will be able to mix in higher volumes with even more precision and also increase output.

Add More Flavors For Crystal 51 Energy
We’ll be adding up to 4 new flavors to Crystal 51 energy. These flavors will be chosen by you and other contributors. Be a part of this revolution today!

Embed Other Active Ingredients
We’re already in the process of embedding melatonin into carbonated crystals, and we don’t plan on stopping there. With your help, we’ll be able to start the process of adding other active ingredients, such as insulin, vitamins, and more. Just imagine the possibilities! Your contribution will help us change the world.

story: A place with Great People Good Food is coming....
story_txt: A place with Great People Good Food is coming....

story:
Our heart is about creating community - we are all about the village. For years we've daydreamed about opening an inn, a cafe, a pub - somewhere we can enjoy the crazy and quiet rhythms of life with our neighbors. We have big dreams, but we're just a little family, so we're starting small. 

Our custom built food truck is just beautiful, to be perfectly honest. We worked with a great group out of Waco to build the truck with purpose and efficiency in mind. Then, we cut, sanded, and stained the siding ourselves to just the right color and finish. Kirk has had the privilege to be part of the Thunderbird coffee team here in Austin, training and working with some of the best of the best coffee people in all the nation. Their wisdom, friendship and encouragement is what has us here at the finish line. 

The truck is bought and paid for, but some of our equipment is being financed or on loan. We want to be able to run our business debt free, and with the best possible equipment, because coffee is both an art and a science, and it requires precision. 

Contributing to this campaign will help us to start this truck out strong, plus help get our name out there in the community.  So many of y'all have been walking with us for years as we've pursued this dream, and we know you're looking for the chance to celebrate with us as we finally bring it to life.

"Square pegs in a round hole" - our family has never felt content to just go with the norm. We believe that we were made with purpose, and one of those is cultivating and hosting community. We are excited to live out the next step of that through this mobile cafe, serving delicious drinks and treats to our friends here in central ATX on the campus at UT.  Thank y'all for walking with us!!!

story:
The Story of Crema

My name is Aidan Miller, and I am 16 years old. I was born in West Africa, and after 11 years in Togo, our family moved to Rwanda with a vision of contributing to the spiritual and physical development of this beautiful recovering nation. We've been in Rwanda for 5 years now, and my family has helped start a new Christian international school, Virunga Valley Academy, where I am currently in 11th grade. This is the story of my dream to start a coffee shop in our town: Musanze, Rwanda.

Our Dream

Rwanda is writing a new story of hope and progress. As a part of that new story of reconciliation, we believe spaces where people can relax and connect with each other are an essential part of our city's development. Crema will be a place where people can not only find great coffee, but also experience community and celebrate creativity. Crema will contribute to the development of our community in three ways:

-Providing job training and employment for vulnerable youth in our community.

-Providing a place for creative projects to be displayed and sold, especially products that support important social projects in Rwanda like Peace House, a non-profit that helps girls come off the streets and make a living by learning to make clothes, jewelry, and accessories.

-Selling and promoting Question Coffee (questioncoffee.com), a coffee produced by the non-profit Sustainable Harvest in partnership with two women's cooperatives in Rwanda who are growing some of the best coffee in the country.

What We Need & What You Get

  • Our goal for this campaign is to raise $15,000. These funds will be used to renovate the historical building we have secured for the coffee shop-- a house on the main road in Musanze that is over 50 years old and has a lot of character, but needs some loving care--, to buy furniture and supplies for the shop, to build our coffee bar and equip our kitchen, and to pay for six months of rent. After an initial private fundraising campaign, we have already purchased a commercial grade Simonelli espresso machine and a commercial grinder, the most important tools for our shop (featured in our campaign video above). Now we need to create the space where those machines will do their magic!

Our perks for our supporters:

                                                                                                                                                    

We've got a great range of Crema branded products planned as a thank you to our supporters. These include stickers, coffee cups, t-shirts, bags of fresh Question coffee, handmade jewelry from the girls at Peace House, the opportunity to have your name included on the Crema founders wall at the coffee shop, and the ultimate: a 3-day coffee experience with the Crema team in Rwanda.

  • If for any reason we are not able to raise enough to make this dream happen, funds raised for this campaign will be donated to Peace House, a program of Africa Transformation Network Rwanda (atn-rwanda.org).

The Impact

Picture your favorite coffee shop. Now imagine that that shop, and all the other coffee shops in your city, didn't exist. What would you do? Kureig machines can only do so much! Your favorite coffee shop is about more than the coffee-- it is a place where you can breathe, find solace, connect with friends, or settle down with a great book. We need this kind of space in our city!

We also believe the future development of Rwanda is tied to entrepreneurship. Small businesses are the back-bone of growing economies, and Crema will provide job skills and training for Rwandan youth in our community and an important market for local social projects.

Our Team

Every dream needs a team of people to make it happen. Creama is no different. Our team includes Prince Kamari, a young Rwandan entrepreneur who just graduated from high school at Wellspring Academy in Kigali. Prince's family started J. Lynns, a coffee and bagel shop in Kigali, where Prince has gained experience in working at and running a successful shop. Aidan and Prince are the core business team at Crema. I have also trained my good friend Saad Rutayisire as our first Rwandan barista.

I started drinking coffee when I was 6 years old (I know, crazy!) when my Kindergarten teacher would make a small cup for me from time to time. I loved it then, and that love has grown into a passion. About two years ago, a friend gave me a small Mr. Coffee espresso machine and I began learning to make specialty coffee. I was somehow able to coax coffee from that little machine that people liked, so I saved up money from tips and bought a Breville espresso machine. During the summer of 2016, I had the opportunity to study at BaristaPro in Nairobi, Kenya where I earned the Specialty Coffee Association of Europe's certification in espresso based drinks. With this training under my belt, I began making coffee at the small bar in my bedroom that my Dad designed when we built our new house. The response to this bedroom-based coffee shop has been really positive, so a dream began to grow in my heart to start a full coffee shop in our city.

                        

                                         The "Famous" Bedroom Coffe Shop

Risks & Challenges

Every business startup includes risk. We have tried to mitigate these risks in several ways. Crema has had a long period of "soft opening" over the past few months as we have operated from my bedroom. We have found that there is demand for our product and enthusiastic local support for the idea. We also have a strong core support system in our parents, the Millers and Kamaris, who have experience in starting new businesses in Rwanda. We do not yet know the challenges we will face, but we have a committed team and support structure ready to face them!

Other Ways You Can Help

Tell as many people as possible about our campaign! You can use the Indegogo share tools to easily do this! Share on Facebook, Twitter, e-mail, or any other way you can think of!

Thanks so much for taking the time to learn about Crema and helping make our dream a reality!

I loved it then, and that love has grown into a passion. About two years ago, a friend gave me a small Mr. Coffee espresso machine and I began learning to make specialty coffee. I was somehow able to coax coffee from that little machine that people liked, so I saved up money from tips and bought a Breville espresso machine. During the summer of 2016, I had the opportunity to study at BaristaPro in Nairobi, Kenya where I earned the Specialty Coffee Association of Europe's certification in espresso based drinks. With this training under my belt, I began making coffee at the small bar in my bedroom that my Dad designed when we built our new house. The response to this bedroom-based coffee shop has been really positive, so a dream began to grow in my heart to start a full coffee shop in our city.
                         
                                         The "Famous" Bedroom Coffe Shop

Risks & Challenges
Every business startup includes risk. We have tried to mitigate these risks in several ways. Crema has had a long period of "soft opening" over the past few months as we have operated from my bedroom. We have found that there is demand for our product and enthusiastic local support for the idea. We also have a strong core support system in our parents, the Millers and Kamaris, who have experience in starting new businesses in Rwanda. We do not yet know the challenges we will face, but we have a committed team and support structure ready to face them!

Other Ways You Can Help
Tell as many people as possible about our campaign! You can use the Indegogo share tools to easily do this! Share on Facebook, Twitter, e-mail, or any other way you can think of!
Thanks so much for taking the time to learn about Crema and helping make our dream a reality!

story:
Introducing PowerOnco

50 to 80% of chemotherapy patients have nutritional issues according to the National Cancer Institute.  Surprisingly, until now, there was no nutritional supplement specifically designed for these patients available.

 

 

Nutronco's breakthrough, nutrient rich supplement fills an empty space in healthcare that has never been addressed in such a comprehensive way before, and contains compounds specifically designed to help support key body functions and provide vital nutrition both during and after chemotherapy.*

 

 

POWERONCO is comprised of a premium protein that is non-GMO, lactose and gluten free, and sourced from free roaming, grass fed cows that are never treated with hormones or antibiotics.  It provides all essential and nonessential amino acids such as leucine, arginine, and glutamine, which help maintain muscle mass and function. POWERONCO was specifically designed to address the special nutritional requirements of patients undergoing chemotherapy, and includes a balanced blend of vitamins and minerals such as vitamin B, D, zinc, calcium, and selenium. POWERONCO is fortified with nucleotides to maximize immune support. POWERONCO uses only natural ingredients, has no added sugar, and contains a multipurpose proprietary probiotic blend to aid with digestive health.*

 

 

POWERONCO includes key ingredients that help support the immune system and decrease oxidative stress, which may also help alleviate the occasional non-life-threatening side effects of chemotherapy while not interfering with the effectiveness of the treatments.*

 

Our Goals

Nutronco is launching this crowdfunding campaign to accomplish three key objectives:

1.  Reach our campaign goal of $100,000,which will support us in our mission to donate a 3 lb supply of PowerOnco to at least 1,000 patients in need who are currently undergoing chemotherapy.

2.  Spread the word about our company, our mission, and our product; continue to raise awareness about the importance of nutrition; and grow a company that will continue to develop and revolutionize how nutrition benefits people both during and after chemotherapy.

3.  Make a vital change in how the medical community approaches the treatment of disease, and spread awareness of the emerging clinical data regarding nutrition and chemotherapy.  

 

 

Your support is crucial to our success and the success of this campaign. Spread the word about Nutronco, share the links on social media, and in addition to helping donate these vital products to a patient in need, you will also help raise awareness and build a company that will continue to develop and revolutionize how nutrition benefits people.

 

 

Our campaign goal is to give away a minimum of 1,000 of the PowerOnco products that are scientifically formulated for chemotherapy patients and post chemotherapy.  Help us make a difference!

 

Nutronco Timeline

Below is a timeline of our projected product releases, which include GuardOnco, PowerOnco+, RenewOnco, and additional product lines such as Nerve Health, Healthy Aging, and Brain Health.   

 

Dr. Peter Acs, Founder

Learn more about the founder of Nutronco, Peter Acs, MD, PhD, and what inspired him to create this easy to use, all-in-one supplement specifically designed for the unique nutritional needs of chemotherapy patients.

 

 
 

 

Dr. Peter Acs on Chemotherapy & Nutrition

 

 

Patients receiving chemotherapy face a combination of unique nutritional challenges that need to be addressed in order support their overall health and quality of life. Unfortunately, there is not enough emphasis on this important aspect of care. Over the years while working as an oncologist, I realized the significant challenges we face regarding nutrition.

It really bothered me to see how patients would struggle to find a nutritional supplement that provides the necessary amount of protein, vitamins, and protective compounds. Additionally, all available supplements contain sugar.

Basically, there is no nutritional supplement specifically designed for people during chemotherapy.

These experiences motivated me to found a company whose mission is to create a nutritional supplement that is scientifically formulated specifically for this population.

Our products contain the vital ingredients necessary to help support the body in the areas most needed during chemotherapy: decrease oxidative stress, support a proper immune response, alleviate non-life threatening minor chemotherapy side effects, help with appetite, nausea, and energy. It contains vitamins, electrolytes and a special proprietary blend of probiotics. We use only the highest quality protein, and no added sugar.*

This product is designed to provide key nutritional support for the patient in order to optimize their overall quality of life, and in no way meant to replace chemo-, biological or immunotherapy. At the same time, none of the ingredients interfere with efficacy of these treatments.*

 

Why Is Nutrition Important When Receiving Chemotherapy?

50 to 80% of cancer patients have nutritional issues. Patients simply do not get the proper nutrition to maintain lean muscle mass and weight.  They experience increased levels of oxidative stress, lack of energy, and other side effects of chemotherapy.

 

 

These additional side effects can include occasional diarrhea, nausea and vomiting, among others.

If we are able to improve nutrition, support lean muscle mass and strength, support the immune system and decrease oxidative stress, we can help maintain the overall health of these patients, and that enables us to treat people with chemotherapy more effectively. This is the goal we are determined to achieve.

 

Ingredients From Medical Point Of View

Our goal is to provide a nutritional supplement to deliver high quality nutrition, while providing additional benefits, including managing minor symptoms and side effects of chemotherapy treatment.

 

 

In our supplement we use a high quality, purified, natural, premium protein that is non-GMO, lactose and gluten free, and sourced from free roaming, grass fed cows that are never treated with hormones or antibiotics. It provides all essential and nonessential amino acids such as leucine, arginine, and glutamine, which help maintain muscle mass and function. There is increasing amount of evidence implying that the ketogenic diet (sugar free) is an effective adjuvant treatment for patient receiving chemotherapy.

For this reason, our supplement does not contain any added traditional carbohydrates, or added sugars. Besides promoting nutrition, our supplement contains ingredients that may help support the immune system, decrease oxidative stress and increase overall health and well-being. Among other compounds, we use zinc and nucleotides, a combination that along with omega-3 fatty acids are effective in supporting the immune system.*

L-Carnitine was shown to support a healthy weight and improve the quality of life in patients, and additionally plays a role in ameliorating chemotherapy-related fatigue.*

Scientific data indicate that quercetin helps reduce oxidative stress. L-glutamine supports liver health, whereas zinc improves appetite and taste, and ginger reduces occasional nausea and vomiting.*

While taurine helps support muscle function and cardiovascular health, beta-carotene will help to further support muscle strength and physical activity. Our supplement also provides electrolytes to maintain homeostasis, and helps rehydrate the body and prevent dehydration.*

Vitamin D and calcium are very important to help maintain strong bones. We fortify our supplement with an array of vitamins that further help with occasional digestive problems, promote immune health, and promote nerve health.*

PowerOnco is also unique for another reason: it contains probiotic bacteria.*

Probiotics stimulate both specific and nonspecific components of the immune system. There is ample evidence that probiotics can reduce oxidative stress and strengthen homeostasis, thus helping to reduce minor side effects associated with chemotherapy. Probiotics can help with occasional diarrhea and other digestive problems as well as help support the immune system.*

Our supplement fills an empty space in patient care that has never been addressed in such a comprehensive way before.

 

Nutritional Pyramid

People with different diseases have specific nutritional needs. This is especially true for people receiving chemotherapy.

 

 

As an original concept we created a novel food pyramid specifically tailored for these people. This pyramid is a visual summary of the important aspects of nutritional support for this population.

 

 

Each block represents a specific area that the ingredients in the supplement will target. Essentially, the pyramid shows not what patients should eat, but the specific nutritional needs for each condition.  The strong foundation is a good quality protein based diet on which other ingredients build, with indications covering oxidative stress, immune support, organ protection, energy, appetite, nausea, vitamins, electrolytes and probiotics.*

The combination of ingredients addressing these issues will provide powerful nutritional support for people undergoing chemotherapy.

 

Connect on Social Media

Visit and follow us on social media, share and spread the word about this amazing product, and donate towards a better, healthier future!

story:
Inception

 

Created by drinks lovers for drinks lovers!!

L.A.B.inc. has been created out of our passion for excellent drinks. 

Working in the food and beverage industry for over a decade we have recognised the need to have excellent cocktails available at reasonable prices in order to make them easily accessible by anyone, at any time and anywhere. 

Now you can have excellent hand crafted cocktails in the reach of your fingertips.

L.A.B.inc. is producing high quality bottled cocktails, made out of the freshest ingredients, without adding any aditives or preservatives, and which do not require any additional preparation or ingredients. And because we stay true to our quality concept, this is reflected in our spirit selection as well.

Think of us as your own private mixologist. 

We aim to make beautifully crafted cocktails casual, fun, easy and ready for any occasion. Simply pick up the bottle, shake, open and serve over ice.  

At the moment we offer 12  cocktails. However many more are on the way as well as the option of creating your own bespoke range. 

Just sit back, relax and enjoy, we'll take care of everything else. 

 

Future Vision of the Company

We all know how hard it is for bars and restaurants around the world to hire, train and retain employees, therefore our ultimate goal is to be able to become a supplier for other F&B outlets.

Our principle is: Bars don't produce their own spirits because they can very easily buy excellent quality ones. L. A. B. is trying to do the same with cocktails, taking the production pressure away from bar staff, thus enabling them to do more of the good stuff like focusing on customer service. In return we offer fresh, consistent, quality drinks which can be ready in a few seconds.

By supporting our growth you will be enabling us to reach all your favourite spots and ensure you will only be drinking the finest cocktails every time you go out.

 

It's all in your hands

 

So far L.A.B. inc. has been present on the local market and up to now we have never had an unhappy customer!!!

Help us ensure you can get your hands on these amazing drinks as soon as possible and we will guarantee you won't stop once you have tried them.

We are aiming to use the funds in order to set up a factory which will bottle those babies to make sure they can be distributed anywhere in the world.

By doing so you will be able to shop for them online no matter where you are as well as find them distributed around some of your favourite hang out spots.

What would be more wonderful than knowing you can always enjoy a consistent quality drink? All we wish is to be able to do that for you.

The funds will mainly be used for securing a factory space, production equipment, and operating supplies. A little bit will be put aside for us to ship all those goodies once they are ready to travel.

 

Take the next step

 

Although we managed to get very far we need just one last push to be able to offer you some of the best things in life.

In order to increase our production and be able to bring this to your doorstep we have to set up a larger production unit capable to cater for our, but most especially your, needs.

There are going to be challenges down the road, but our previous experience will provide us with the means to overcome them. However, we can only make it happen with your support.

And don't forget there are many ways you can contribute, and funding is only one of them. Please share our project with all your near and dear ones, many opportunities can arise when great minds come together.

Facebook/ Instagram 

@cocktailLABinc

#LABinc

story:
About us|

Hyperion's sole owner is Anays Ponce, originally from Venezuela and grew up in Durham, North Carolina. She is also an Army veteran. 

Hyperion is the kind of place we'd would love to go to as customers. Cozy, calm, and creative. 

The seed was planted in her mind when she found herself asking why somebody in Mebane hadn't already opened a craft cocktail bar. Eventually she had the thought, "Well, I'm somebody." 

We have made a lot of progress, particularly thanks to our architect Anna Wirth (@flockdna). We have rented a wonderful underground location on Clay street. We have painted, we have purchased all of our furniture and equipment, and we've submitted our construction permit application. 

The challenge with this space, however, is that it is not remotely ADA (Americans with Disabilities Act) compliant and we must make it so, without cutting corners. 

 

What We Need |

We need funds that will go toward making this basement space accessible for people who are differently-abled.

We are raising the floor on about half of the space. It is currently inaccessible for people who are differently-abled because guests must step down to get in through our rear entrance, they must step up to enter the restroom, and they must step up to reach the bar. 

We must expand the existing bathroom to increase its clearance to make it accessible. 

We must build a paved accessible parking pad and path that leads to our rear entrance.

The Impact|

Hyperion is all about inclusion. This is why we are happy to do everything we can to make our space inclusive to guests who are differently-abled, but we need your help.

Risks & Challenges|

As they say with construction, expect it to cost twice as much and take twice as long. However, because it is a small space, the challenges are on a smaller scale than a large bar. There is a possibility that we will not raise enough with this campaign alone, but we are committed and we will not give up on this project. 

Other Ways You Can Help|

Share, share, share, share! Then share again!
