story:
From Napa to Appalachia!

Elizabeth, Loren, Ava Jean and their doggies, Eli and Jackson, are known as the 'Country Gingers.' They grew up in Northern California and have always been very involved with food and wine. They stumbled upon a winery when helping their best friends move from California back to Virginia and fell in love with the beautiful land, delicious wines and gracious community. They have made the cross country trek and are thrilled to be the carrying on the Abingdon Vineyards legacy!

Read more in the newspaper article HERE or on our website HERE!

Next Level Needs

Abingdon Vineyards is in a beautiful location, right on the South Holston River. We have 13 acres of grapes and make a wide variety of quality wines. The property is truly beautiful and deserves to be cared for and shared with the community! 

Purchasing the winery is a long stretch for our family. With a huge mortgage and a full staff, it will be a challenge to navigate the initial growth of the winery, especially during this first winter! We also have a lot of work to do to upgrade the property to make it ideal for all of the events we would like to host for the community: wine dinners, music festivals, crawfish boils, weddings and more. This is where YOU come in! You can help us to improve the property and become part of the Abingdon Vineyards family!

WINERY UPGRADE

  • Upgrade the kitchen to code for catering events - $10,000
  • Install outdoor kitchen for events - $10,000
  • Build creekside deck for stage & more seating - $15,000
  • Improve furniture and fixtures for the tasting room and event room - $12,000
  • Commission more locally built picnic tables - $8,000
  • Rain cover for patio - $10,000

We are also eager to plant more native North American grapes, which are adapted to our climate and are more environmentally responsible. This will ensure a long future for this local treasure!

SUSTAINABILITY

  • Planting more native North American varieties that withstand frost and summer rains - $50,000 per acre

The Impact

Abingdon Vineyards has the potential to be an ideal community gathering space for live music, art, fine food and all other celebrations of good living. We want as many people as possible to be able to enjoy the fine wine, stunning scenery and generous hospitality of Abingdon Vineyards. We want to do all this while taking great care of the beautiful land, community and culture that surrounds us. It takes a village! 

Challenges

Purchasing the winery was far beyond our reach, but help from the former owners and our friends and family made this dream a reality. It will be very financially challenging the first few years, as we need to make big purchases and slowly increase our production to a financially sustainable place. 

The biggest challenge to growing grapes here in Virginia is the climate. We can have late frost (which took over 40% of our grapes this year) and lots of summer rain, which can cause rot (which took and additional 15% of our grapes this year, for a total crop loss of 55%) Luckily, there are native grape varieties and hybrids that are well suited to Virginia. We would like to plant more of these varieties to ensure the environmental and financial longevity of Abingdon Vineyards.

The climate also poses challenges to events! We are need of more rain and sun shelters, so we can gather and celebrate outside, no matter the weather. Improving the inside spaces will ensure the community can be warm and cozy, even as the snow falls.

How you can help:

​We hope you will enjoy one of our "perks" listed to the right and become a part of our Abingdon Vineyards support team! In addition, please:

  • Share the campaign and spread the word by Facebook, Instagram or email. Tag us @abingdonvineyards
  • Come visit us at the winery! We are open Wed-Sun from 11-6 for tastings and picnics. Kids, dogs and kayaks welcome!
  • Join us for a special event at the winery! Here are just a few that are on the books:
    • Whole Hog Roast (in partnership with JJ's, Adam Bolt & Wolf Hills Brewing) - Sept. 2
    • Oktoberfest (in partnership with The Tavern and Studio Brew) - Sept. 30
    • Wine Dinner (in partnership with Joel Jerkins) - Oct. 20
    • Halloween Party (also Ava's birthday party! With guest chef Chris Noone) - Oct. 28
    • Harvest Dinner (with guest chef Charles Parker from Heartwood) - Nov. 17
    • Holiday Wine Dinner (in partnership with Joel Jerkins) - Dec. 15
  • Host your own event at the winery! Birthday parties, anniversaries, book clubs, church groups, weddings... we would love to help you celebrate!

This is only the start of our aspirations! If you would like to be an investor in our future vineyard blocks or upcoming distillery, please contact Loren@abingdonvineyards.com

We are forever indebted and honored to spend a lifetime here in beautiful Southwest Virginia!

 

What makes us happy... friends and family enjoying Abingdon Vineyards!

We are grateful our little girl gets to grow up in such a wonderful community and setting!

We are honored to be able to preserve some of Virginia's rich history!

We are looking forward to sharing this slice of heaven with you! Thank you for your support!
story_txt:
From Napa to Appalachia!
Elizabeth, Loren, Ava Jean and their doggies, Eli and Jackson, are known as the 'Country Gingers.' They grew up in Northern California and have always been very involved with food and wine. They stumbled upon a winery when helping their best friends move from California back to Virginia and fell in love with the beautiful land, delicious wines and gracious community. They have made the cross country trek and are thrilled to be the carrying on the Abingdon Vineyards legacy!
Read more in the newspaper article HERE or on our website HERE!

Next Level Needs
Abingdon Vineyards is in a beautiful location, right on the South Holston River. We have 13 acres of grapes and make a wide variety of quality wines. The property is truly beautiful and deserves to be cared for and shared with the community! 
Purchasing the winery is a long stretch for our family. With a huge mortgage and a full staff, it will be a challenge to navigate the initial growth of the winery, especially during this first winter! We also have a lot of work to do to upgrade the property to make it ideal for all of the events we would like to host for the community: wine dinners, music festivals, crawfish boils, weddings and more. This is where YOU come in! You can help us to improve the property and become part of the Abingdon Vineyards family!
WINERY UPGRADE

Upgrade the kitchen to code for catering events - $10,000
Install outdoor kitchen for events - $10,000
Build creekside deck for stage & more seating - $15,000
Improve furniture and fixtures for the tasting room and event room - $12,000
Commission more locally built picnic tables - $8,000
Rain cover for patio - $10,000

We are also eager to plant more native North American grapes, which are adapted to our climate and are more environmentally responsible. This will ensure a long future for this local treasure!
SUSTAINABILITY
Planting more native North American varieties that withstand frost and summer rains - $50,000 per acre

The Impact
Abingdon Vineyards has the potential to be an ideal community gathering space for live music, art, fine food and all other celebrations of good living. We want as many people as possible to be able to enjoy the fine wine, stunning scenery and generous hospitality of Abingdon Vineyards. We want to do all this while taking great care of the beautiful land, community and culture that surrounds us. It takes a village! 

Challenges
Purchasing the winery was far beyond our reach, but help from the former owners and our friends and family made this dream a reality. It will be very financially challenging the first few years, as we need to make big purchases and slowly increase our production to a financially sustainable place. 
The biggest challenge to growing grapes here in Virginia is the climate. We can have late frost (which took over 40% of our grapes this year) and lots of summer rain, which can cause rot (which took and additional 15% of our grapes this year, for a total crop loss of 55%) Luckily, there are native grape varieties and hybrids that are well suited to Virginia. We would like to plant more of these varieties to ensure the environmental and financial longevity of Abingdon Vineyards.
The climate also poses challenges to events! We are need of more rain and sun shelters, so we can gather and celebrate outside, no matter the weather. Improving the inside spaces will ensure the community can be warm and cozy, even as the snow falls.

How you can help:
​We hope you will enjoy one of our "perks" listed to the right and become a part of our Abingdon Vineyards support team! In addition, please:

Share the campaign and spread the word by Facebook, Instagram or email. Tag us @abingdonvineyards

Come visit us at the winery! We are open Wed-Sun from 11-6 for tastings and picnics. Kids, dogs and kayaks welcome!
Join us for a special event at the winery! Here are just a few that are on the books:

Whole Hog Roast (in partnership with JJ's, Adam Bolt & Wolf Hills Brewing) - Sept. 2

Oktoberfest (in partnership with The Tavern and Studio Brew) - Sept. 30

Wine Dinner (in partnership with Joel Jerkins) - Oct. 20

Halloween Party (also Ava's birthday party! With guest chef Chris Noone) - Oct. 28

Harvest Dinner (with guest chef Charles Parker from Heartwood) - Nov. 17

Holiday Wine Dinner (in partnership with Joel Jerkins) - Dec. 15


Host your own event at the winery! Birthday parties, anniversaries, book clubs, church groups, weddings... we would love to help you celebrate!

This is only the start of our aspirations! If you would like to be an investor in our future vineyard blocks or upcoming distillery, please contact Loren@abingdonvineyards.com
We are forever indebted and honored to spend a lifetime here in beautiful Southwest Virginia!
 
What makes us happy... friends and family enjoying Abingdon Vineyards!

We are grateful our little girl gets to grow up in such a wonderful community and setting!

We are honored to be able to preserve some of Virginia's rich history!

We are looking forward to sharing this slice of heaven with you! Thank you for your support!

story:
Don't Slip, Get a Grip

Meet Brew Soldier, your key chain warrior. At the thickness and length of a standard house key, the Brew Soldier falls in line on your key chain. Cut from Grade 5 Titanium and featuring a Grip Tooth, this opener never slips when called to action. Additionally, the optional Orbital Grey finish adds that extra bit of stealth that your bottle opener deserves. The unique shape keeps your keys looking professional yet always beer ready.

Don't slip, get a grip with the Brew Soldier bottle opener.

 

How it Works

The Brew Soldier features an Eagle Grip Tooth which hooks under the edge of the bottle cap during cap removal. Since it will never slip, the opener can be much thinner than your typical aluminium key chain bottle opener.  

 

Brew Soldier Specs

  • It is the height and thickness of a standard house key (2.25" long x 0.10" thick)
  • Made from grade 5 titanium
  • Features a Grip Tooth to ensure you are always locked onto the cap of your beverage
  • Available in the same Orbital Grey finish as what is on the NASA solar arrays.
  • Weighs 0.006 lbs (2.5 g)
  • Made in the USA!

 

What Our Customers Are Saying

"Brew Soldier is great. Got it on Friday and used it over the weekend." - Colton

"My Brew Soldier just opened it's first beer, it definitely didn't slip! It's even lighter than I imagined!" - Malcolm

"Got my Brew Soldier today and just tried it, works great!" - Todd

"This thing is incredible, so much better than my old aluminium opener!" - Ryan

 

Shipping Details

All orders ship USPS First Class which includes a tracking number. Orders are shipped in a 6" x 8" white cardboard mailer.

 

Refund & Return Policy

You may return our product for a full refund for any reason within 10 days of receiving it. It must be returned in the original packaging. If the product is defective or damaged, we will pay for return shipping. Your credit card will be debited within 7 business days of the return. 

 

FAQs

How small is Brew Soldier? - Brew Soldier is the height and thickness of a standard house key.

What shipping service do you use? - USPS First Class for both Domestic and International orders.

What kind of packaging should I be looking for in the mail? - Orders ship in a 6″ x 8″ rigid white envelope.

What is the diameter of the opening for the keyring? - The diameter is .180"

 

More Picture on Instagram

@ pry.me_bottle_opener

story:
The desire for great beer is growing every year as consumers reject bland beers, opting instead for flavoursome interesting niche beers brewed by passionate people. The UK has now over 1,800 small and micro-breweries and this figure is set to continue into the next 5 years at least.

Top of the Hops operates from a unit in a central location in Stockton on tees. We have recently found a suitable premises that will cater to our needs and will attract target market.

Top of the Hops aims to be the one-stop shop for all things craft, selling beer in bottled, can, draft and keg sourced from local and UK breweries as well as beers form the USA and Europe. Customers will be able to consume or taste beer on the premises as well as take-out in the form of ‘growler’ bottles.

Top of the Hops customer will also be able to fill their beer vessels or ‘growler’ from the specialist beer pouring unit, and a range of 8 beers will be available on tap during the week. Growlers are attractive amber glass bottles, originating from the USA, containing 64oz of beer (roughly 1.9litres in the UK). This state- of-the-art counter-pressure filling system ensures that the beer remains fresh for up to six weeks without any loss of carbonation.

When customers refill their growler they will avoid the cost of bottling, meaning growlers can be up to 20% cheaper by volume than pre-packaged beer. Top of the hops will also regularly showcase beers on growler not available in bottle due to their limitation or one off nature.

Top of the hop will also have a online store with over 500 beers to choose from.

All funding will got to expanding our bar and shop. We will be able to add more seating to attract more customers, promote our business through advertising, set up an online website to reach customers outside of our local town and buy equipment needed such as, temperature controlled fridges, flash coolers, counter pressure filling systems and a temperature controlled cellar with tap wall.

With your help we can make this a reality.

story:
Gardening Vertically with Varden

A space-saving, 2-foot by 3-foot wall-mounted gardening system that holds up to 36 plants, with a drip irrigation system for easy watering. Enjoy the benefits of growing your own herbs and nutrient-dense greens at home. Empowering everyone to start gardening even if short on space. The next evolution of gardening is vertical!

Our Vertical Gardening Story

For the past eight years, we have been designing living walls for restaurants, hotels, and retailers who want to display beautiful ornamental plants in a unique and artistic way.

A few years ago, we noticed a surge in interest in the Varden Living Walls from organic farmers, many in urban areas, who began using our structures to grow leafy greens and herbs on rooftops or small fields. They liked the vertical concept because it saves them precious space and allows them to grow more food, in soil,  without more space.

Seeing urban farmers’ innovative use of our product inspired us. With the sustainability and local produce movement, we’ve become convinced that our focus should be on food. Knowing that nutritious, clean, food access and equality are problems in need of solutions now.

We began tweaking the Varden system to be the best Vertical Garden that everyone can use to start growing their own food even if short on space. We are there! 

About the Varden Kit

Join the sustainable food revolution with the Varden Kit, our new, smaller version of the Varden Living Wall.

This sturdy structure can be mounted on a wall, fence, balcony or even a post. Herbs, lettuce, spinach, kale and edible flowers grow beautifully in our optional custom-blended, pesticide-free, compost-based soil. Or save on shipping and use your own soil media.

Plants thrive due to our Vardensok, a breathable mesh tube that hold the soil, and the efficient drip irrigation sitting beneath them, right at the root zone.

The Varden Kit is easy to install and comes with a cardboard template to help with placement of the fasteners. The Kit can be installed in less than an hour.

The Food Revolution

So many people live in urban areas with poor access to fresh local food grown in soil.  Even when produce is available, it's hard to know how it was grown and what was sprayed on it. Access to clean, fresh food is an increasing problem. The world needs to get back to home-gardening again.  Time to garden and space to garden are huge hurdles for most people. Living urban with a small backyard, no yard or maybe even only a small patio or balcony is challenging even for skilled gardeners. To be useful for everyone, we needed to create a small but productive size that could be easily shipped, quickly installed and ensure success.  Our Varden uses soil for great flavor and nutrient density, just like "mother nature" intended!

The Varden Kit is our 100% Made in the USA solution and the starting point for the home Victory Garden revolution. We have designed all the parts and figured out how to assemble them in an affordable, fun, box kit to get new gardeners going fast. Now we need to spread the word so everyone can start gardening vertically. Even though it's designed, patented and in production, we have accessories to complete, need lots of component inventory, need to increase our staff for box kit assembly, outreach efforts and providing consumer access. There is so much more to do in completing our mission of evolving how people grow and access their food!

Our long-term goal is to see Vardening become the norm and for vertical gardeners to add on to their systems, making bigger Vertical Garden to feed their families. Nothing beats the nutrition and taste of cooking with fresh cut herbs and greens. We are developing an indoor kit that enables gardeners to bring their Vardening indoors for year-round harvests. Our design team is working to perfect the indoor kit components, the trim options, the watering system and lighting. We are almost there and need help to make the last push into full-on, in-home vertical gardens that feed people year-round. Since Varden is so scalable, we see opportunities ahead in the restaurant, grocery and even greenhouse markets too. 

What We Need & What You Get

  • We need to raise $15,000 now in order to add staff for kit assembly, push our gardening evolution message and continue our momentum in completion of the indoor kits in time for the fall. 
  • We offer great discounts on the Varden Kit so supporters can get growing and feeling great about it, plus we have some cool wearables and gear to roll out as we go along! By supporting us you become an insider with a view into our progress and evolution. 
  • All funding goes into growing the business, people to make it happen and messaging to get the word out now, so families sheltering at home can start growing their own.

The Impact

  • We believe in self-sufficiency, sustainability and secure access to food. We understand that our climate is changing and the planet's soil is degraded and being lost.

  • Now more than ever, the world needs to know where its food comes from, how it’s grown, when it’s picked and what’s been sprayed on it.

  • The worlds population is increasingly more urban and it makes sense that local growing is one of the solutions so harvesting can be closer to time of need, at the peak of freshness and nutrition. Gardening at home, urban and community gardens and even indoor vertical farming represent food security, access and equity. 

  • Our mission is to improve the way the world eats by evolving the garden.

  • The next evolution of gardening is vertical and it allows nutritious food to be grown in small spaces, out-of-the-way places and empowers everyone to grow  more of their own food.

  • We make elegantly designed, high functioning, American-Made products that will last for many years. Our Varden Kit is just the beginning and it enables everyone to start growing their own food for fun, beauty, nutrition and security.

  • Join us in our mission to improve the way the world eats, start gardening vertically and help us get the word out. 

Risks & Challenges

  • Over the past 30 years we have designed, patented and launched other products in the living wall category with good success. We know this market and the plant side of it better than just about anyone. The need for the evolution of food is immediate and the market is fast moving. We made it all the way to product production and had to decide to either run the business slowly to conserve funds OR, focus entirely on fund-raising through venture capital.
  • So far we have self-funded to manage risk in sustaining our venture. Covid-19 and cash-flow are concerns for us and could continue to be hurdles to growth.
  • We are committed to our mission and Crowdfunding allows us to get the word out and raise needed funds while continuing to run the business. Now is the time and Varden is the right product for the rapidly evolving and hungry world we live in!

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Even if you don't contribute but love our mission, please help us get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
  • Push our message out to your social media friends and use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
The genesis of the Pod Pistol

The concept for the Pod Pistol came to me when I was serving with Army Special Operations and spending a lot of time around guns and drinking a lot of pod coffee. It occurred to me that there were a bunch of similarities between the shape of bullets and coffee pods and that it would be cool to do something with that. Fast forward 5 years to my discharge from the Army and when all was said and done, one of the things I seemed to miss the most about my military time was the tactile experience of operating guns, and I looped back around to the coffee pod gun concept with an emphasis on capturing some of the tactile experience of handling guns. Around the same time I was completing a subject in entrepreneurship to finish up my MBA and I thought I'd go all in and found Coffee Cannon to bring my vision to life! Starting with a very basic concept that I made myself with parts from a hardware store I created the first prototype. Pretty quickly I exceeded my ability for further development and I reached out to an industrial designer to prove the concept with a 3D printed device (pictured below).

Once we had proven that we could make a magazine-fed, bolt-action coffee pod dispenser work, it was off to a larger industrial design firm to further refine the device and prepare it for mass manufacture. After a further couple of years of development the refined Pod Pistol is finally ready to go into production!

What We Need & What You Get

We are ready to rock with production of the moulds that will allow us to mass produce the Pod Pistol. The funds from success in this campaign will allow us to produce the first run of Pod Pistols and deliver them to the exclusive Alpha Team of buyers. The plan is to keep the first production run small and we anticipate that only 2800 will be available initially. Your bid will not only help us realise our dream of bringing the Pod Pistol to the market, but it will allow you to be one of the first-movers to join the elite Alpha Team of owners by securing one of these devices. 

Along the way I have joined forces with my mate, and now business partner, Dusty, who is an active duty Police Officer and between us we have raised the funds to build the plates that will allow mass production of the Pod Pistol. 

With your help we can fund the first production run of Pod Pistols and get them out there for coffee and gun lovers to start having fun with! For those of you who want to support the mission but either don't have a K-Cup machine, or simply aren't ready to commit to buying a Pod Pistol, check out our other range of merchandise that will allow you to get involved and be part of the team. 
 

Like the idea but don't want to buy anything?

No problem at all, we appreciate you reading this far and checking out our campaign! If by any chance you know someone who might be interested or would be willing to spread the word of our campaign then we'd be hugely grateful for your support.

No problem at all, we appreciate you reading this far and checking out our campaign! If by any chance you know someone who might be interested or would be willing to spread the word of our campaign then we'd be hugely grateful for your support.

story:
We have packed just enough jars ready for shipping to our early bird backers at our carefully chosen facility in the South Island of New Zealand.

The honey has been sourced from Great Barrier Island, Tongariro National Park and The Canterbury High Country. We have packaged 45+, 100+ and 265+ and have a very high grade and high quality 515+ ready to be packed. 

Our chosen packaging facility is registered with the FDA and RMP registered here in New Zealand. 

 

https://www.healthline.com/nutrition/manuka-honey-uses-benefits#TOC_TITLE_HDR_10

https://www.healthline.com/health/manuka-honey#tips-for-buying

https://www.webmd.com/a-to-z-guides/manuka-honey-medicinal-uses#1

https://www.newshub.co.nz/home/rural/2020/08/kiwi-honey-producers-excited-after-study-proves-its-effectiveness-at-treating-colds-coughs.html

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dyfU_cDw0Vw

story:
Short Summary

Our team is looking for your help to bring a community space to life in Stow, Massachusetts.  Our mission is to provide a safe outdoor gathering space with excellent options for food and beverage.  We are looking for your contribution to help us speed up the plans for our outdoor gathering space.  We would like to build this with you, for you.

We are fortunate to have a beautiful historic farm building and barn tucked away and ready to offer tasty food and groceries which will open this Fall. We do need help with getting the space fully ready for outdoor experiences and are asking for your sponsorship to help make that happen much faster.

Jordan and Reanna are owners of 29 Rustic in Sudbury, MA.  Their team, along with the entire restaurant industry, has been hit hard.  First, the EEE spread impacted the town of Sudbury, with a town-wide curfew of 6PM.  Shortly after, Covid-19 struck and has made traditional service a massive challenge with constant turns and pivots.  Nan's is our solution to what the community requires—easy access to curbside service, provisions and most importantly, safe outdoor gathering.

We are looking to build this with you and for you. 

It is important for us not only to understand what you would like to see for your gathering space but to help get the basics covered so that we can speed along for you to safely gather.  Our indoor space and inventory is covered—we are looking for your help building out the outdoor space of which we have 2.5 acres.

Sponsoring Picnic Tables and Umbrella's are the most urgent need.  

Your contributions will be greatly enjoyed by our amazing community here in New England.  We're supporting local and hyperlocal farms and vendors with a focus on sustainable practices.  Donating and helping us to move our outdoor seating faster will impact our guests, farmers, growers, artisans and creatives in our community.  Buy local, support local and let's create this space together.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Follow Nan's and share our campaign on Social Media
  • Sign up for our newsletter

story:
The Idea:

SnackAsian Box was founded due to a love of Asian snacks. From the uniquely awesome flavours featured in Japanese snacks like Japanese KitKats and Coca Cola to the iconic Chinese Lobster Chips and the Korean seaweed crackers, I realized that snacks are one of the best ways to experience a country! But, it often isn't possible to fly halfway across the globe (for many people, like us) to visit places like Shanghai or Tokyo. So I wanted a way to experience these exquisite locations through snacks! I subscribed to many different Asian snack subscription boxes, but there was one issue - there wasn't any choice in what showed up in your box! The "surprise factor" was nice, but constantly getting coffee or matcha flavoured snacks which I didn't really enjoy made me feel like I was throwing my money into snacks I didn't want to finish after trying a bite.

That led to SnackAsian Box: the Personalized Asian Snack Box. We personalize your box by asking you to complete surveys that let your curator know your snack preferences. This way, we keep the "surprise!" while making sure that the surprise is a good one!

How it works:

The 1-month subscription to either one of our boxes will ship you just 1 box so you can get to know what it is like. We will follow up with a survey that will ask you whether or not you liked each snack in your box. If you are interested in subscribing to more boxes, we will be able to use your answers to the survey to curate a box just for you!

The 3-month subscription will ship you 1 box every month for 3 months. The first box will be the same as the 1-month subscription, but boxes after that will vary based on your preferences from the survey! The survey is super simple and will be sent to your email - you just click the "yes" or the "not really" regarding whether or not you liked the snack for every snack you got. It's optional, too, so feel free to ignore it.

The Standard Box is a good pick if you (or the person you are gifting it to) want a smaller taste of the many different Asian snacks!

The Premium Box is a great pick for someone looking for a larger taste of all the amazing Asian snacks!

What snacks will I get:

You'll receive all sorts of Asian snacks - from unique Japanese KitKats to Chinese gummies and Korean chips! We don't want to tell you exactly what's going to be in your snack box, because that would ruin the surprise - but we want you to know what to expect. So check out our sample unboxing video (above) to get an idea of what you might get in your box. The best part is that if you don't like a snack, you can let your curator know! So you're always in control of what you get - even when you don't know exactly what it is!

Risks and Challenges

We have already negotiated with companies for the packaging, snacks, and shipping costs. One thing to note would be shipping times and possible damage, as weather and other situations may account for longer shipping times and late arrival. Once we ship a product, we are not responsible for any damage that may happen due to shipping. However, our boxes are quite sturdy and this damage is unlikely.

story:
Short Summary

Originally, our Bliss Nut Butters http://blissnutbutters.com were created to help me with my distance training events. I was running triathlons and such and finding that most Peanut Butters were overly processed and just not healthy enough to support my regimen. What I discovered after making my creation in my kitchen is that everyone was just loving this new kind of Nut Butter. 

I kept the ingredients simple but the flavor profile had to be something I’d want to eat every day – so I took Peanuts, Sea Salt and Organic Honey, along with Sunflower Oil to create a taste profile that was unique. 

Plus, I sort of developed a more “cold-pressed process” for the peanuts by not cooking them or grinding them so fine to keep the integrity of the nutrition I was seeking from the peanuts. The result is Bliss Nut Butters and the response we have been having has been astounding!

Over the last few years, we've become so passionate about how we eat and how we can help others enjoy gourmet delights like nut butters without the usual health risks of unhealthy ingredients. Our nutritionally designed Bliss Nut Butters help everyone find a powerful flavor profile and a great source of nutrients that can help anyone of any age.

What We Need & What You Get

Our hope is to make our product more accessible and more attractive to more types of consumers over the next few years. In order to so, we need to raise capital to grow in the following way:

  • We’re looking to get Organically Certified so folks can trust the ingredients we are using. We already use all the ingredients to be Organically certified, but the actual certification is very expensive – over $5,000.
  • We also want to purchase a Form Fill and Seal machine so we can start selling and giving away small 1 oz. samples and boxes of the sachets as another way to enjoy our brand. These machines cost about $25,000.

  • We really need a cap chucker for better security of our lids onto our jars.Right now we manually seal the lid then use a plastic wrap around the lids edge. It’s time consuming and less attractive than having a cap that is machine sealed and the lid “pops’ when opened to insure freshness. They cost around $15,000

With each contribution you'll get a chance to enjoy the wonderful line up of Bliss Nut Butters. As you donate more, you get more - tee shirts, recipes, gift boxes of nut butters and even a chance to try new flavors before we launch them to the general public.

If we don't reach our goal, we plan on using what funds have been raised to get certified and then look to which machinery we can purchase right away to make a stronger & smarter production process.

The Impact

Over the last few years, we've become so passionate about how we eat and how we can help others enjoy gourmet delights like nut butters without the usual health risks of unhealthy ingredients. Our nutritionally designed Bliss Nut Butters help everyone find a powerful flavor profile and a great source of nutrients that can help anyone of any age.

Our Original has been the key to our success right from the start - 

Since then, we've grown to offer our Chia Nut Butter...

We found that by adding Saigon Cinnamon to this we had another winner!

And then we  made a Hazelnut Butter that is too good to just write about - you have to taste it!

We genuinely want to convince you that your impact is meaningful.  Because it is.  Your donation to our fundraiser means you share our vision for a  world with healthier foods and bliss that can actually be spread across the country - literally and figuratively.  You believe in the advancement of woman-owned business, and you believe that your donation is not simply an act of kindness, but a commitment that offers actions versus words - and means the world to us. So we thank you for entrusting us with this venture and hope you will join us on this journey. 

Finally

  • Finally, 1% of our net income will go to protect a vital part of our food cycle - the honey bee. We have joined others in supporting the Save the Honeybee Foundation with our sales. 
  • In the two and a half years we've been making Bliss Nut Butters, we've grown all along the west coast and into parts of Texas and the Midwest. Our growth has been organic and consistent. With your help we know we can continue this growth and do it in a responsible manner that  would make you, as a donor, proud to have been a part of this venture.

Can't Donate?

We completely understand!  Please do us the valuable favor of sharing this page with someone who can!  Any and all help matters to us. 
We are grateful to have you on our side.  

Thank you, and remember: Live Blissfully!

Daniell Bliss & Rick Jennings​

story:
The Flight Plan and The Groundwork

Our vision for Flying Man Brewing Co. is a brewery that will serve as a gathering place to build relationships within our community while fostering an appreciation for a locally crafted beer and all forms of aviation.

At Flying Man we will start our beers in our 30 BBL (barrel) brewhouse.   This allows us to focus on production, quality, and growth without being at capacity too quickly.  We also have an automated pilot system that further allows us to experiment with one-offs and specialty beers.  We are licensed as a Brewpub which will allow us to serve in our taproom, as well as beer to go, in growlers, Crowlers, and kegs.

It has taken several years of planning and hard work to get to where we are now. We purchased the building, the equipment, and have started upgrading major systems to bring the building up to code.  We are currently working to finish the production area plumbing, new electrical work, the taproom, and the outdoor beer garden.  We've invested a lot of our own money in this project, secured a large loan from our bank, and one investor.  We have a few projects left before we can open and we are asking for you to show your support and join the Launch Crew to help get Flying Man Brewing off the ground!

 

What’s Flying and What’s Still Grounded

We purchased our North East Austin location and equipment in August 2016.  Since then we have been working hard to bring the building up to code and remodel the space. We have invested our savings, plus investor and bank loans totaling over 1 million dollars into making this dream take flight.  Walls, flooring, ceilings, and more have been removed in order to create a new lab space, tasting room, bar, and storage areas.  Our funds have purchased new insulation for the ceiling, insulated garage doors, an eighteen foot diameter Big Ass Fan, new plumbing, electrical, and an updated HVAC for the tasting room. Many of these projects are still a work in progress and there is still a lot of finishing work to be started.  We need your support to complete projects such as the bar and tap area build out, finishing the tasting room and lab, installing the grain mill and auger, and finishing the outdoor beer garden.

Progress will be updated online on our Indiegogo page, Website, Facebook, Twitter, and  Instagram pages.  We appreciate your time and your support and look forward to raising a glass with you at Flying Man Brewing Co.!  

 

Launch Crew Rewards

We greatly appreciate your support in helping us fund the breweries final projects.  We have set our goal at $25,000 however; our expenses to finish out the projects will be significantly higher.  Any amount raised over the goal will still be going towards finishing out the production area plumbing, new electrical work, the taproom, and the outdoor beer garden. 

 

$10.00  

We know every dollar counts.  Cheers to you and we’ll will give you a huge shout out on social media.  Thanks for the support.

 

$15.00  

Flying Man Sticker

Show some squadron love.  These are high quality indoor/outdoor stickers.  Throw them on your plane, glider, car, refrigerator, anywhere you want to show the love.

 

$25.00 

A Limited Edition Flying Man Glass

This is a one-time only, limited run of Flying Man Pint Glasses.   This glass shows you’ve got our six and we appreciate the hell out of the backup. These will only be for Indiegogo supporters.   

 

$50.00

Limited Edition Flying Man Supporter Shirt and Glass

This Limited Edition “Flying Man Brewing Launch Crew” T-Shirt is awesome.  Show your support for Flying Man Brewing around town with this light weight, 4 oz. shirt and look flight ready.  We have these shirts available in Men’s and Women’s sizes.

 

$75.00

Limited Edition Flying Man Hoodie

Stay warm and show some love.  These limited edition “Launch Crew” hoodies are for Indiegogo supporters only.  Wear your hoodie at the brewery and you might get some extra attention!

 

$125.00

Flying Man Insulated Growler

We're damn happy that you’re in our squadron and showing it off with this bad ass growler. On top of that, we are throwing in 2 fills at the tap room.

 

$250.00

Lifetime Platinum Membership in the Aces Club.

Want a little extra leg room because you’re here a lot. Receive happy hour prices on all beer, growler fills and extra discounts on merchandise.   See the website for details

 

$500.00

Lifetime Executive Platinum Membership in the Aces Club + Growler, T-Shirt and 2 Pint Glasses.  Along with all the perks of Platinum Memebership, you will also get VIP access to opening weekend and events. 

 

$1000.00

Grand Opening Pre-Party!

We’re flying high now!  You’re a super fan and we’re going to throw a private party before the brewery opens to the public for you plus a guest.  This perk includes two tickets to a private dinner party at the brewery + VIP access to grand opening weekend.   We want to show you how much we appreciate this so be prepared for a fun night.  

 

$2500.00

Grand Opening Pre-Party + Give one of our tanks it’s Call Sign.

All the perks of the Grand Opening Pre-Party plus you get to name a tank.  Let’s keep with the aviation theme here and remember…pilots are cool, their Call Signs should be too!

 

$5000.00

It’s a Fly-In.

We’ll buy you a round trip ticket from anywhere in the Continental USA.  Put you up in a nice Austin hotel for 2 nights for the Grand Opening Pre-Party.  We will pick you up from the airport and arrange transportation while your're here.  

 

When are we Flying?

As with any business in the startup phase, delays are unavoidable.  We are excited to get beer in your hands as soon as possible.  We are aiming for a Grand Opening mid to late summer of 2017.  As we get closer we will keep everyone informed through email, our website, and social media.  We have a great team of people working with us to launch Flying Man Brewing.  We have come a long way and with your support the skies the limit!

 

Watch our Six

We know that money can be tight so here are some other ways you can help that are much appreciated!

  • Share this page on all forms of social media. The more people we can reach the greater chance we have of reaching our goal. Indiegogo has share tools to help you!
  • Share our Facebook page with your friends, the more people we can get following us, the greater chance for success we will have.
  • Go brag about us, seriously, go talk us up to your friends!
  • If you can't or don't want to donate monetarily but still want to help, we can always use a helping hand with our renovations. Beer and lunch on us! 
  • Come see us when we open! We’ll be stoked to raise a glass with you and share some stories.

 

We appreciate you taking a moment to hear our campaign.  If you can or can't contribute, please consider sharing this with your friends and helping us spread the word!

On top of that, we are throwing in 2 fills at the tap room. $250.00Lifetime Platinum Membership in the Aces Club.Want a little extra leg room because you’re here a lot. Receive happy hour prices on all beer, growler fills and extra discounts on merchandise.   See the website for details $500.00Lifetime Executive Platinum Membership in the Aces Club + Growler, T-Shirt and 2 Pint Glasses.  Along with all the perks of Platinum Memebership, you will also get VIP access to opening weekend and events.  $1000.00Grand Opening Pre-Party!We’re flying high now!  You’re a super fan and we’re going to throw a private party before the brewery opens to the public for you plus a guest.  This perk includes two tickets to a private dinner party at the brewery + VIP access to grand opening weekend.   We want to show you how much we appreciate this so be prepared for a fun night.   $2500.00Grand Opening Pre-Party + Give one of our tanks it’s Call Sign.All the perks of the Grand Opening Pre-Party plus you get to name a tank.  Let’s keep with the aviation theme here and remember…pilots are cool, their Call Signs should be too! $5000.00It’s a Fly-In.We’ll buy you a round trip ticket from anywhere in the Continental USA.  Put you up in a nice Austin hotel for 2 nights for the Grand Opening Pre-Party.  We will pick you up from the airport and arrange transportation while your're here.   When are we Flying?As with any business in the startup phase, delays are unavoidable.  We are excited to get beer in your hands as soon as possible.  We are aiming for a Grand Opening mid to late summer of 2017.  As we get closer we will keep everyone informed through email, our website, and social media.  We have a great team of people working with us to launch Flying Man Brewing.  We have come a long way and with your support the skies the limit! Watch our SixWe know that money can be tight so here are some other ways you can help that are much appreciated!
Share this page on all forms of social media. The more people we can reach the greater chance we have of reaching our goal. Indiegogo has share tools to help you!
Share our Facebook page with your friends, the more people we can get following us, the greater chance for success we will have.
Go brag about us, seriously, go talk us up to your friends!
If you can't or don't want to donate monetarily but still want to help, we can always use a helping hand with our renovations. Beer and lunch on us! 
Come see us when we open! We’ll be stoked to raise a glass with you and share some stories.
 We appreciate you taking a moment to hear our campaign.  If you can or can't contribute, please consider sharing this with your friends and helping us spread the word!

story:
Short Summary

I was born in the USA but moved to Sardinia, Italy in 1990 and never looked back. I have two sons in Sardinia, My older son is living in Seattle and working to develop Trigu on the West Coast.

I spent most of my professional career in digital media where I was lucky enough to work with organizations like the Mandela Foundation, the band U2 and IMG. I have always worked where I found a strong passion and connection and that is how at age 50 I came to food, my original source of income as a high school and college student (cook and waiter).

Trigu Italia was born naturally when my son moved to Seattle and was working long days in restaurants. One day I called him and told him that I thought it would be great if he could keep a connection with his homeland and even help friends and fellow Sardinians. At the same time, I was speaking to Sardinian artisan producers, especially, Paolo Melis , the founder of Bresca Dorada, Sardinia's best mirto distillery. It was out of these two conversations and two friendships that quickly developed with the owners of two dairies, Formaggi Aresu and Murtas Formaggi that I understood our mission and vision;

help Sardinian artisans continue what they do best and that is producing some of the healthiest , genuine and culturally intense products on the planet. Bring this food in its most natural state to the USA and help people get back into touch with real flavors and rhythms with product from one of the oldest cultures in the Mediterranean.

Sardinia has always been the bread basket, since Roman times and even before. Artisans are not always great marketers and this is where Trigu fits in. We want to create a simple and direct business model, where product gets to American cooks, stores and consumers in the fastest and most simple way possible, keeping more margin for the artisans and with the idea of creating work for young Sardinians, like my son, who want to be connected to the island but who also want to travel and explore the world.

If we are successful, we will show not just the 2 dairies we are working with how to tap a huge new market but also all of the other Sardinian artisans who can follow suite, whether they do it with us or simply copy our model.

We are successful when Sardinians say, hey, those Brownsteins, they really helped the Sardinian artisan at a time when it was most needed to protect our culture and our traditions.

 

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • We need operating capital
  • Legal compliance work
  • Travel
  • Marketing (e-commerce is going to be important)
  • eventually 1 store or food truck
  • Initial funds will go to cover full time salaries and the marketing of our holiday season product for consumers.
  • You get an amazing Taste Sardinia box with over 5 pounds of cheese from Sardinia , delivered to your doorstep or as a gift.

The Impact

The most important impact we can make is to be successful enough where other people copy us or simply join our project. I strongly believe that Trigu Italia in the long term is a travel company. First we get people intrigued about the incredible island of Sardinia and its products and then we get people to come visit the producers and understand in more detail what healthy, genuine food production is all about.

Risks & Challenges

If I get sick. If Gabriele and I do not work well together. If Trump starts to ban European products. If we make silly mistakes with the FDA and food regulations.

Other Ways You Can Help

Get your friends or company to buy some Taste Sardinia boxes for their employees or clients.

I think we can sell 2,000 Taste Sardinia boxes and use these funds to take Trigu Italia to the next level.

story:
Well lets get all the pleasantries out of the way first. My name is Jeremy and I'm the Owner, Founder, and Head Brewer for Stranger Tides Brewing. I have twelve years experience cooking and managing restaurants with another thirteen years experience in finance.  Well now that that is done, lets talk about the fun stuff!!!

What We Need & What You Get

What do we need? We're currently seeking $50,000 to renovate and decorate our new location into a relaxing, stress free, community hang out. Funds will be used for painting, flooring, furniture, lighting, a bar, and some extras (maybe some games who knows ;) ). 

Got Perks? Hell yeah we do! We have some killer perks to fit anyone's budget. Please see the list of perks we are giving out. Tell your friends, family, co-workers because they'll be jealous if left out. Also anyone who contributes $99 or more will be added to a special contributors board we are having done by Chalk Art New England. How many places you can you say you have your name hanging on the wall?

So what happens if we don't reach our goal? Unfortunately world will self destruct. Just kidding. We still plan on moving forward. Luckily I was in the vocational school for carpentry and cabinet making. We'll try to stretch every dollar we receive as far as we can. We have no problem organically growing and improving the location. At the end of the day it's about how good our beer is, and it's damn good. Just say'in. But seriously we need to get rid of the carpet. We don't need to make a "you made the mess, you clean it" policy. 

The Impact

This voyage for us has been a dream of mine for years. I've worked hard to get to where I'm at and have no doubt our brewery will be successful. And that's where you come in. Your contributions will not only help us achieve our dream and leave a legacy for our children (yes sappy and sentimental, but what can I say). But it'll give us an opportunity to give back to the community we call home. We'll dedicate one tap each month to a local charity, of which 10% of all sales will go to a local charity. A couple examples would be the Youth Center or to paying for lunch debts owed to the schools. No child should go hungry or be forced to be served the lunch bag of shame. How else can we contribute? Well as we grow we're gonna need more employees. We'll be sourcing our hops from a local in town Hop Farm (how cool is that). We'll be scheduling local food trucks to provide food for our customers. And all spent grains will be given to local farmers to feed their live stock and cut down their feed bills. 

Risks & Challenges

Challenges? Oh I'm sure there will be some almost every day. Still working full-time and two-toddlers, yeah....But challenges to the business. Not being able to separate ourselves from the ever growing popularity of opening a brewery. However we got that covered, we'll have something for everyone, including the ladies. We have strong relationships with other brewers in the state to help mentor us during the beginning stages.

People may say the market is over saturated. We beg to differ. Breweries are becoming the new wine trails. Having multiple breweries in a close location is a plus not a negative. As of now there are three breweries within 25 minutes of us. 

Other Ways You Can Help

But Jeremy we cannot donate at this time. No Problem!!! Word of mouth and this crazy thing called the internet is magical. Please spread the word about our cause, say it loud and say it proud. Make sure to use the Indiegogo share tools. And make sure to  follow us on Facebook/Untapped/Instagram.
