Last Pour Size
Batch name
Kegging date
OG & FG
The built-in calculator automatically calculates the ABV%
Real-Time Tap Status
The app automatically calculates the volume of beer in the keg based on the Final Gravity, and you can choose between Metric or US Customary units. Connect all your kegsAdd unlimited number of kegs in the same account.     Industry-standard accuracy High-quality, full-bridge load-cells makes the PLAATO Keg highly accurate, even on the smallest pours (and on the bigger ones).  Check out the feedback from our beta-users.   
Technical specifications, Materials & PerformancePLAATO® KEG is developed with feedback from over 350 ambassadors enrolled in the PLAATO Test User Program. This ensures a device that fits 99% of the most used kegs out there, including:
All types of Corny Kegs
Key-Kegs
Torpedo Kegs
Sankey Kegs

 
   
Enable CO2-mode & monitor the CO2-bottleIt came to us while in development. If we can measure the real-time level of beer, then we can do the same thing with CO2! Presenting you the CO2-version of the PLAATO Keg. Enable CO2-mode in the Plaato-app, and turn one of your keg-devices into your CO2-bottle monitor, checking the remaining level of gas in real-time. Use it to have control over the remaining level of CO2 to make sure you have enough for the upcoming brew-day, or use it to detect a CO2-leak from a connector. CO2-bottles loses mass as the CO2 is used by carbonation, tapping or leaks. This means that by placing the CO2- bottle on top of our "PLAATO Keg", you will get precise estimates of the remaining level of CO2. This feature can also be used to detect leaks.Most CO2-bottles fit directly onto the Plaato Keg, providing you the tool to never be unawarely out of CO2 again  
EARLY BIRD REWARDS  Comparing the vitals of the PLAATO Keg with the other solutions out there, and it'll make a clear picture   
We believe in an open community where hardware and software are unified. That is why we already now has started working on the API that lets you connect your PLAATO Keg to best brewing software out there: Brewfather. 
We have tried, tested and redesigned the PLAATO Keg more times than we want to admit. Our end goal has always been to make a product that we can all stand behind.
 
  Located in Oslo, Norway, we do all development and design from our lab.
Paal Ingebrigtsen, Co-founder and CEO
Michael Kononsky, Co-founder and Lead Designer
Tarje Sandvik, Embedded Systems Engineer
Tobias Hartvedt Knudsen, Developer
Martin Blæsbjerg-Christiansen, Logistics & Customer Support
  
 
Thanks to everyone that got our first campaign successfully funded. Now over 6000 airlocks is bubbling away in over 60 countries!The PLAATO Airlock won the Red Dot Award 2018. Check it out here.   
 
  Follow us on Instagram! 
 PLAATO Keg can be used in many more ways that just for kegs. It is a versatile platform that helps you throughout the brewing process. Use it to measure grains and ingredients - up to 130lbs / 60kg Closed transfer - Get full control and know when your keg is full during oxygen-free transfer Do you have an outdoors kitchen?Use the PLAATO Keg to monitor the propan-tank remotely

story:
A Love of Dining Theatre 

Many styles of dining are as much about the experience as the food. Think about the theatre of the Teppanyaki Table where the skilled chefs chop, slice and flip pieces of food to the delight of their audience, often with flames jumping from the table. 

Or perhaps the fiery experience of the Yakiniku Table where you grill your own slices of meat and vegetables over open flames of heated grills, exactly as you like.

Whilst these experiences are great fun, they are not exactly easy to recreate at home - until now. With the SteakStones Ishiyaki Set, you can sear every slice of meat, fish or vegetables to perfection live at your dining table on our super-heated Lava Stones. 

How to Heat 

Simply heat the stone on your hob or stove (gas or electric), under your grill or broiler as close to the element as possible, or even on your barbecue to between 300-350c (550-660f). Remove the stone from the heat and place it in the Steel Tray which is safely recessed into your Bamboo Board. 

You can do the sizzle test as shown below to check the stone is fully up to heat. Then, you're ready to go. Simply rub a very light coat of cooking oil on the stone which prevents the meat, fish or vegetables from sticking and you're ready to go. You can cook each slice exactly as you like, with the last bite as hot and delicious as the first.

Whilst you may have seen some nice enough looking Ishiyaki Sets in Restaurants in the past, these use stones that simply don't hold the heat aswell as our Lava. The set below is a perfect example; it looks great, but the tea light under the stone does nothing to extend the cooking time of the stone which will be just a couple of minutes compared to the 20-30mins sizzling time you get with SteakStones super-heated Lava Stones. We deliver form and function in equal measures for your dining enjoyment.

The dry, searing heat of our stones makes them perfect for cooking thin strips of steak and vegetables as you would have in a Yakiniku Restaurant and is also ideal for some succulent Sashimi-style Fish including Salmon, Swordfish and Tuna or some deliciously seared Scallops.

We urge you to try and find some Prime Kobe or Wagyu Steak which when cut into strips is simply delicious when simply seared on the stone, perhaps with some soy and wasabi for that delicious, salty heat kick.

Our Experience

SteakStones products are tested in the most rigorous Commercial Kitchens and feature in top quality venues such as Sushi Samba in London and Amsterdam and Catch in Las Vegas and New York and in the past we have made bespoke designs for both these companies, so are used to delivering new products under pressure.

From this background, we can guarantee our products will give you many years of enjoyment at home. They will serve you many of the best meals you will ever have, the only downside is yours might become too popular a location for dinner!   

SteakStones Exceptional Quality Guaranteed

We're a family business, as you saw in our Video, but we are also the experts in this method of dining, since our Founder got fascinated with the properties of Lava Stones many years ago. Since then, we've sold many of our sets all over the World, but whilst this new set is nearly ready to go, the almost global lockdown to the Hospitality industry due to Covid has had a major impact on our business and with pressure on our income and we are looking to continue the availability of this product from our Kickstarter Campaign to the Indiegogo Community.

So we are offering some great special offers available to offer this product to you and to keep ours and our partners business moving.

Rewards

We also have some great optional extras as shown below which compliment your Ishiyaki Set and create a fun, modular dining system on which you can enjoy many varied and healthy meals.

The Ishiyaki Set is perfect for some thinly slices meat, fish or vegetables and you can also enjoy a hearty meal as shown below. Check out the little guys face a few seconds in. Sometimes being a product tester is pretty cool. 

The dry, searing heat of our super-heated Lava Stone sears in all the flavours and succulence of your chosen meat, fish or vegetables and is an extremely healthy way to dine that you'll enjoy for many years with your quality SteakStones products.

Beautifully Seared Fish on the SteakStones Ishiyaki Set

We'll finish off with a few minutes of sensationally searing Steak as that is what we promise to you. The best meal of your life, every time you dine. Happy Sizzling from us all at SteakStones. 

Environmental Commitments

Long-Lasting Design

Our first product design is now 15 years old and bar some minor cosmetic changes uses the same materials and design as it did back then. Our products stand the test of time and we expect this to be no different for our new Ishiyaki Sets.

Reusability and Recyclability

Our Lava Stone has been a few million years in the making and there's a chance it will last just as long into the future. We haven't yet been able to test this far forward, but our products last incredibly well in tough commercial settings, and even more so with lighter use at home. 

Sustainable Materials

All of the bases of our products are made from Bamboo, nature's fastest growing and strongest material. The Lava we use is produced naturally by the Earth itself; we don't think you can't get more sustainable than that.

Environmentally Friendly Factories

For every cubic meter of Lava we take from the foothills of Mount Vesuvius, we plant a quota of Olive Trees in place. This in turn produces Olive Oil which is used locally by Restaurants.

Risks and Challenges

We're experienced at delivering great products and don't see any changes to this. A more important risk is that people get bored of eating the same old meal at home. We're here to prevent that. Enjoy some sizzling strips of Sirloin or Wagyu. Find yourself some Kobe, and this is simply the only way to enjoy it. Fancy some fish, try some sizzling cubes of Tuna, Salmon and Swordfish and maybe some Scallops. Simply sear the outside and enjoy the succulence and flavours trapped into every bite. We promise we'll deliver you a simply sensational dining experience, and once you will enjoy for many, many years.

story:
It's time to take Avocado Vegan Cafe & Juice Bar to the next level. We were established just under 2 years ago to give you the healthiest, most flavorful vegan cuisine in this town. The response from the community has been tremendous and we are extremely grateful. However we believe there are other areas in which we can serve you, and we have 3 project in the works to do just that. Were are currently developing the following;

  • The catering arm of the restaurant. We'll make your event extraordinary
  • A Grab-N-Go service.  In a hurry? Be it sandwiches or salads, it will be prepared, prepackaged already, waiting for you in one of our coolers.
  • Subscription-based meal delivery service. For a few days or weeks, leave the cooking to us. We'll deliver healthy, delicious meals to your front door. Just warm and enjoy.

To accomplish these goals resources are required. So have turn to you to get us there.

What’s in it for you?
With a $30.00 investment, you get $40.00 in gift certificates and with a $50.00 Investment, you get $70.00 in gift certificates.

Please help us take Avocado Vegan Cafe and Juice Bar to the next level.

story:
OUR STORY

We are excited to finally make our dream a reality and open up the first MashRoots Mofongo Bar. For the past 4 years, we tested the concept of bringing traditional Puerto Rican Mofongo to Cincinnati. Most people have never tried Mofongo before, let alone heard of it, but as we suspected after the first bite, it becomes a new favorite.

The concept began from a Cuban/Brazilian & Puerto Rican friendship with a shared passion for food, science, and business. After moving to Cincinnati 15 years ago, we often dreamed of bringing a bit of our culture to the Mid West and sharing the diversity of Latin America. On a snowboarding trip to Canada in early 2017, while making lunch of a delicious mix of leftover “mofongo” and “borscht” soup (which we call Borfongo), we decided to put our dream into action. We partnered with Findlay Kitchen to build our concept from recipes we grew up loving into a startup pop-up restaurant. In just 5 months, we went from concept to a pop-up event on May 7, 2017, and we haven’t looked back since then.

THE GOAL

Our focus has always been evolving beyond a pop up to establish a fixed location as food, to us, is only a means to an end. Our mission at MashRoots is about creating memorable experiences that will bring people together to build a sense of community fueled by our culture. It is in our DNA to bring people together around the kitchen counter so they can learn from one another and contribute to society.

Our restaurant is due to open by the end of the year in College Hill and we have secured funding to do the build-out and the equipment we need.  However, we want to make sure that our interior space creates an environment that will bring folks together into the community.  We believe that with your support, we can raise funds to transform the inside of our restaurant with an ambiance that is both inviting and comfortable for the community to enjoy.  In return for your generous contributions, we have a range of rewards we hope will make you feel part of our family, we have something for everyone in here.  Our perks range from cool swag, to more cultural experiences like domino tournaments, pig roasts, and Puerto Rican Christmas parties!  We also have a lifetime membership to our Clube Pilon, which will get you access to exclusive events, food and discounts.  There are also several options for private pop up parties at your home or our store.

We understand not everyone has the ability to contribute to this campaign by buying rewards and that's ok!  What would be awesome for anyone though, whether buying rewards or not, would be to simply spread the word!  Tell all your friends, share our story with them, tell them who we are and let them know what we're trying to accomplish with this campaign!  Also, if you or your friends aren't already, we highly recommend you follow on us IG/Facebook @MashRoots.cincy!  

If you have any questions, please email us at mofongo@mashroots.com

All the best,

The MashRoots Family.

story:
Tessie's Teas = Healthy Living

First, I have been in the community service arena for 20+ years. I have provided mental health counseling to individuals suffering from schizophrenia to bipolar disorder, and everything in between. I worked in the education arena for the majority of those years in various capacities, providing services to children and families. The students I have worked with were lost and in need of love and direction (pregnant teens, abused mentally and physically and varying exceptionalities students, youth on the road to committing serious crimes, and others unable to negotiate the educational system successfully. I have counseled, washed faces, combed hair, provide meals, assist with housing, wrote grants successfully to provide car seats, assist with scholarships, provided college tours, gotten major hospitals to support a campus clinic so the students and their children wouldn't miss valuable teachable hours. I have been an expert witness for children caught up in sex slavery scenarios, abandonment, and vicious life situations that most people couldn't even imagine. For the majority of my professional career, I have worked with children suffering in unspeakable ways.

One day, I just felt burnout and overwhelmed and needed to follow my dream of providing a different type of service. Now, I have poured my heart, soul, and resources into my love for tea. I was born in Jamaica WID, and as a child, my great grandmother always talked about the medicinal benefits derived from drinking various herbs, spices, and roots. Drinking tea is a family tradition spanning over five generations. We're shaking up the traditional tea space by providing beneficial instant teas, no messy tea bags or steep time needed. Just pour crystal in a cup, pour in water, stir and go. 

 Our teas are all natural, instant crystalized ginger-honey and mint teas having no additives, no preservative, and no caffeine. They are convenient and portable for the busy but health-conscious consumer.  The vacuum sealed satchel makes 2 cups of tea, just by adding 8-10oz of water and can be consumed hot or cold. Customers are excited about the delicious taste and health benefits of ginger and mint, ranging from anti-inflammatory, anti-oxidant, digestive aid, weight loss and many more benefits. We also provide literature regarding the teas health benefits to our consumers. It's important to educate our population on how to address simple ailment naturally without medication. Tessie's Teas is nature at its' best.

We have spent the majority of our funds developing an awesome product that many people aren't aware exists. We seek funding to launch a full-scale marketing campaign and increase our inventory selection. We seek 20k in funding, 7k - 10k for marketing and 10k to expand the brand ( increase inventory, cover warehouse cost, transportation, etc). All backers will receive gifted tea, amount based on contribution. Contributions of $199 or greater will receive one year's supply of our teas and literature covering the health benefits. 

Tessie's Teas challenges have been getting the word out and serving customers out of the US who purchased our teas on vacation. We can address and solve these challenges with increased funding. We appreciate all contributions and anyone who took the time to read our request, please share it with others using the Indiegogo share tool.

Thank you for time and consideration,

Tessie's Teas = Healthy Living

story:
That is our mission statement. We painted it on our old freight elevator door; we also crochet this on our pillows and tattoo it onto our pectoral muscles and chant it during staff meetings. It is that important. We are a brewery, but we brew more than great craft beer. We also are in the business of brewing joy, which is so corny it's awesome. We love to be a gathering space for people, and we love to connect with our customers over great food and beer.

Our Story

We bought this brewery, and then we bought a homebrew kit on craigslist, because that is the correct order in which to buy these sorts of things if you want the maximum adventure ride. Brewmaster Jon was an engineer in his former life, and now puts all that energy and science into the world of craft beer, with some amazing results (including this magical peanut butter concoction). We also have a coffee shop and coffee roaster in our brewery, which provides us with the magical beans for this magical brew. 

Check out our blog for more info on the story here: http://www.copperstate.beer/single-post/2017/06/01/Grit-and-Grist--the-Copper-State-Story

*Pictured above: Brewmaster Jon and his wife Missy (AKA the High Brau Frau, AKA me), and our offspring, who are homeschooled at this brewery, because that's part of the adventure. 

 

What People are Saying about this Beer

The following are real quotes from real beer drinkers on the real website Untappd, who have tried the Chocolate Coffee Peanut Butter Porter. Nobody was forced to say any of these nice things about our beer. Also, everything you read on the internet is true.

"Holy smokes, the smell of this beer is ridiculous! It's one of the most robust flavored beers I've had." --Wayne S.

"Top 5 beers all time." --Jacob H.

"Magic beer." --Emmy DJ.

"So good I actually might consider moving to Green Bay. As close to perfect as it gets." --Jordan B.

"Liquid dessert." --Jeff B.

"Seriously, it lives up to the name. No single notes, but full scores of major chords." --Michael P. 

"Omg...yaaaaaas." --Erin G.

"Just frickin' have this!" --Ty K.

 

What We Need

Copper State Brewing Co just turned two years old. We'd like to give ourselves a birthday present that could benefit you, something all two-year-olds desire: a nitrogen doser for our canning line. 

To make this work, we need a few things: knowledge (check--Jon is an engineer), beer (check--Jon makes great beer), and the support of our biggest fans (check?--here's where you come in).  Our canning line needs an appendage in the form of a nitrogen doser. Appendages aren’t cheap—in fact, they cost an arm and a leg. We are aiming for a cool $25k for the equipment and install, and if we surpass this goal, we will put it towards the can design and the first pallet of cans to get us rolling. 

Here's the science-y stuff: right before we put the beer into kegs or cans, we carbonate it. But for certain beers, we also add nitrogen, which gives the beer its creamy mouthfeel, without any bite from the CO2. When we started the brewery, we put in three nitro taplines so that we could serve some epic nitro craft on draught (doesn't look like it should rhyme, but it does). However, we cannot put a nitro beer straight into cans or crowlers or growlers from the tap because it would go flat in short order and it would not taste good. And as a rule, we don't serve beer that does not taste good. Enter: the nitro drip for our canning line, which gives each can a little nitro burst and purges all the oxygen before the lid is sealed on, ensuring a delicious creamy beer poured hard out of the can. The nitro drip doser would also benefit our other packaged beers by ensuring a longer shelf life. We would even have the capacity to do some nitro cold brew coffee in cans, which is another fun avenue to venture into...not as fun as beer, but still fun. 

What you Get

Aside from the warm fuzzies of having helped out a new brewery with our production needs, we've got a pack of perks for you at various levels of donations. Click on the perks to get a bit more info about what is included with each one. Check 'em out, and come in and redeem them at Copper State Brewing Co.

*Nota Bene (that's Latin for "note well"--isn't learning fun?): some of these perks will not be able to be redeemed until we have the nitrogen doser set up in our cellar. Email info@copperstate.beer for more details or questions.

The Impact

Nope, this campaign will not save puppies or fix the ozone. It will not ensure world peace or provide a cure for cancer. It will, however, enable us to get fantastic beer out into the marketplace for you to share with your friends. Also, with more success of the brewery, we will be able to give back more to our growing downtown community. We serve beer at various fundraising events, and donate tours and gift cards and merch to many fundraisers throughout the year, so I guess in some ways, our beer does cure cancer and save puppies and feed starving artists. It's just that good at being beer. 

Your donations will enable us to help the community. They will also allow us to increase our distribution farther across the great state of Wisconsin and into your house. 

*Not pictured above in our cooler: Chocolate Coffee Peanut Butter Porter on Nitro...yet.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We'll be honest with you: mostly, we could use your support in the form of money. However, we understand that not everyone can give their hard-earned cash straight to us. So here are some other ways you can help: 

--Word of mouthfeel--come in and try the Chocolate Coffee Peanut Butter Porter on nitro at our brewery, and tell everyone you know how stinkin' good it is. And how you could share some with them if only we had a nitro doser for our canning line...

--Share this campaign with your friends, your coworkers, your craft beer snob neighbor, your second cousin thrice removed, your best friend's sister's daughter, your periodontist, your rich uncle...especially him

--Come and check out our place--we'd love to meet you, and we know you'll fall in love with our beer, our space, and our people

--Check out our website here (I like to think it's a fun place to spend some of your internet hours): http://www.copperstate.beer/
story_txt:
That is our mission statement. We painted it on our old freight elevator door; we also crochet this on our pillows and tattoo it onto our pectoral muscles and chant it during staff meetings. It is that important. We are a brewery, but we brew more than great craft beer. We also are in the business of brewing joy, which is so corny it's awesome. We love to be a gathering space for people, and we love to connect with our customers over great food and beer.
Our Story
We bought this brewery, and then we bought a homebrew kit on craigslist, because that is the correct order in which to buy these sorts of things if you want the maximum adventure ride. Brewmaster Jon was an engineer in his former life, and now puts all that energy and science into the world of craft beer, with some amazing results (including this magical peanut butter concoction). We also have a coffee shop and coffee roaster in our brewery, which provides us with the magical beans for this magical brew. 
Check out our blog for more info on the story here: http://www.copperstate.beer/single-post/2017/06/01/Grit-and-Grist--the-Copper-State-Story

*Pictured above: Brewmaster Jon and his wife Missy (AKA the High Brau Frau, AKA me), and our offspring, who are homeschooled at this brewery, because that's part of the adventure. 
 
What People are Saying about this Beer
The following are real quotes from real beer drinkers on the real website Untappd, who have tried the Chocolate Coffee Peanut Butter Porter. Nobody was forced to say any of these nice things about our beer. Also, everything you read on the internet is true.
"Holy smokes, the smell of this beer is ridiculous! It's one of the most robust flavored beers I've had." --Wayne S.
"Top 5 beers all time." --Jacob H.
"Magic beer." --Emmy DJ.
"So good I actually might consider moving to Green Bay. As close to perfect as it gets." --Jordan B.
"Liquid dessert." --Jeff B.
"Seriously, it lives up to the name. No single notes, but full scores of major chords." --Michael P. 
"Omg...yaaaaaas." --Erin G.
"Just frickin' have this!" --Ty K.

 

What We Need
Copper State Brewing Co just turned two years old. We'd like to give ourselves a birthday present that could benefit you, something all two-year-olds desire: a nitrogen doser for our canning line. 
To make this work, we need a few things: knowledge (check--Jon is an engineer), beer (check--Jon makes great beer), and the support of our biggest fans (check?--here's where you come in).  Our canning line needs an appendage in the form of a nitrogen doser. Appendages aren’t cheap—in fact, they cost an arm and a leg. We are aiming for a cool $25k for the equipment and install, and if we surpass this goal, we will put it towards the can design and the first pallet of cans to get us rolling. 
Here's the science-y stuff: right before we put the beer into kegs or cans, we carbonate it. But for certain beers, we also add nitrogen, which gives the beer its creamy mouthfeel, without any bite from the CO2. When we started the brewery, we put in three nitro taplines so that we could serve some epic nitro craft on draught (doesn't look like it should rhyme, but it does). However, we cannot put a nitro beer straight into cans or crowlers or growlers from the tap because it would go flat in short order and it would not taste good. And as a rule, we don't serve beer that does not taste good. Enter: the nitro drip for our canning line, which gives each can a little nitro burst and purges all the oxygen before the lid is sealed on, ensuring a delicious creamy beer poured hard out of the can. The nitro drip doser would also benefit our other packaged beers by ensuring a longer shelf life. We would even have the capacity to do some nitro cold brew coffee in cans, which is another fun avenue to venture into...not as fun as beer, but still fun. 

What you Get
Aside from the warm fuzzies of having helped out a new brewery with our production needs, we've got a pack of perks for you at various levels of donations. Click on the perks to get a bit more info about what is included with each one. Check 'em out, and come in and redeem them at Copper State Brewing Co.
*Nota Bene (that's Latin for "note well"--isn't learning fun?): some of these perks will not be able to be redeemed until we have the nitrogen doser set up in our cellar. Email info@copperstate.beer for more details or questions.

The Impact
Nope, this campaign will not save puppies or fix the ozone. It will not ensure world peace or provide a cure for cancer. It will, however, enable us to get fantastic beer out into the marketplace for you to share with your friends. Also, with more success of the brewery, we will be able to give back more to our growing downtown community. We serve beer at various fundraising events, and donate tours and gift cards and merch to many fundraisers throughout the year, so I guess in some ways, our beer does cure cancer and save puppies and feed starving artists. It's just that good at being beer. 
Your donations will enable us to help the community. They will also allow us to increase our distribution farther across the great state of Wisconsin and into your house. 


*Not pictured above in our cooler: Chocolate Coffee Peanut Butter Porter on Nitro...yet.
 

Other Ways You Can Help
We'll be honest with you: mostly, we could use your support in the form of money. However, we understand that not everyone can give their hard-earned cash straight to us. So here are some other ways you can help: 
--Word of mouthfeel--come in and try the Chocolate Coffee Peanut Butter Porter on nitro at our brewery, and tell everyone you know how stinkin' good it is. And how you could share some with them if only we had a nitro doser for our canning line...
--Share this campaign with your friends, your coworkers, your craft beer snob neighbor, your second cousin thrice removed, your best friend's sister's daughter, your periodontist, your rich uncle...especially him

story: Hello, we are Trever and Brandon Stern, the Sons of Warner Stern Jr. Our father was a talented and passionate cook who specialized in Creole and Cajun cuisine. He loved his recipes so much he decided to share them with the world by opening his own restaurant. Unfortunately he was not able to see his dream come true as his life was tragically taken weeks prior to opening. In his memory we’ve made it our own mission to carry on his legacy. Peto’s PoBoys guarantees the authentic, flavorful, and delicious tastes of New Orleans with Peto’s original style and ingredients. Our goal is to build a Brand in our fathers name that would make him proud. We promise to bring forth the best possible effort to complete our dads dream and live the dream he left for us. We are our fathers sons, we are New Orleans, we are Peto’s Po boys.

story:
Coffeehouse and Bakery

My name is Jeremy McMaster. Since 2009 my wife and I have been the owners and operators of Teahouse of the Mullah Nasrudin's Donkey LLC. I roast coffee at my home and sell it online and we participate annually at the Great Dickens Christmas Fair by operating our coffee business there under the name "Mr. Browns Fine Coffee and Teas". Since the beginning of the pandemic I have been selling baked goods from my home kitchen.

What We Need & What You Get

Currently I am baking from my home. I would need funding to not only pay a lease to have a place but I also need to equip it with convection ovens, counters, a standing floor mixer, refrigeration, ventilation, an espresso machine, small wares, furniture, start-up funding.

This is not going to be cheap. I believe I will need close to $75,000 to obtain a location (I am looking in the Bay Area for former restaurants), purchase equipment, obtain permits, decorate and become ready for customers.

Our goal is to have a nice place where I can produce my wares and folks can either get their morning coffee and/or chai with a baked good or enjoy acoustic music or gaming or recite poetry or just hang out in the evening/ night.

The Impact

Your contribution is very important, no matter the size. Every little bit helps. Perks are listed in the perks section. This will take some time. 

Risks & Challenges

A bakery isn't the most profitable venture. I enjoy running coffeehouse and bake shop. It is not going to be easy.  Most restaurants fail in the first few years, but I believe that we will not be one of those places. Not only do I roast great coffee but my baked goods are fantastic. I am thinking of using the name "Prof. Norton's Bake Shop"

Other Ways You Can Help

You can help by sharing this campaign with your friends, coworkers, and family.

Thank you very much.

story:
Greetings everyone!

I'm Victoria Mattox and my family and I reside in Fresno, California. We are a Nigerian family that truly appreciates the amazing culture, including the cuisine which is absolutely tasty! My mother Philomina, is a master chef and she is inspired by her grandmother who owned a restaurant in bustling city of Lagos in Nigeria. Her grandmother co-managed a farm with her husband which produced the rich, organic produce that she used to prepare her recipes in the restaurant. Her grandmother's restaurant never experienced a dull moment as it was always filled with smiling faces, attractive aromas, and laughter that could be heard from the outside of the restaurant! She remembers it as being a very warm place and one where everyone gathered after a long day to relax and enjoy good cuisine. My mother had the pleasure of being able to learn cooking skills and mastered her preparation techniques while spending time in the restaurant during the summer breaks within her college years. 

The purpose of this campaign is to introduce our restaurant concept: Organic Nigerian and Caribbean cuisine and to raise start-up funding that will be a significant resource as we remain on our course to introduce Nigerian and Caribbean cuisine in Fresno, California. We are very fortunate to be in Fresno as this city is leading in agricultural production and supply and we have the opportunity to collaborate with local farmers that will provide us with organic produce to prepare our recipes. We appreciate the magnitude of population growth that Fresno has experienced, especially within the last 5 years. Fresno has become increasingly diverse and is a representer of various ethnic groups. Within the Central Valley, there are more than 300 Nigerian families. Nigerian food is scarce within the Central Valley which makes it is essential to include as an option amongst the many different cultures represented in cuisine choice. It's important to my family and I to provide this to the city and our hope is that it inspires other entrepreneurs to introduce the cuisine of their cultural background as well. We would love to see Fresno join other cities that have a robust representation of restaurants that serve Nigerian cuisine such as New York, Atlanta, Houston, and Los Angeles. 

The gathered contributions will help tremendously with our plans for construction and the ability for us to introduce small group seminars that will cover topics such as: Introduction to the Nigerian culture, Popular Nigerian cuisine, and How to dine Nigerian style. The ability to host after hour dance sessions with amazing music and an emphasis on West African dance is also something that we look forward to offering. We are hoping to create a warm, family like atmosphere that will not only encourage local Nigerians to visit the restaurant but also every resident in the Central Valley and beyond. We are very excited to be able to embark on such a journey that will create life long memories for us and our Central Valley families. 

Our goal is to raise $100,000 and this will go towards costs associated with supplies, equipment, contractor and architect fees, construction and remodeling, advertisement, and costs associated with conducting live classes and seminars in the restaurant. Upon consultation, we have learned that supplies and equipment will cost approximately $70,000, while construction and associated fees will cost an additional $90,000. If we happen to not reach our monetary goal, the funding raised will go to construction and then equipment, respectively. We do understand the many challenges that one may encounter while opening a new business and we are closely tied with a local business mentor and the small business administration program in Fresno. 

The impact that this project and the restaurant may have on the Central Valley population is notable as we consider the ongoing goal to increase access to healthy, organic food. Our cuisine will be included as an option for organic cuisine, further aiding in the good health our population. Thank you all for taking the time to read our story and we appreciate all of your contributions! Please spread the word and link to family and friends! We hope to see you all in the restaurant very soon! Take good care and many blessings to you. 

Victoria Mattox

story:
(Turn on subtitles if your Spanish is a little rusty! Used with permission from the filmmaker)

dig·ni·ty /ˈdiɡnədē / noun

the state or quality of being worthy of honour or respect. a sense of pride in oneself; self-respect.

Our purpose is to build lives with dignity. Full stop. Everything else is just steps in between.

One of the cacaoteros in the Santander region of Colombia, with C4P Executive Director Sergio Figueredo

this isn't just chocolate, this is a movement.

What if I told you that the reason much of the chocolate we eat is so cheap is directly related to child slavery in Africa and cocaine production in Colombia?

Choco4Peace works to enable vulnerable Colombian farmers to improve their lives by finding markets for their chocolate-producing cacao, allowing them to escape poverty and conflict. Our social enterprise supports constructing and sustaining peace by generating positive socioeconomic and environmental outcomes in post-conflict regions through the empowerment of women, youth, indigenous and other at-risk people in the cacao sectors by providing access to markets, capacity building, and disruptive technologies.

Raw cacao: this is what your chocolate looks like at the beginning of its journey

what's the problem?

There are over 38,000 cacao farmers in Colombia, and over 70% of them live below the poverty line (less than $2 USD/day). These farmers face the awful dilemma of either farming crops like cacao in poverty or returning to cocaine production as a means of survival.

We need your support to show the world that we can prevent future armed conflicts and cocaine production.

Check out this video by Vice about why the war on drugs is failing:

Tumaco is a town on the Pacific coast of Colombia, which in addition to having 80% poverty rate and 74% unemployment rate, it is also the largest coca producing region in the world. We are working with a group of courageous farmers in Tumaco who have successfully made the transition to growing cacao. Nevertheless, they are at risk of falling back into dangerous cocaine production because they don’t have access to markets, fair prices, technology, and other services.

what are we doing?

We start by connecting farmers with chocolate makers who will pay them fair prices for their cacao. This increases their revenue above what they would make cultivating coca.

Next, we give them access to technology, using an application we have designed that will allow you to trace not only the origin of the cacao in your chocolate, but also the socioeconomic and environmental impacts of your chocolate consumption. This application is designed to create traceability and transparency in the value chain, which will allow farmers to grow their enterprises, and build a life with dignity.  It gets nerdy fast, so if you want to know more about how this whole thing works, check out our website, or get in touch and we'd be happy to tell you all about it!

what your contribution will do

It sounds straightforward, but we'll be producing the chocolate you're looking for. That takes a lot of coordination.

We have spent the last two years building the right partnerships, not only so you can feed your chocolate addiction, but really so that we can allow you to trace and measure the impact of your dollars (Euros, Pesos, Shekels...).

Your cacao will travel on a long journey before it gets to your sweet faces. It has to be harvested, fermented, dried, sorted, tested, inspected, shipped around the world, sorted again, tested again, shelled, ground, liquefied, aged, tested again, set into molds, labeled - and THEN we can send it to you.

Phew!

Goal 1: Access to market for 50 families - $25,000

This money will enable us to set up the infrastructure to support approximately 50 families to import 1 tonne of their cacao to Montreal, Canada, and for our chocolate maker partner to transform it into chocolate just for you!

Goal 2: Access to technology - $75,000

In collaboration with our partners, we have designed a modular application that will allow us to trace the cacao along its journey to be transformed into chocolate. This application will enable you to trace not only the origin of the cacao, but also the socioeconomic and environmental impacts this chocolate has, and build greater transparency and trust within the chocolate ecosystem. With another $50k, we will be able to build the first two modules of this application.

Goal 3: Scaling up - $125,000

As we mentioned, there are a lot of cacao farmers in Colombia. The higher your demand for ethical chocolate, the more reason farmers have to keep growin' the beans! So far, we have agreements with 7 cacao cooperatives in 4 regions of the country representing about 1000 farmers. How sweet is that?!

who are we?

(Some of) the choco crew!

We're a bunch of international development geeks, economists, business people, ethicists, designers, communicators, polyglots, and chocolate lovers. You can check out our full kick-butt team on our shiny new website!

We align and measure our work with six of the UN Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs). Check out how on our website.

Founder and Executive Director | Sergio Figueredo has more than 8 years of experience in business development, investment management working for financial service providers (FSPs), non-profits, development finance institutions (DFIs) and NGOs. While studying at the University of Colorado at Boulder, Sergio managed the business accounts for TCF Bank and later on, he joined JP Morgan Chase to assist high-net-worth clients to determine investment needs. His interest in sustainable development and social investments inspired him to work with different NGO’s including ANED, a DFI in Bolivia where he was in charge of research and development from micro-finance programs aiming to improve the quality of life of low-income families by empowering women.

Later on, Sergio directed the development of an online financial matchmaking platform, AXiiS (Access and eXchange for Impact Investment and Sustainability) that connects Financial Service Providers (FSP) with investment-ready Small & Medium Enterprises (SMEs). After the successful launch, AXiiS reached with 6.4 billion USD worth of FSP’s assets under management and SMEs in over 20 countries throughout Latin America, the Caribbean, and Africa, Sergio focused on developing institutional partnerships with international investors, governments, and NGOs.

Further, in collaboration with Alianza Cacao, Sergio was responsible for the finance component of an effort to reactivate the cacao sector in El Salvador, build local capacity and support cocoa SMEs to be credit-ready and be matched with FSPs through AXiiS.

join us in showing the world how sweet is chocolate for peace...

Thank you for your support. It matters.

Here are some of the others who are supporting us on our journey so far:

 

Former and current presidents have given their endorsement for the project. Click this image to learn more about Colombia's interest in disruptive technology

Chocolate makers, technology companies, UN and government agencies, crop insurance companies, trade organizations, family offices, and the anti-narcotics special forces of Colombia.

Topl - our disruptive technology partner

Our growing network of partners

Risks and challenges

The biggest challenge in getting you your chocolate, honestly, will be if we try to ship it to you in the summer. It will probably just melt in the mail, and that will make us all sad.

We live in Canada though, and it's frigid at least half the year. That's a better time to get it to you. After all, you'd probably rather we spend your money on supporting farmers, instead of freezer packs for your chocolate, right? How do you feel about holding off until, say, September?

Obviously, it's also risky working in Colombia. Tumaco is still a dangerous part of the country, and travel there is not without risks. But, we have the support of the United Nations, who keep us safe when we go.

Moreover, the peace accord negotiated in 2016 is fragile. When the FARC demobilized, other illegal armed groups moved in to fill the vacuum. And the peace transition process is long and complex. There is still a chance the deal could fail. But there are a LOT of smart, dedicated people working on this problem. We have the opportunity to build a movement to support this process. That starts with making sure farmers have lives with dignity so they don't return to illegal activity.

Join us; #ElCacaoSoyYo

 

--

 

Dignidad

Cualidad del que se hace valer como persona, se comporta con responsabilidad, seriedad y con respeto hacia sí mismo y hacia los demás.

Nuestro propósito es construir vidas con dignidad. Nada más. Todo lo demás son pasos intermedios.

(Uno de los cacaoteros en la región de Santander, Colombia, con el Director Ejecutivo de C4P, Sergio Figueredo.​)

Esto no es solo chocolate, esto es un movimiento..

"¿Qué pasaría si te dijera que la mayor parte del chocolate que comemos, que es tan barato, está directamente relacionado con la esclavitud infantil en África y la producción de cocaína en Colombia? "

Choco4Peace trabaja para que los agricultores colombianos puedan mejorar sus vidas al encontrar mercados para su producción de cacao, esto les permite escapar de la pobreza y de situaciones de conflicto. Nuestra empresa social apoya a la construcción y al mantenimiento de la paz a partir de la generación de resultados socioeconómicos y medioambientales positivos en las regiones de pos-conflicto a través del empoderamiento de las mujeres, los jóvenes, las comunidades indígenas y otros actores del sector del cacao, brindando acceso a mercados, al desarrollo de capacidades y a la utilización de nuevas tecnologías.

(Cacao crudo- fruta: así es como se ve tu chocolate al inicio)

Cual es el problema?

Hay más de 38,000 productores de cacao en Colombia, de los cuales, más del 70% de viven por debajo del umbral de la pobreza (menos de $ 2 USD al día). Estos agricultores enfrentan el terrible dilema de seguir cultivando cacao en condiciones de pobreza o de involucrarse en el cultivo y producción de cocaína como medio de supervivencia.

Necesitamos tu apoyo para demostrarle al mundo que podemos trabajar para prevenir futuros conflictos armados y desincentivar la producción de cocaína.

Echa un vistazo a este video para entender por qué está fallando la guerra contra las drogas:

Tumaco es una ciudad ubicada en la costa pacífica de Colombia, que además de tener una tasa de pobreza del 80% y una tasa de desempleo del 74%, también es la región productora de coca más grande del mundo. Estamos trabajando con un grupo de valerosos agricultores en Tumaco que han hecho con éxito la transición al cultivo de cacao. Sin embargo, estos productores siguen en peligro de volver a caer en la peligrosa producción de cocaína porque aún les falta apoyo para el acceso a mercados, precios justos, tecnología y otros servicios.

Que estamos haciendo?

Comenzamos conectando a los agricultores con fabricantes de chocolate que les pagarán precios justos por su cacao. Esto aumenta sus ingresos por encima de lo que harían cultivando coca.

A continuación, les damos acceso a la tecnología, mediante una aplicación que hemos diseñado y que te permitirá rastrear no solo el origen del cacao en tu barra de chocolate, sino también te hará saber los impactos socioeconómicos y ambientales derivados de tu compra. Esta aplicación está diseñada para crear trazabilidad y transparencia en la cadena de valor, lo que permitirá a los agricultores hacer crecer sus empresas y construir una vida digna. Sabemos que es un poco complicado, pero si quieres saber más sobre cómo funciona todo esto, te invitamos a visitar nuestro sitio web o a contáctarnos. Estaremos encantados de contártelo todo!

¿Qué logrará tu contribución?

Parece sencillo, pero producir el chocolate que siempre has querido probar requiere mucha coordinación!

Hemos pasado los últimos dos años buscando y logrando las conexiones correctas,no solo para que puedas alimentar tu adicción al chocolate, sino también para que puedas rastrear y medir el impacto de tus pesos (euros, dolares, shekels ...).

El cacao hará un largo viaje antes de llegar a tus manos. Deberá ser cosechado, fermentado, secado, clasificado, probado, inspeccionado, enviado alrededor del mundo, clasificado nuevamente, probado nuevamente, molido, licuado, probado nuevamente, moldeado, etiquetado - y DESPUES estará listo para ser enviado.

Ufff!

Meta 1: Acceso al mercado para 50 familias - $ 25,000 US

Este dinero nos permitirá configurar la infraestructura para que aproximadamente 50 familias,  productoras de cacao colombianas, importen 1 tonelada de su cacao a Montreal, Canadá, y para que nuestro chocolatero aliado lo transforme en delicioso chocolate.​

Meta 2: Acceso a la tecnología - $ 75,000 US

En colaboración con nuestros socios, hemos diseñado una aplicación modular que nos permitirá rastrear el cacao a lo largo de su viaje para transformarlo en chocolate. Esta aplicación le permitirá rastrear no solo el origen del cacao, sino también los impactos socioeconómicos y medioambientales que tiene este chocolate. Con esto, logramos construir una mayor transparencia y confianza dentro del ecosistema del chocolate. Con otros $ 50,000, podremos construir los dos primeros módulos de esta aplicación.

Meta 3: Escalar - $ 125,000

Como te mencionamos, hay muchos productores de cacao en Colombia. Cuanto mayor sea tu consumo de chocolate ético, mayor será la razón por la cual los agricultores seguirán cultivando este cacao! Hasta ahora, tenemos acuerdos con 7 cooperativas de cacao en 4 regiones del país, estas cooperativas representan aproximadamente 1000 agricultores. ¡Qué te parece eso!

Quienes somos?

(Algunos miembros del choco-team!)

Somos un grupo de apasionados por el desarrollo internacional, economistas, empresarios, diseñadores, comunicadores, políglotas y amantes del chocolate. ¡Puedes ver nuestro equipo completo en nuestro nuevo pagina web.

Alineamos y medimos nuestro trabajo con seis de los Objetivos de Desarrollo Sostenible (ODS) establecidos por las Naciones Unidas. Echa un vistazo en nuestro sitio web.

Fundador y Director Ejecutivo |

Sergio Figueredo tiene más de 8 años de experiencia en desarrollo de negocios y gestión de inversiones. Ha trabajado para proveedores de servicios financieros (PSFs), organizaciones sin fines de lucro, instituciones financieras de desarrollo (DFI) y organizaciones no gubernamentales. Mientras estudiaba en la Universidad de Colorado en Boulder, Sergio administró las cuentas comerciales de TCF Bank y más tarde, se unió a JP Morgan Chase para ayudar a determinar las necesidades de inversión de sus clientes. Su interés en el desarrollo sostenible y las inversiones sociales lo inspiraron a trabajar con diferentes ONG, incluida ANED, una institución financiera de desarrollo en Bolivia, donde estuvo a cargo de la investigación y del desarrollo de programas de microfinanzas, con el objetivo de mejorar la calidad de vida de las familias de bajos ingresos mediante el empoderamiento de la mujer.

Posteriormente, Sergio dirigió el desarrollo de una plataforma financiera en línea, AXiiS (Access and eXchange for Impact Investment and Sustainability) que conecta a los proveedores de servicios financieros (PSF) con pequeñas y medianas empresas (PyMEs) listas para invertir. Después de su exitoso lanzamiento, AXiiS alcanzó un valor en inversiones por más de 6.400 millones de dólares en activos bajo gestión y pymes en más de 20 países de América Latina, el Caribe y África. Sergio se centró en desarrollar asociaciones institucionales con inversionistas internacionales, gobiernos y ONGs.

Además, en colaboración con Alianza Cacao, Sergio fue responsable del componente financiero de un esfuerzo por reactivar el sector del cacao en El Salvador, desarrollar la capacidad local y respaldar a las pymes del sector del cacao para que estén listas para el acceso al financiamiento y ser vinculadas con proveedores de servicios financieros a través de la plataforma AXiiS.

únete a nosotros para mostrarle al mundo lo dulce que es el chocolate para la paz ...

Gracias por tu apoyo. Es muy importante.

Aquí tenemos algunas personas que nos han apoyado en nuestra travesía :

 

 

Presidentes anteriores y actuales han dado su apoyo al proyecto. Haz clic en esta imagen para obtener más información sobre el interés de Colombia en la tecnología disruptiva!​

Fabricantes de chocolate, compañías de tecnología, agencias de las Naciones Unidas y agencias gubernamentales, compañías de seguros, organizaciones comerciales, oficinas familiares y las fuerzas especiales antinarcóticos de Colombia.

Nuestra creciente red de socios.

Riesgos y retos.

El mayor desafío para conseguir tu chocolate, honestamente, será si tratamos de enviártelo en verano. Probablemente se derretirá en el camino, y eso no es una buena noticia.

Vivimos en Canadá, y hace frío al menos la mitad del año. Ese sería un mejor momento para enviar tu chocolate. Después de todo, probablemente tu preferirías que gastemos el dinero apoyando a los agricultores, en lugar de comprar paquetes congelados para el chocolate, ¿cierto? ¿Qué tal si esperas solo un poco, digamos, hasta septiembre?  :)

También, trabajar en las zonas cacaoteras de Colombia es un poco riesgoso. Tumaco sigue siendo una parte peligrosa del país, y viajar allí no está exento de riesgos. Sin embargo, contamos con el apoyo de las Naciones Unidas, que nos mantienen seguros cuando visitamos a los productores.

Además, las condiciones después del acuerdo de paz negociado en 2016 sigue siendo frágiles. Cuando las FARC se desmovilizaron, otros grupos armados ilegales llegaron para llenar el vacío. Como sabemos, el proceso de transición a la paz es largo y complejo. Todavía hay una posibilidad que el trato pueda fallar. Sin embargo, hay MUCHAS personas inteligentes y dedicadas que trabajan para mantener la paz.

Tenemos la oportunidad de construir un movimiento para apoyar este proceso. Y eso comienza en el momento en el que aseguramos que los agricultores tengan oportunidades para una vida digna y cuando no permitimos que regresen o ingresen a una actividad ilegal.

Unete; #El Cacao Soy Yo

(Turn on subtitles if your Spanish is a little rusty! Used with permission from the filmmaker)
dig·ni·ty /ˈdiɡnədē / nounthe state or quality of being worthy of honour or respect. a sense of pride in oneself; self-respect.Our purpose is to build lives with dignity. Full stop. Everything else is just steps in between.One of the cacaoteros in the Santander region of Colombia, with C4P Executive Director Sergio Figueredothis isn't just chocolate, this is a movement.What if I told you that the reason much of the chocolate we eat is so cheap is directly related to child slavery in Africa and cocaine production in Colombia?Choco4Peace works to enable vulnerable Colombian farmers to improve their lives by finding markets for their chocolate-producing cacao, allowing them to escape poverty and conflict. Our social enterprise supports constructing and sustaining peace by generating positive socioeconomic and environmental outcomes in post-conflict regions through the empowerment of women, youth, indigenous and other at-risk people in the cacao sectors by providing access to markets, capacity building, and disruptive technologies.Raw cacao: this is what your chocolate looks like at the beginning of its journeywhat's the problem?There are over 38,000 cacao farmers in Colombia, and over 70% of them live below the poverty line (less than $2 USD/day). These farmers face the awful dilemma of either farming crops like cacao in poverty or returning to cocaine production as a means of survival.We need your support to show the world that we can prevent future armed conflicts and cocaine production.Check out this video by Vice about why the war on drugs is failing:Tumaco is a town on the Pacific coast of Colombia, which in addition to having 80% poverty rate and 74% unemployment rate, it is also the largest coca producing region in the world. We are working with a group of courageous farmers in Tumaco who have successfully made the transition to growing cacao. Nevertheless, they are at risk of falling back into dangerous cocaine production because they don’t have access to markets, fair prices, technology, and other services.what are we doing?We start by connecting farmers with chocolate makers who will pay them fair prices for their cacao. This increases their revenue above what they would make cultivating coca.Next, we give them access to technology, using an application we have designed that will allow you to trace not only the origin of the cacao in your chocolate, but also the socioeconomic and environmental impacts of your chocolate consumption. This application is designed to create traceability and transparency in the value chain, which will allow farmers to grow their enterprises, and build a life with dignity.  It gets nerdy fast, so if you want to know more about how this whole thing works, check out our website, or get in touch and we'd be happy to tell you all about it!what your contribution will doIt sounds straightforward, but we'll be producing the chocolate you're looking for. That takes a lot of coordination.We have spent the last two years building the right partnerships, not only so you can feed your chocolate addiction, but really so that we can allow you to trace and measure the impact of your dollars (Euros, Pesos, Shekels...).Your cacao will travel on a long journey before it gets to your sweet faces. It has to be harvested, fermented, dried, sorted, tested, inspected, shipped around the world, sorted again, tested again, shelled, ground, liquefied, aged, tested again, set into molds, labeled - and THEN we can send it to you.Phew!Goal 1: Access to market for 50 families - $25,000This money will enable us to set up the infrastructure to support approximately 50 families to import 1 tonne of their cacao to Montreal, Canada, and for our chocolate maker partner to transform it into chocolate just for you!Goal 2: Access to technology - $75,000In collaboration with our partners, we have designed a modular application that will allow us to trace the cacao along its journey to be transformed into chocolate. This application will enable you to trace not only the origin of the cacao, but also the socioeconomic and environmental impacts this chocolate has, and build greater transparency and trust within the chocolate ecosystem. With another $50k, we will be able to build the first two modules of this application.Goal 3: Scaling up - $125,000As we mentioned, there are a lot of cacao farmers in Colombia. The higher your demand for ethical chocolate, the more reason farmers have to keep growin' the beans! So far, we have agreements with 7 cacao cooperatives in 4 regions of the country representing about 1000 farmers. How sweet is that?!who are we?(Some of) the choco crew!We're a bunch of international development geeks, economists, business people, ethicists, designers, communicators, polyglots, and chocolate lovers. You can check out our full kick-butt team on our shiny new website!We align and measure our work with six of the UN Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs). Check out how on our website.Founder and Executive Director | Sergio Figueredo has more than 8 years of experience in business development, investment management working for financial service providers (FSPs), non-profits, development finance institutions (DFIs) and NGOs. While studying at the University of Colorado at Boulder, Sergio managed the business accounts for TCF Bank and later on, he joined JP Morgan Chase to assist high-net-worth clients to determine investment needs. His interest in sustainable development and social investments inspired him to work with different NGO’s including ANED, a DFI in Bolivia where he was in charge of research and development from micro-finance programs aiming to improve the quality of life of low-income families by empowering women.Later on, Sergio directed the development of an online financial matchmaking platform, AXiiS (Access and eXchange for Impact Investment and Sustainability) that connects Financial Service Providers (FSP) with investment-ready Small & Medium Enterprises (SMEs). After the successful launch, AXiiS reached with 6.4 billion USD worth of FSP’s assets under management and SMEs in over 20 countries throughout Latin America, the Caribbean, and Africa, Sergio focused on developing institutional partnerships with international investors, governments, and NGOs.Further, in collaboration with Alianza Cacao, Sergio was responsible for the finance component of an effort to reactivate the cacao sector in El Salvador, build local capacity and support cocoa SMEs to be credit-ready and be matched with FSPs through AXiiS.join us in showing the world how sweet is chocolate for peace...Thank you for your support. It matters.Here are some of the others who are supporting us on our journey so far: Former and current presidents have given their endorsement for the project. Click this image to learn more about Colombia's interest in disruptive technologyChocolate makers, technology companies, UN and government agencies, crop insurance companies, trade organizations, family offices, and the anti-narcotics special forces of Colombia.Topl - our disruptive technology partnerOur growing network of partnersRisks and challengesThe biggest challenge in getting you your chocolate, honestly, will be if we try to ship it to you in the summer. It will probably just melt in the mail, and that will make us all sad.We live in Canada though, and it's frigid at least half the year. That's a better time to get it to you. After all, you'd probably rather we spend your money on supporting farmers, instead of freezer packs for your chocolate, right? How do you feel about holding off until, say, September?Obviously, it's also risky working in Colombia. Tumaco is still a dangerous part of the country, and travel there is not without risks. But, we have the support of the United Nations, who keep us safe when we go.Moreover, the peace accord negotiated in 2016 is fragile. When the FARC demobilized, other illegal armed groups moved in to fill the vacuum. And the peace transition process is long and complex. There is still a chance the deal could fail. But there are a LOT of smart, dedicated people working on this problem. We have the opportunity to build a movement to support this process. That starts with making sure farmers have lives with dignity so they don't return to illegal activity.Join us; #ElCacaoSoyYo -- DignidadCualidad del que se hace valer como persona, se comporta con responsabilidad, seriedad y con respeto hacia sí mismo y hacia los demás.Nuestro propósito es construir vidas con dignidad. Nada más. Todo lo demás son pasos intermedios.(Uno de los cacaoteros en la región de Santander, Colombia, con el Director Ejecutivo de C4P, Sergio Figueredo.​)Esto no es solo chocolate, esto es un movimiento.."¿Qué pasaría si te dijera que la mayor parte del chocolate que comemos, que es tan barato, está directamente relacionado con la esclavitud infantil en África y la producción de cocaína en Colombia? "Choco4Peace trabaja para que los agricultores colombianos puedan mejorar sus vidas al encontrar mercados para su producción de cacao, esto les permite escapar de la pobreza y de situaciones de conflicto.
